szJCAYjceT__HrM_Dq_aGw.text: ok so I've only been here once but I'm already in love. We found this place w/ the Entertainment guide book. (and Yelp of course)   LOVE at first sight. The place is so cute and they have the greek music in the bkground so you feel like you're on the set of that wedding movie.   I ordered the souvlaki mini. Perfect for me. mini greek salad, a skewer of chicken, skewer of steak, rice, pita bread, that yogurt sauce and lemon.  I'd order that again in a heartbeat.   My bf went w/ the super lemon chicken pita sandwhich and it was to die for. I loved it. even just the one bite, I'd drive all the way bk from Henderson /Green Valley just to order that.   After reading the reviews the only thing we knew for sure was we were going to order the greek fries. eh. that was the lowest rated item I tried. Nxt time I go I'll get the lemon pita and a baklava.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JUVFsBu6rUQYgQKaZWjPEQ.text: The food here is delicious. I've ordered everything, and it's simply fresh, great tasting food. Customer service is fantastic, even when they're busy. I think it's family owned and run, so go support a local business for a change. Oh, If they have rice pudding, get it, the simplest, tastiest dessert ever.

fxb1o21YxXXDuwGlxoYPZQ.text: Yassou is great for greek food!  Everything I've had there has a great flavor.  The meats are juicy and tender.  The salads are fresh and makes me feel like I'm eating healthy. I still have a few things I'd love to try on their menu like the spanakopita and dolmades.  I've had their "Big Fat Gyro" sandwich which has everything you need for a good lunch especially when I am limited on time.    The ambiance is lacking but the food more than makes up for it.  Everyone working there was super nice and the prices are reasonable.

kcRb9l8epleayw6h0zCw2w.text: I really like the clean atmosphere,everything tasted good, spanikopita was a bit dry, Greek fries were just ok and the big fat pita was not bad, but just kinda basic, the Sevier here was great very polite people, very fast, i just can't get past the basicness of the food nothing stood out as fantastic

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanikopita
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek fries
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My big fat pita

3Eiagl4SU9r2FZnbIU-Wiw.text: I absolutely love this place. And the ONLY reason they did not get 5 stars is because of the same small, simple thing that happens quite too often. I eat here AT LEAST twice a month of not more (sometimes once a wk)  and I pay EXTRA for extra sauce, and 85% of the time my EXTRA sauce that I PAID for is missing. It's already bad if an eatery forgets the sauce that comes with your meal, but for a sauce that is PAID for by yourself wether if it's 50 cents or $5, you, we, PAID for it. Please don't leave that out!!! I'm such a pushover and HATE complaining and esp over a $1 sauce. But hey, that's A DOLLAR (or whatever the amount is.) Other than that, the food is amazing and soooo good that I choose to come back. Plus I tried quite a few other Greek places and they are not nearly as good as here. I just wish they'd be a little more attentive to these "small" big things

zyuDxv3PTBS6_-SV_zX8eg.text: My experience there was very nice. The company that I work for rented space for a celebration. The people that work there accommodated our needs, and were very friendly.  The thing that caught my attention was that this was a catered event but, they still were kind enough to take orders of people that had dietary restrictions. It's a small cozy place, and I would go back! And of course the food was great!

-priRrfpCoW6m6bMFV7uqg.text: Hubs took me here for lunch with our little one.  I'm not all that familiar with Greek food, but after this, I can say I'm a fan.  I have eaten at another Greek place on the other side of town and that was good, this place it's even a wee bit better.    Since I had eaten prior to our lunch date, I told my husband that I would just share with him.  We shared a Gyro plate and baklava.  This plate was full enough for the both of us.  Lots of lamb and beef.  It comes with pita, rice, and greens.  The beef skewers had four large cube pieces and it was not over cooked, it was cooked medium well, just the way I like it.  Service was fabulous and as a matter of fact it was one the workers b-day, I think it was Mary.  Anyhow, if on this dude of town, this place has some really good, healthy grinds!

dX_A56DybgUQaRnLfrzaXg.text: Stopped in as we were passing through the area - so glad  we did. Best Gyros ever! Meat was very tender and flavorful. Soup was fantastic. Baklava was wonderful - not overly sweet, savory and flavorful.  We will be back!

V0im3GKzrhe1rVgiH1z_OA.text: My husband introduced this place to me and I fell in love with it! After a few more times of coming here I brought my co-workers for lunch and they enjoyed it as well. I always get the lunch chicken special which comes with rice and salad. Tonight I tried the chicken gyro which was also really good. We also got to speak to the owner during this visit and he spent at least 15 minutes talking to us about how he got started in the business. Absolute pleasure to speak with! I would say we come about twice a month and have always had a wonderful experience. I really pay attention to customer service and this place has great staff!

JparU0E2BmvrvovCzRpidA.text: I love me some Greek. I had just moved to Vegas and was looking for a good Greek place. I think I have tried them all. Only Yassou's was worth my time to sit down and write a review. I haven't had anything there that wasn't amazing. I go at least once a week and every new person I bring there loves it. So glad I found this place. Try it. You won't be disappointed.   FYI the Super Lemon Herb Chicken Pita is nothing short of magic.

Y9yaZBPZ2UAk1fMNfHFE8Q.text: This place feels so authentic. The service was great and the food was plenty. One meal was enough for my husband and I didn't realize how close it was to our house. We ordered the slouvaki combo and the meat was so tender and juicy. The salad was awesome and the bread was fresh. We got a side order of Parmesan covered fries and it was to die for. Will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KDwleHYXEPRExM01IDXq0A.text: The food is good however, I took my out of town family there and we wanted to order a Gyro  filled with just lamb and the proprietor said they cannot fulfill that request. The Gyro has to be   mixed with beef. I did not understand what the big deal was, It is a Greek restaurant and   Gyros are usually filled with Lamb. A good restaurant should accommodate its customers  Because we pay the bills. I decided not to ever return and not give Yassou my business.

_cxPG9n9EiguGo85e8eh1Q.text: My go to spot for Greek! Service is always 1000% Owner is on location so that's nice.  The meat is just perfect and is made with care. Juicy and tasty ALWAYS.  The yogurt sauce is amazing but they make you pay for extra in those little plastic cups. ( so that kinda sucks) but I pay eat. Eat it. Then come back for more always. :-)  I also bring all my friends to introduce them to the best Greek that I've found.  So check it out! You won't be sorry!

jSKzeozPFKREzQf5___3sQ.text: Very underwhelming and thought the food was going to be a lot better due to their amount of great reviews. The food was just alright.

RLYniF65ZlI4jj2QFc4rQg.text: I had the chicken kebab plate. Plenty of chicken (2 skewers) the rice and were also very delicious. I will be back!

7vA8hFPCi98EdC1UAvmudA.text: My husband and I first discovered this Yassou through the entertainment guide. I started my order with the Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves) for $5.99. They serve them with a thick lemony sauce on top. It is different from how my mom makes it but it still tastes pretty good. I chose the Steak Souvlaki plate as my main entree ($10.99). The steak kabobs were excellent ! They are marinated in lemon and herbs. It is served with rice and a fresh salad. The rice has a lemony flavor to it. I liked this place so much I took my brother here because he always craves this type of cuisine. He also loves the food here !

Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dolmades

9fyrDPeCxgXQ5yX6otinOA.text: Once you walk in, someone greets you. It seems like a family run business. The father I think does the cooking. I ordered the gyro combo and my bf ordered the steak souvlaki plate. The gyro was delicious. The meat was tender and flavorful. The steak souvlaki was so juicy, flavorful and tender. It almost melts in your mouth. The pilaf rice was delicious. I live how I can taste the spices in everything. I will definitely come back to try the infamous Greek fries. The added plus is that everyone is incredibly nice and service is on point.

RjO-NJstPnIwxwoNNO0lrA.text: Holy shit this place was delicious and Chris the owner was a super cool dude too. Definitely five stars on the service food and cleanliness. They have inside and outside dining

yartV78JYtQguRqMmWV4kQ.text: Food is great- I recommend getting your food to go- LARGER PORTIONS! Always very fast, exceptional customer service and foodies very tasty!

McBsERaCWZ7RBD4frDwv5w.text: My favorite place to go!!! Family owned and very authentic Greek food. The staff is always kind. Things I've tried on their menu: Mediterranean cheese pizza, spanikopita, big fat gyros, Greek fries, yellow rice, the salads, fruit smoothies  and the lemon herb chicken....it's all delicious!!! The chicken was juicy and very flavorful. The gyros are the stuffed with meat and toppings. I've dined it and ordered for pick up and it's never been disappointing.

9cjCpeLTliWQkyzhBuQ5dg.text: I would of gave it more stars the reason why is because they should of stayed open later than 8:00pm!! Why not 9pm or 10pm?? They are making money why not stay open much later!!

m87ZttNLIbQT3Yjk_7z1Lw.text: Very good :) the steak and chicken are perfectly marinated.  Pita was the only disappointment, it just wasn't the best.  Otherwise, it was great

loUsEOq99mTQmSfdhkByNw.text: I just ate at this restaurant. I had the Greek salad with gyro meat which was excellent. What I really enjoyed about the restaurant is in addition to good food, there's a very pretty patio to sit outside. We were lucky to have great weather so it was a very enjoyable experience. The owner came by and spoke to us and was very friendly. All in all its going to be a very refreshing new place to go to.  I really enjoyed it.

ksq9257QE-tJDVUONawIXg.text: Amazing Greek food in Las Vegas it is far away from the strip but the drive is totally worth it

dfQe20rzEq1NbGvqbQTWmA.text: A very warm and friendly place, all the employees are so nice and always are so polite.  The food is so tasty, succulent tender chicken prepared with savory seasonings along with rice and "green" lettuce for your salad with a light oil, not the half green and yellow lettuce at some places. If your looking for "real" authentic Greek food, you have found eureka!

LKL6JXMwOdyEfwaQr2dF3g.text: Simply the best fast Greek food, and some of the best food overall, that I've had in my 49 years in Las Vegas.  'Nuff said. -- -- -- -- -- On the newly-established Nighthawk 100-point scale:  94.

5y9LItlyQYYZdI11XL0B9A.text: I have gone to Yassou Greek Grill twice now for lunch and both times it has been a top notch experience. First off their prices appeal to a heeb like me. You can get a huge gyro platter for under $10 bucks, it filled me up both times I have had it. You would be paying $15 or more at another Greek restaurant for a similar dish.   The title of Best Greek food I have had in Las Vegas is a toss up between Market Fresh Grille and Yassou Greek Grill Cafe. Both have been consistently high in quality and taste of the food. The variety of food on the menus will keep you going back for more. But the tie goes to Yassou because of the excellent economical pricing.

T5PsHUNpu0pnfsmHiFvPzg.text: Great place to meet after the sports park. Went with family and friends had gyros, chicken cababs, salad and hummus.pizza was a little dark but only on the edges. Hummus appetizer was nice fresh and served w toasted pita. Fast and made to order. Second time ead better than the first time we went.

_wxtGoID7SPERihMoPgvrw.text: I've been eating here since before Yelp! was even around (no seriously.)  And I love it.  For years I've come here on a weekly or so basis and gotten my to-go order for lunch at work.  I get the Veggie Kabob (Vegetarian here) but back in the day before I was a Vegetarian, I had the Steak Kabob - SO.  GOOD.  Also the Greek Fries are like heaven in your mouth.  I could eat them all day (and I do, and that's why I also have a gym membership.)  I also tend to order extra salad or rice when I go, because it's so good.  They have plenty of ample seating and a nice background noise of music, as well as a TV usually on during the day.    The staff is also really friendly.  I love to just go in there and chat with them while I wait for my food - they're caring and this is a great example of a family owned business that we need more of in Vegas.  (I know I've said it already: but TRY THE GREEK FRIES!)

VxXf8Xa6sAWUbqj1fQ1BTg.text: I will literally drive 8 hours down from Reno just to eat here. The best Greek food I've ever had!!

vjZfc-dywYLtzX571ClEgg.text: Pita and humus was really good!  I had the Athenian plate.  Lots of food. I was looking for a different Greek restaurant and was not disappointed.

Al6mSlN_xPsh9p50NgIJiQ.text: This place is absolutely my go to for Greek food.  I get the gyro plate which comes with rice, pita and salad.  They let me substitute my salad out for more pita, which I love.  The pita is always soft and the rice is so perfectly cooked and flavorful.  I've brought many people here with me and every single person has always wanted to come back again and again.  I highly recommend it.  My only complaint is that if you want to split a meal (because the portions are huge) with someone they charge you and additional dollar for a styrofoam plate and fork.

oWNwCXZ_5bv3QJAUH4ag6Q.text: BEST GREEK FOOD EVER!!! I go here quite often, and the customer service is always awesome, even when it's packed. The chicken pita with the greek fries are my go to. The atmosphere is really cool too. I wish I could give it six stars.

-ezwbvnw4adYo0S1rBbHcg.text: The quality of the food and the yumminess were right on point. However, the service was super slow and the gyros were really lacking on the meat portions. Unfortunately they drop from 5 stars to 3 for me.

AFLmXZr4nEuQOlNCumw01Q.text: They have the best Greek food ever!! Reasonable prices, I come here every couple weeks and the staff is great. I recommend this place to anyone who enjoy Greek food

edMARBxVgRHeCUrpEFHB_g.text: Hands down the greatest gyros I've ever had. I'm from NYC so I know what a quality gyro tastes like. That being said this is the only restaurant in Las Vegas that truly makes an amazing gyro with abundant amounts of quality meat full of amazing flavor and the price is just right!! Love this place!!

EsZNbNoM726auYa4Ame35A.text: great food, nice staff, clean place, pretty Greek decor, amazing gyros and reasonable too. love it! I'm not sure if the curly haired guy is the owner but he's very nice, always asking if we're doing ok or if the food is good. I believe I saw him catered at the recent Greek festival as well. overall, this is my main go to Greek restaurant.

THHHJePEnppKM6B5izUKvw.text: OMG! Being a Greek has its privileges. Understanding Yassous to be like Gramma's homemade Greek food is one of them. The Dolmades (warm with meat) are to die for. The only bad thing about Yassous, is trying to decide what I want each time. The Spanakopita, Moussaka, Pastitsio, or the Big Fat....awesome stuff!!

CJmfaXxTipSm7miQe2PDNw.text: Being greek I'm extremely picky about greek food. This place has some of the best gyros and tzaskiki that I have had in the states.  The greek fires are also pretty solid. If your in the mood for a gyro this would be the place to go.

bQwyyDRhXXJPYm5UHYu-KA.text: I frequent Yassou almost on a weekly basis.  This is the best GREEK food in town.   If you go for lunch, try to go before 12, otherwise, there is aways a line!  I prefer eating at places that have a line because that tells you the food is fresh and yummy.  They have a few awesome lunch specials.  You can even use a coupon from the Entertainment!  The chicken kabobs are the best/ If you like Gyros, order the big fat with feta and Greek fries.  They also have a lemony soup that's great for our weather now. YK

DIw8FnpZQH5eVou7G7YF1w.text: Came here while in Vegas. It was great! The gyro was tender and cooked perfectly. The chicken kabobs were delicious and the Greek salad was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend this place if you want good Greek food.

2TpmrU9YpLfHnwW-WlwFkQ.text: Lunchtime and feel like something new? One of my favorite places for some good Greek meets and salads! Authentically owned former food truck that prospered into this local icon due to it's amazing tastes and authenticity! You know when you're craving that one dish and nothing will take care of that craving unless you get "that dish from that place?" Well that's how I feel about my chicken lunch special here at Yassou. For under $10 bucks a lovely salad, rice. Pitas bread, humus and that lemon chicken skewer... see now I have to go myself,again. Best rice which is critical for this type of food but the succulent juicy lemon chicken, does not get more delicious. The owner and son will be there with a smile. Does get busy during that lunch time rush but has plenty of seating indoors and out. Feel free to call ahead with your order if you're short on time or looking for pick up. Service I wonderful and quick, but its not fast food, made to order so give yourself a few more mins.. just feel like I'm in Greece when I'm there so I enjoy to dine in. Wonderful large menu from Saganaki to the lighter side of salads.  Enjoy... and Yassou PLEASE FOLLOW ME AND ASK ME ABOUT ANY SPECIFIC SPOTS YOU'RE INTERESTED IN & WGAT IS THE OCCASION FOR THE DINING EXPERIENCE (first date, fun night out with friends, cheap and fun day out of towners)OR ANY RECOMMENDATIONS AND I'LL WRITE A REVIEW FOR YOU ON ANY PLACE AND ANY TYPE! OVER 70 COUNTRIES I KNOW HOW ITS "SUPPOSED" TO TASTE!... Just ask the local ;)

PQNJjnUvN2N0tUZnzR_tFg.text: Delicious food and excellent service! The gyro plate and baklava were so good. The employees were welcoming, friendly, and helpful. The service was quick and food was made just right. Good prices, great food and great service.

H0Yr9ZVWjo-TphHZgKlp7g.text: NEVER DISAPPOINTS! There has never been an item we've ordered here that we didn't like. Their gyro meat is amazing! The service is great! Their tzaziki sauce is the best. Something about their coke is great too! It's always crisp and just the right amount of fizziness!   We love this place!

MgycO9SqzjsMR-ElN_D3Ng.text: Love this place, great food, great service, and quick and can be healthy if you order right.

3EvRQII5OZyW_VZEvmrZJA.text: By far my favorite Greek place in town. The lemon chicken & gyro salad is so delicious and refreshing. My kid loves their pizza. My husband DESTROYS the Big Fat Gyro... sooo good. Hummus side is a must. Today I tried  the big fat and totally get why the hubs likes it so much. Their fries are bomb. Calamari plate is delicious. This place is one of our staples for lunch and dinner. The owner is so incredibly nice and authentic. He is always there and you can tell he takes such pride in the restaurant he has truly made AMAZING. We've probably been to this place 30 times over the years, and each time has been a wonderful experience. If you are a Vegas local and haven't gone... you are majorly missing out. Just sayin. We are BIG FANS if you couldn't tell.

jcICXZsuaj0OktfSIR7OGA.text: I got mini souvlaki for my lunch and Greek fries. My order came out nicely and the food was so delicious. I'll definitely come back again.

UN2M1b4EorlDtjwMCOqEgQ.text: They have been my go to place for gyros since I moved here in 2010.  But last couple of times seems like gyros are not as good (wilted lettuce, limp onions) and it takes at least 25 minutes to get one even though it's not that busy.  Already kind of pricey but then they charge extra for a small container of tzatziki sauce (which is very good BTW).

P2xi5RUy_vgtJj5ZDLxIlA.text: I came here 4 years ago, thought the gryo was too salty and otherwise average, and never returned.   Came back with a friend on a super busy lunch time on Friday. The hummus was good and seems house-made. They didn't have the red caviar for another dip on the menu I wanted to try. My friend like her Greek Salad.   I would give it 1 star for the dolmades if not for the above. Why is there meat in it?? The grape leaves were hard, old, and stringy/veiny. The dip that came with it was lemony-sour but also oily in a way that its yellow tallowed appearance reminded me of lard. And the texture was similar.   I'll stick with Meraki Grill.

8DI6Ec2ZO5-YeNtKy1WrhQ.text: Best Mausaka I ever had and I had a lot !! Fantastic staff. Wonderful service !   I will not go anywhere else

6rUv6PEPmA9O7hAQg0z1kA.text: What's not to love about homemade Greek food served with a smile in heaping portions at reasonable prices? Family owned and it shows in the consistently good service and quality. I'm a big fan of the Spanakopita (flaky pastry stuffed with spinach and feta cheese), the gyro meat and the lemon garlic chicken skewers. You can double up on salad to keep it healthy or comply with all the low carb diet needs. There is a cute outdoor patio and plenty of indoor seating. Limited parking is the only downside to this delicious lunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro and Spanakopits combo is great for those of is with indecisive minds.

uzyUP0VpQCn0LJE5HkpziA.text: Yummy Yummy Yummy! Never disappointed!  Always Fresh! Great food!!! Very clean & plenty of seating.

H_7fz1W1BgjiqDMrxOv7yg.text: We have been going to yassou weekly for about a year now! Always very good food and great service. Do yourself a favor and go get some delicious Greek food. We have tried almost every Mediterranean/Greek food in town. This is the best A+++++

CasBG-gar5X1l5YTtJig5w.text: I got the fried shrimp platter !! It wasn't on menu it was recommended to me by cashier! And omg it was so good ! I crave it sometimes It came with rice and salad!! The lemon sauce it came with was delicious and the Greek yogurt was also so good !!! I come here after my hair appointment since it's next door ! I love this place the fried shrimp is so bomb ! I can't wait to try the salmon next time !

YL7KBM14dZyoSl-pFToHhQ.text: Can't go wrong with this lunch spot it's fair prices and the kababs are very flavorful.

OoqgIZD13W1py-BrLtHpFA.text: I cannot get enough of this place, wish I lived closer! Reminds me of the authentic Greek food in Chicago where I am from. I have also been to Greece & seriously this is the best Greek food I have ever found in Vegas! Never a bad meal, the service is outstanding, everything fresh, hot & delicious. The quality of their ingredients and pride in their work really shines at this out of the way gem.

yzgsB5Nh_jOpSTxytGzaTQ.text: Awesome food, love their Souvlaki there. The salad was greasy. Rice pilaf was so flavorful. And everything else on the table was so good as well. Must try this place !!

q3CcVdGwI13se_Bqqcy2MQ.text: This place is soooo freaking goood!!!! I always get the chicken place, with rice, salad and pita bread. Can't go wrong with it, always very filling leaving leftovers for later. Just not a big fan of their beef. Call and pick it up because most of the time is busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite

ZHUEjZjqLS-91w3SQs74TQ.text: Super fresh yum food. Excellent service. Clean place. Cute outdoor patio seating. Totally recommend this place. Good prices and portions.

gBRX8c28_rKCmHnL7hzlzA.text: My family and I used to come to this restaurant regularly about 10 years ago. It always served excellent Greek food and today for Fathers Day we were in the mood for Greek and thought we'd revisit...only to be really disappointed.   The first thing we noticed was how dirty the floor in the dining area was and the bathroom's poor condition. One restroom was out of order and the other was disgusting, in the most literal sense. It smelled very strongly of urine (it was so intense it actually reminded me of cat urine ) and the floor was covered in dirty marks, paper towels and long hairs. I have no idea how so much hair has accumulated in a restaurant bathroom unless someone literally washed, blow dried and styled their hair in there. Additionally, the bathroom hardware was dirty, rusty and in pretty bad shape.  Next we ordered our food and were surprised not to see any actual Greek ppl behind the counter or on the line. We always felt like we had a genuinely Greek experience when we previously came as the person at the til and the cooks obviously had either a hand in ownership or had a personal connection to Greek culture and cuisine.   As for pricing, we were expecting it to be slightly overpriced, as good Greek food can be. If you aren't eating at Del Taco, you can't expect those prices. Unfortunately, Yassou's prices no longer represent the freshness or quality of the food. The food came out very sporadically and some entrees took an exceedingly long time. There were 9 of us eating and all of our meals came out at different times, which is awkward for a family meal with kids who get their food last. I had requested that my Greek Fries be extra crispy and when they were delivered mine didn't look any different than the other normal Greek fries we had ordered. When I asked the food server about my fries' appearance she said that mine were definitely the extra crispy ones and that they all are, in fact, prepared extra crispy. It was a weird comment and didn't really make sense since none of the fries were very crispy anyway, but it was obvious that she didn't have much of a say behind the counter and was trying her best to help the customers in the dining room. The hummus portion was generous but only comes with 1 pita cut into very small triangles, so unless you plan to eat your hummus by the spoonful, you'll have request more pita. Lastly, the meat on my gyro plate was shaved very thinly and the slices were dried and hard before I was even half done. The only thing redeeming about our experience was the excellent customer service of the food runner. She was very friendly and helpful. Offering a cup lid for my young daughter's water and bringing extra napkins, etc. She was great. Overall, we are very disappointed in the current condition of what used to be a fantastic Greek meal AND experience in this part of Las Vegas.

cDZZVwtT2YeMtr5ep1nxyg.text: Hidden Gem! Hands down best Greek food I've had. Mom and pops owned. When you see dad in the back cooking, it gives you comfort and you just know he's making sure your foods delicious.  BTW, he's not my dad but he's someone's dad in there.   If you haven't yet, check it out you'll be happy you did.

86GpsMjFkF3_t6Vp5hguuA.text: Wow! Thanks LVYELP for all the great reviews! I love trying new places! Today I made my way to Yassou for the first time with one of my besties. We ordered 3 appetizers and a main entree and shared everything. $30 for 2 people for lunch is reasonable! Everything we had was delicious! I'm a fan of their pita bread and hummus! I found my new favorite greek spot for lunch in the city! I will come back! My gf and I both agreed YGGC rocks! Love it! If you're in the area or visiting the city and looking for greek food... come here! no regrets! great customer service, no problem with seating (indoor/outdoor) or parking, affordable! -Miss Yelp 2012

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time here :))

ghxeqW7DdvKz4EpMoHVdEg.text: I don't often eat Greek food even though I really do like it.  Glad the stepdaughter introduced us to Yassou!  Good Greek food right off of Charleston near Summerlin.  Lots of folks visit, can tell you're in the affluent part of town because of all the cars parked outside!  Our lowly Acura was parked between a new BMW and a Mercedes coupe.  Dang did that make me feel poor.  Oh well, suck it rich people I can eat at Yassou too!  Upon entering the restaurant, it definitely reminds you of the diner from that movie "My Fat Greek Wedding".  White & blue dually represented!  Nice little family run place.  Wasn't particularly busy in the place that day, noticed that lots of folks were doing take-out, or picking up large catering trays for glitzy parties.    Menu is displayed prominently on huge boards right above the service counter.  Kinda hard to miss!  Menu was varied, went from traditional Greek fare to items of a more modern palette.  We of course, stuck with what the Greeks know.  And what they know is pretty darn tasty.  Throw the spanakopita, dolmades, and hummus aside...show me the meat!  Although I'm sure those items on the menu are probably pretty good, I was here for some carnivorous action.  The wifey and I went for the Souvlaki Combo - one beef and one chicken skewer marinated in the house lemon herbs & spices.  Our plates came with a Greek salad, rice pilaf, pita bread, and tzatziki sauce.  Overall the plate was good.  The skewers were a nice serving, and you could definitely taste the lemon and herbs throughout.  My beef skewer was juicy, but the chicken skewer was a little dry probably because it was breast meat (which tends to dry out).  The Greek salad was good with feta, tomato, cucumber, olives, and lots of red onion (which the wifey didn't really like), topped with their house vinaigrette.  Tasty.  Pita bread and the tzatziki sauce was good too, pita being warm and soft, with the tzatziki being a good complement for dipping things in to.  I wasn't a fan of the rice pilaf though, it didn't do much for me.  It's probably because I'm more of a sticky rice kinda guy.  Overall a decent plate.  What I really should have ordered was what our kids ordered.  I almost wanted to switch halfway though our meal!  They got the popular My Big Fat Gyro - gyro sandwich with flame broiled sliced beef & lamb, feta cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, and tzatziki sauce.  Along with a large order of Greek fries - fries with herbs & spices, and feta cheese.  This stuff was delish!  The thin sliced beef with the lamb, all combined into that gyro made a wonderful dish.  Was hard to put down after a few bites!  I will definitely have this instead the next time I visit Yassou.    Prices were kinda on the high side for me (I'm a cheapie eater) but I guess if you want quality food you gotta pay for it.  Our plates were about $9 each, and the gyros were a tad over $7.  Fries were separate, and cost us another $3 or so.  Servings were generous though.  On the plus side, they serve Coca-Cola!  Figure it would have been Pepsi since of the blue motif and all.  The restaurant has two different seating sections, one is in the restaurant, but there is another area on the outside in more of a patio setting.  Nice if the weather is good outside, or if you have a large party of folks with you.  I'll be back.  OPA!

HMNFnpANiR8r8jGzx-ma8Q.text: Hands Up! The best Greek restaurant in Vegas! Great food! Great atmosphere! Great location! & most of all Great owners! I have tried every greek restaurant in Vegas and this place right here shoots everyone out the water! There flavours are amazing and right on point! I recommend everyone to come here, if your in Vegas and want to try REAL authentic Greek food.

ezENrImx4U1eydg5oB-Www.text: I.Just.Love.This.Place. I've been going here for probably 5 years now, if not more. They are consistently good. It's worth the drive from Boulder City (where I live) if that tell you anything!  Produce on salads and gyros is fresh, as is the meat - always well seasoned and cooked well. I've tried several things here, Spanakopita is fresh, truly made by hand (no pre boxed frozen stuff here). Fries are perfectly cooked and it's worth the upgrade to Greek fries. Feta cheese on salads and fries is creamy and tangy. Pitas are soft and delicious, and the gyros are made with generous portions. Sauces are delicious! The Baklava is made daily, SUPER fresh, warm, and the perfect balance of sweetness with the richness of the pastry and nuts. One word of warning, they do not serve pitted olives so watch your teeth!   The staff are attentive and fast. This is a True family owned business and I see the owner and his son working their butts off every time I'm in. The eating areas are kept clean, and there's lots of natural light coming in and a nice outdoor patio area if you like. For what you get, the price is very reasonable.

kRYVOKTKeXvsUOr-4nvhVA.text: Im back again! The food is still worth the U Turn you have to make on Charleston.  They are sprucing up the place still same great greek feel and same great staff!

GBxJLoRWKL-VERzBkfxvWw.text: Wow!  Everything is great!  Lived in Greece for 3 years, and the food here takes me back.  Everything I've tried (saganaki, gyro, pasta, chicken, dolmades, pork) have all been wonderful.  Not to mention the staff--all very friendly.  Definitely recommend!

22J5y7N34jljhf9xBulqCQ.text: I've lived across the street from this hidden treasure for almost a year! I'd seen it plenty of times, and although I'd never eaten Greek food, I wanted to give it a try. So finally, I decided to try it. Because it was new to me, I decided to keep it simple. I ordered the Spanakopita. Lord have mercy, it was a flavor overload that my taste buds had been dying for!!! Imagine, such a simple dish with amaze ball flavor!   Since then, my husband has become addicted to the "big fats"; and I've tried the dolmades, and pastitsio. He's also tried the lemon herb chicken pita. We both have yet to be disappointed. In all honesty, we eat here weekly. So much so that when I call in my pickup order, they know it's me...and they make sure I get my 'spana'. Keep up the good work guys! We love and appreciate everything about Yassou!

I have yet to try the pasta. The only negative I can give is that the Baklava was dry, as other have said. AND the last last negative is...... We live on Sunrise Mountain, we NEED a YASSOU East side ! PLEASE !!!!

8BWe5zMJ-zZvvHgGpT9n_Q.text: Quality has degraded.  From souvlaki with juicy chunks of either beef or chicken interspersed with onions and green peppers, now there's grainy chunks of lower-quality beef and overcooked, dry chicken, one or two slivers of onion and no green pepper to speak of.  All we ever get is the souvlaki plate, but lately we're considering finding another place to order out.  Sad, because for years we got consistently delicious food.

5el5ncJYoAyV62k98wQGTA.text: Yassou was delicious!  I ordered the chicken pita - juicy lemon herb chicken, veggies and just the right amount of tzatziki.   Loved it.  Also ordered a side of the dolmades (stuffed grape leaves).  Unlike most places that serve the oily canned meatless variety, these are homemade with ground beef.  It was odd though - in some, the meat was juicy and in others it was dry and crumbly.  Obviously I preferred the juicy ones, but they were hit and miss.  I will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.  Great place.

They buy the most expensive cone (of Gyros Meat) and you can tell with taste.  If it is your first time go with the my big fat greek gyro and make it a combo with Greek fries.  It's the best gyros in Vegas hands down.  Other items on menu are good but take a little bit longer to cook.  They just upgraded by getting another gyros cone cooker to help with the increase of customers.  The word has gotten out this place is a hidden gem in Vegas.  If you are staying on the strip its worth grabbing it and taking it back to your room or suite like my friends did.   Enjoy!

Greek Fries Standard fries with feta cheese and some chopped parsley. Given the price difference between Greek fries and American fries being 50cents more i would have gotten the standard fries. There just wasnt enough feta or herbs to enhance the fries and make them tastes different or Greek for that matter.  Chicken Souvalaki Overall excellent, the side salad was fresh and crispy, could have done with a few more olives. The Pita bread is EXCELLENT soft and chewy very nice texture. Excellent rice pilaf, buttery with a fresh lemonly taste. Chicken was cooked to perfection, nicely flavored and still juicy in the middle.  I would highly recommend this place to others and will definately come back to try out other dishes.

O9g9qWpAuzCqgFUp22slxg.text: I know I won't spell much right, but just imagine I'm talking with my mouth full of delicious food. This was some of the best Greek food I have had in a very long time.  I had the "Big Fat Gyro", salad, pilaf and spanakopita... maybe auto correct got that one for me.  I missed out on the baklava... but I think it may not have ended up on my order.  I was too excited to check and to be honest everything else was so so soooooo good, I didn't have room for it.  Next time though I am gonna get it.  The filo dough on the spanakopita was so light and airy, not heavy like some places that use too much oil/butter between layers.  The filling was perfectly seasoned.  The meat in the gyro was too.  And the edges were slightly crisped, just the way I like it.  The tzatziki was different from what I have had in the past more herbaceous than what you get at chain places... the garlic and cucumber were balanced so wonderfully it wasn't cucumber yogurt with some garlic.  The price was good too.  And the serving size?  Perfect!  *especially for the price.*  Anyway, if I was able to, I'd eat here multiple times a week.  But I have bills to pay and all that jazz so when I can get here again it's a treat.

4U3K52GJxPwaRk2s4Nh7tw.text: I ordered the Veggie Spreads Plate and a side of Hummus... at the end of the meal I was left feeling "meh".    I glanced over the menu and picked from one of the two vegetarian options. I picked what I thought would have been the healthier of the two, Veggie Spreads Plate.   The Plate consisted of rice pilaf, greek salad, pita bread, two small stuffed grape leaves (I think it was grape leaves), and containers of spread.   Rice pilaf and pita bread dominated the plate, making it a hefty serving of carbs. In my opinion the rice pilaf was bland, lacking flavor. The greek salad was a ordinary salad, though the dressing was also bland. Keeping it consistent, the hummus was bland as well.   Like I mentioned in the beginning, I was left feeling "meh". I have definitely had better. Perhaps the positive reviews from my fellow Yelpers are as the result of meat plates?   As a vegetarian, this place definitely did not do it for me.

z0atbl-DYQUNoXCm6rV4Ag.text: I bought the lamp chop meal for my grandmother because she loves lamb chop and I can't make it right, LoL. She's particular about how how her lamb is cooked. She LOVED this dish!! It's a lot of food too. Definitely worth the money! I'm happy that my grandmother is happy!!! HEA6bKCZEA8Rd7fTMt_0kg.text: Found myself on the West side of town in dire need of sustenance.  Yelp located this fine establishment and I arrived right at noon.  Fairly busy but my order was taken quickly and courteously.  Looking around the interior I saw a very clean front counter, kitchen and seating area.  The decor was tasteful and the owners Greek Pride definitely shows through! My gyro arrived promptly and it was immense.  What a huge sandwich for such a reasonable price!  Pita bread was soft and warm and the meat and other fillings burst forth in a cornucopia of flavor! I highly suggest a stop here for the food and atmosphere.  I will be back!

958cIVse0N6lWF7Jr-fhIg.text: Very slow service. Waited a hour for 1 chicken plate. Bad customer service. Their excuse was there was no cooked chicken. I told the waitress "chicken does not take over a hour to cook . " and there excuse was they cannot break up orders. But party of 10 was eating food after they came 20 minutes after I ordered. Staff not trained for customer satisfaction!!!

8baIqm1K6nJ6f2iKOCV25g.text: Not enough can be said about this place. Upon first impression it's your very typical Greek cafe. Lots of blue and white tile. Greek music. Friendly staff. And awesome food.   My wife often makes fun of me when we go to Greek restaurants because I complain that they don't serve enough meat on their gyros or gyro plates. Not this place! It'd be fair to say that they even serve to much. I ended up forcing myself to eat all of the meat and left the trimmings because I didn't want to waste any of it. It's so good, that no matter how full I was, I still wanted to eat more.   I had the traditional beef and lamb gyro, and my wife and I split the gyro pasta. The kids had the beef skewers. Awesome!

32OvTS0ErY-mNgXXENiIFw.text: I was craving for Green food and came across this place. Food was incredible that I went twice in one day! Service was fantastic and the cooks were very friendly. Definitely a great spot to visit when you're in Las Vegas.

7yGTyQGoWRfI5TTPilJ-YA.text: This place was very great. It really added to our Vegas experience. There was a very authentic feel here. The music, the food, the decor, and so on. The use of space was very much appreciated. Totes yummy.

-k15gDrHBmke1GXa9yzP6g.text: LEGIT!  I'm so happy to have found a go-to Greek restaurant here in Las Vegas. I like that it's casual and quick but you can opt to sit, take your time, and enjoy yourself if you'd like.   I called my order in for pick up and it was ready it about 10 minutes. For $26 I got the Big Fat Gyro with a side of salad/rice, the Gyro/Chicken Souvlaki combo, a side of Spanakopita, and a drink.   It was delicious and filling with enough to eat for lunch the next day. The chicken skewers is a definite recommendation as the chicken breast is so juicy, flavorful, and tender. The spanakopita side came with 2 large pieces which was very delicious.   They have a cafe to the side which I plan on trying sometime soon. I'll definitely be coming here often.

sOCucOPKmZ5snGDtuVAwww.text: Forever my favorite Greek restaurant in town. I've tried to venture off and find somewhere closer and although they've been good, it's not the same! The chicken souvlaki plate is the best!! 2 skewers of grilled chicken and onion, seasoned and marinated perfectly served with rice, a salad and pita. I love their Italian dressing and tzatziki sauce also. The owner is here pretty much everyday, very friendly gentleman and remembers his repeat customers! Trust me, if you want some good Greek, this will surpass your expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken souvlaki plate!

I5DluFyr63uDY7qzWJ_Ycw.text: This family owned cafe is so laid back yet serves amazing food! I love coming here even though I live all the way from the South! The owner is so friendly, the food is so great & the portions are perfect! Salad is phenomenal! I have been coming here for 3 years!

2c6oVkzBLbxDyccw7LGqXg.text: I'm long overdue for a review. I've been coming here regularly for over a year, ever since I moved close by. This place is my weekly staple.  I have been known to eat here 3x a week! I have only eaten the chicken and steak souvlaki. The chicken and meat is probably the most flavorful, juicy, and tender I've had from comparable restaurants.  The Greek salad is awesome! The rice is to die for! The pita bread is so good too. This is a great family owned and run restaurant and the prices are awesome considering the amount of food and quality you get. Most plates are $8- $9. Peak lunch times you will sometimes see a line out the door.   Give this place try, you won't be disappointed. 8D

43m1GH2zNi_LXDfO3V_JrA.text: Food was so good!!!! The Greek salad was well dressed and the feta cheese was a good amount.  Service took awhile. I do understand it's a Friday during lunch time. 30 minute wait for a salad.  I definitely will come back to try their other good looking foods :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad

_IMDvU-f_tJ1qWWCt47Z9w.text: I cant tell you how delcious the food is. My family and I have been coming here for a while and I'm finally writing a review. They are always consistent with their food. Always tastes the same and again always so good! People are super friendly and always have a smile. Looking for great greek food, This is definitely a great stop!

7s1OEFWYv8afpGCUSoI2wg.text: Authentic Greek food!! Highly recommend the Gyro Steak Souvlaki. My Greek Mother-In-law absolutely loved the food. Thank you Peter it was nice to meet you we will be back for more!!

NNjyFULlRXwiMht74VBpMw.text: Love this place! Don't get to come as often as I would like as I live so far away. Thank goodness I was in the area for a meeting.   Awesome food and 5 star service!

ckYmp8HpTSScQDgNqROogA.text: First time coming here, girl at the counter was amazing and extremely professional. I love Greek food but I love great customer service even more! I think her name was alexis? I will be coming back just because she was so sweet

qEhGoNuiUuZcxtsS2DwwIw.text: I'm not fluent in Greek, but I'm pretty sure Yassou means "delicious food". Found this place on Yelp and bookmarked it, then heard from my BF that it was an old favorite place of his, so naturally we went by our first full day in town.  The lunch specials are well-priced and delicious- for $10/each we got a gyro (the big fat for him, the lemon chicken special for me), with greek fries and a drink. Not bad at all, and portions are huge. Price for value is excellent.  Both gyros were delish, but i'm more a fan of the traditional gyro meat rather than the chicken, though it was good to see a healthier option on the menu. Worth a try, at the very least. Greek fries are the bomb- regular fries with feta, and maybe some garlic?, and parsley. Delicious. And for a take out order, they are carefully wrapped so as not to displace any of the plentiful crumbly cheese. Smart thinking!  Love how the owner himself is working alongside the employees to make and fill the orders- great sign and also underscores the quality you can expect here.

0ELoKuT1SU3r4qnHs2l2-Q.text: Yassou always is the best meal of my day. We come at least twice a week for lunch. The service, the food and the friendly atmosphere makes this a great experience. It feels like home.

hPBRNqIR_avzK3FfDX4mZg.text: What a great lunch experience! Food is delicious and authentic. Pete and Christian are great hosts. Highly recommend

weNzfrkFd6HQLEWCg35tYg.text: This place was great. Wait was a little long for lunch but that's because the line was out the door during lunch and my friend ordered the salmon plate. I got the gyro and feta fries. It's nice to have another good place for Greek food.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LqGxz1HqXDF8W8olMBFG6A.text: I came in right before closing with my lady and we were kindly greeted. After ordering and shortly waiting, Pete brought us our food. He was so passionate and was excited for us to try it for the first time. It was delicious! I loved the rice and geyro meat. It was also a great bargain and has the total Greece vibe. We had a great talk and will definitely be back!

kwuv5Aip5yjPgIsKwvG1Jg.text: I've only been here once but I now have a favorite Greek spot in Vegas! The food was seasoned to perfection and not only that, the atmosphere was extremely inviting. Very personable, helpful and friendly staff. I was a bit skeptical coming because I've yet to find a greek restaurant that offers authentic flavors. Yassou not only met but exceeded my hopes, definitely will be returning!

x-tNHr1Z0jHY13sjSdymzw.text: Went here for lunch and got a combo for $11. It comes with a gyro, fries and a smoothie.  For my combo I picked Greek fries and strawberry banana smoothie. I've had my fair share of gyros in this town.  Gyro: Not as heaping with meat as my favorite gyro place in Henderson. The meat was more cooked and saltier than what I'm used to. I couldn't finish it. More tzatziki to mask the saltiness please. 3.5/5  Greek Fries: I love fries. Crispy, crunchy and hot with a little bit of feta cheese and parsley. Not the best Greek fries I've had but still good. They only give you a handful so you might want to order another side of fries. 4/5  Strawberry Banana Smoothie: This is absolutely great since I don't drink soda. They have strawberry, mango, banana, etc. I asked them to make strawberry banana smoothie for me if it wasn't too much of a hassle and they did. Yay!  5/5  But for what you get with the combo, it's definitely good value. I'd much rather drive 3 more miles to get here than eat at G Time. Plus, the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek fries, gyro and strawberry-banana smoothie

Rp7VpNer_n0UPbz99XS7XQ.text: I love Mediterranean food and was hoping it would be good..Nope..Just not close to my standards..I ate half and chucked the other half when I realized just how lousy the food was..

rUJK-fbN9uge2lbWHeo46A.text: Great experience here! It was my boyfriend and I's first time trying Greek food and wow, pretty amazing stuff they have going on here. The minute you enter you suddenly feel like you're not in Vegas. The people working, the people around eating in the restaurant makes you feel like you're in Greece, very authentic. Their hummus was addicting, glad we had more than enough to take home. Their mizithra pasta was, amazing! And the boyfriend enjoyed his Greek plate mini filled with pork, chicken and lamb. We had an amazing experience here, would love to go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mizithra Pasta
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Plate Mini

2CBFVnB3UMymTNzQLDmIfw.text: The best!  Try the gyro and chicken plate, you won't be disappointed.  Always great taste, quality, quantity and value - unbelievable(we keep meaning to try other items on the menu, but we really love this meal).  It includes the best tasting rice, pita bread and greek salad.  We have tried all the Greek places in Vegas over the years and you can't beat this place!

TX_6teusG615CAZw2FICLw.text: Love, love love Yassou. I come here with my family and we the share vegetarian plate, greek salad, beef souvlaki & chicken souvlaki. Even though the fries are very good, we skip those and pay for the extra salad because....... their house made salad dressing is sosososososos GREAT. The salads, btw, are perfectly dressed.

2-IBmTkrx6vntBDxQP7cow.text: Best Greek food in town. Spankopita & greek fries are awesome. Perfect for lunch don't forget they close fairly early no late dinners here.

MSJnIUrrf4vaZhDh8tsRYw.text: Mmmm, one of my favorite Greek restaurants in town!  This is, surprisingly, one of the only places in the whole city with taramosalata - my favorite Greek dip!  The service is fast, the food is cheap, really, I couldn't ask for more :]

8D4TPqCSK-5nOh-YDNQ8Ig.text: This is an excellent place for for fast food dinner.  Or for a catered affair.  Great food and great service.

T57i-bTN4kEmbjiuwbDyAw.text: the staff here is super nice. i love that they greet everyone as they come through the door. the food is super good and you know its made to order because it takes a bit before they bring it out to you. i had the gyro and steak souvlaki combo...Mmmm Mmmmm! i also shared some greek fries with my friend. nice portions. it definitely fulfilled our craving for greek food. =)

gJ3WI33DvCHanpBShEdm4w.text: I had a giro and it was delicious. Prices were fine. A bit crowded/loud inside, but eating outside was great.

tdCUOZFC2iN8uCdjH1Z1mQ.text: Just walking in and seeing the take out menu brought back memories of being in Santorini.  The Spanakopita is delicious.  And the staff are super friendly.  I happened to get the owner's son as my cashier and he recommended the Spanakopita.  So I ordered that and a Gyro Pita and both were tasty.  My only gripe is that they close quite early.  I have driven by twice for dinner around 8pm and they were closed.

JiccH_x-hC9H_ocRtBRsEA.text: Great food.  Good service. Too much dressing on the salad but good vibe. The chicken and gyro tasted very good..

yi3RdNNjFtClkmc11vnKhA.text: I love this place! It has the best chicken, Greek salad and rice I've ever had....My mouth waters just thinking about it

aGGqEaU3-_7aBN7pBCHD7Q.text: Why do you make such great food, but refuse to put salad dressing on your salad? Does the salad dressing cost extra? I appreciate getting my salad tossed, but don't make it so dry!!!

eKyzLCQ-nBe11_oktaheew.text: We have been all over Las Vegas and no other Greek place compares. The food is superb and the price is amazing.

8EiRlNcp9w1Bk_ZvKYtk9A.text: I genuinely love the food here. The chicken and pita bread is so darn delicious. The staff is always so friendly. My food is always fresh. The greek salad dressing is delicious so get extra. They have great lunch specials too. I also get the baklava. I have had the beef plate which was good, but I think the chicken is better. The greek fries are yummy  I love the fact that you can see the kitchen, you can see the cooks prepare your food. Cleanliness is a must. They also have a very nice patio for dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Fries
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Skewers, rice pilaf, greek salad, and the oh so yummy pita bread
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baklava

uZ89NISELE3OP3eREdpKIg.text: Employees in too big of a hurry to close up shop and get out of there. Came in on Sunday evening around 5:30 (close at 6) the clerk at the front wasn't very friendly didn't greet us or ask us what we want seemed irritated. Asked for the gyro combos ended up getting 2 gyros and 1 fry and said I didn't ask for the combo. Best time to go is during the day when not rushing to clean tables and put chairs up to get out of there even though close 30 minutes after coming in.

-Jw51ANYFt6MHUyoNdVRpQ.text: I tried to come here for lunch, they totally forgot our order. They were super rude about it and not very helpful. But the kicker is that the chef was eating his lunch in the middle of making food. Seriously? Either he is so over worked he isn't allowed a break for eating, or he and management don't care about hygiene. Either option is not good. Will not be going here again.

GrC5cWAH0jNnKurvyggzSg.text: TOP GREEK CAFE SO FAR!   **2016 YELP 100 LV CHALLENGE #1**   SO I thought I had tasted the best Greek cafe mom & pop shop, but w/ the new year I have found another GEM in Las Vegas!! Although it is a bit far I am willing to drive the distance! We even saw the owner working his but off in the kitchen which you know that the food is being prepared at it's best!!   The staff are SUPER HAPPY all the time it seems & enjoy what they do. You can definitely see it in the food. You order your food at the redigister & pay then they bring out the food to your table.  The restaraunt is nice & big w/ outdoor seating as well. One thing that I LOVED was that it was SPACIOUS & clean cut... not too much decoration clutter everywhere. The high ceilings also a plus. The kitchen is an OPEN kitchen so you can see all of your food being cooked & you get all of the yummy smell of the food being prepared as well. One more thing was how CLEAN the freaken bathrooms were.   BIG FAT SPECIAL W/ FRIES & SODA $10.59 - the flame broiled beef & lamb is something I don't usually get but that's an automatic meat that comes w/ the big fat special.... I be so SURPRISED at how DERICIOUS the darn meat was & how much meat came in the gryo! You can make another gyro out of it.  SMALL GREEK SALAD $3.99 - I will have to say this was the least of my favorite.... I like my dressing a little more salty & acidic but this one was more olive oil than I would want. Still protiom wise it was pretty big for a small salad.  HUMMUS $4.99 - absolutely PERFECT flavor!!!! Just the right amount of garlic & oil w/ citrus... the pita bread was warm & fluffy  MEDITERRANEAN PIZZA W/CKN $8.99 - they use a 9" flat bread & make a pizza out of it! The ratios were all EVEN! Chicken pieces in every bite... an OCD person's dream pizza ahhahaha

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mediterranian chicken pizza 8.99
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of big fat gyro special ... greek fries 0.75
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big fat gyro special 10.59

H-GSDWOO65uRd2ZZFadnyA.text: We went here one evening craving Greek food, saganaki in particular. We showed up 45 minutes before they closed and the employee didn't look too excited to see us. Most of the place was already cleaned up and closed off. We were a group of 8 and no one offered us help with seating as we struggled to drag tables together to accommodate us. We expected a dining restaurant with waiters and such, but this is more of a cafe feel where you order your food at the counter and then get your own beverages. They were out of saganaki. Sadness. But I ordered the Spanakopita Plate and it was enough for two people. And all of it was good. Looking at everyone's plates, portion sizes were a definite plus. While we were eating, several people came in to pick up carry out orders. We'll be back, hopefully on a day where they have Saganaki.

wfJTfF2IAUrBpNftka64RA.text: Decent Gyro sandwich compared to others I've tried in Las Vegas.  I am taking off one star because of the little amount of Tzatziki sauce that was on the lettuce and didn't make it into the sandwich and when I asked for extra side of sauce, they wanted to charge 55 cents for a little container.   It's not the money, and fine charge extra for additional sauce, but try putting on a decent amount on the sandwich in the first place.  Other than that I did enjoy it and would probably go back.

xhR-o-mYoiV7C9sRgiOpOw.text: Nestled upon the Southwest hill of Buffalo and Charleston is this local gem that all must visit opening at 11am.   Today I had the Calamari under the Greek Plates section of the menu. It was the best calamari I have ever had, and I have had a lot of calamari in my lifetime. The plate was generous for the price; with salad, rice, and the fluffiest pita bread I have ever had surrounding.   The sauce that was also provided with the Calamari plate would be a world wide phenomenon if it was ever bottled and sold. I can't quite pinpoint all the flavors in it, which leads me to believe it is something special. All I can tell you is that you must try it for yourself and be enthralled in its zesty goodness as I was today.   The place is very well kept and clean with table clothes and sturdy chairs. It's as authentic as you can imagine. With authentic Greek Coffee in their Espresso Bar, Gyros, Hummus, Pita Sandwiches, and all sorts of authentic sounding appetizers and plates. They even have imported Greek Olive Oil and Greek Coffee Grounds for purchase.   The service was beyond excellent and as I was standing by the cashier to pay for my meal, I read a framed article about the place. It was then I realized that I was served by the owner himself and his family.   It was a wonderful experience and I am now determined on completing all of the menu.

Mdq_xIEIJlYLWndal7Znkg.text: The best Greek food in Las Vegas, made to order.  Fresh, hot, and filling.  Serving portions are wonderful.  The service is top notch.  Christian and his father work to make sure our experiences are great every time!  We will be back again very soon.  Thanks so much Christian!

MWr9E9-wY5co5xXIloRRWA.text: Light refreshing and flavorful! Who said healthy eating should be flavorless? They really have a way with adding flavor with natural ingredients such as yogurt, parsley, lemon, etc. I'm thrilled this place is down the street from us, they are really tasty!   I ordered the super lemon herb chicken pita. It was a nice big freshly homemade pita stuffed silly with grilled lemon herb chicken and lettuce, also dolloped with a good amount of their creamy yogurt sauce. Squirt some lemon on that baby and eat to your heart's content. It is really refreshing and flavorful! I was completely satisfied and I also didn't feel guilty or overstuffed. Just perfect!   My boyfriend ordered the steak souvlaki combo which comes with a side of greek salad and also rice pilaf. We really enjoyed this dish! The steak was cooked perfectly tender and the seasoning was just right to where you can still really enjoy the flavor of the meat. The rice pilaf was super flavorful and addicting. Also the salad had a super light dressing that didn't overpower the flavor of the meal at all. Everything went together very well.   The greek fries were not my favorite. I'm sure it's because we ordered them to-go and by the time we got home they were soggy. But they were also lacking feta, parsley and seasoning.   Other than that, the super lemon chicken herb pita is a winner! I can't wait to try their other pitas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek fries were lacking seasoning, feta, and parsley. :( sad day
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak souvlaki! Very tender steak and flavorful rice pilaf. Everything in this combo went well together!
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super lemon herb chicken pita! Messy but scrumptious. Light and Refreshing! Chicken is tender and flavorful.

jcbKDMKds6Kw1MxvlCBF4A.text: the taste was really healthy, you know you are eating at a local restaurant that keeps to their name and tradition. my wife and i came here for lunch coz apparently her and her coworkers eat here for lunch. she knows to order in prior to her break to avoid the wait since we only have 30mins to eat. The food was amazing in portion and taste and presentation. The customer service of everyone felt like what a business should be like, family-owned through and through. It's a clean place, also good location and this place was always busy. Parking could be a challenge but it is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent portions!

QyMB9dFVWgpqsSf8ob28cg.text: Best Greek Food I've had in Las Vegas! Great service and delicious food. I highly recommend

DkSzWwzha0NOt6xcVhgxAQ.text: Love it here! They always treat me like family. Their skewers are so good that I have a hard time ordering anything else. Everyone that I send here always raves about it. One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!!!

MVICtQLFfimwaso822L5mA.text: Las Vegas has a lot of great Greek options hut Yassou just happens to be my favorite. I have regularly eaten here for 8 years and they have never let me down. I especially love the Big Fat Gyro with Greek fries and the Mini Souvlaki specials; both offer generous portions of fresh ingredients at ridiculously reasonable prices. The food is cooked fresh and lunch lines are long, so don't get frustrated when the food takes a few minutes to come out. Well worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Souvlaki Special. Yum.

DadRAdUJqc8dCY2fV9W1GQ.text: So after a couple years, I decided to give this place a try again. Now I'm hooked. I love the spanakopita plate and lemon chicken soup. The spanakopita is perfect and the dolmas are delicious as well, not too salty like some places. The rice pudding is also a welcomed ending to the meal.

asayWhZ3JzNrV5HL8K6Hhg.text: A gem in the Section 10 neighborhood. Very reasonably-priced all-day "lunch" plates/specials, and a very neighborhood feel. The owner/manager is always there and more than happy to make sure you have everything you need to grab a good, home-cooked Mediterranean meal.  You can't ask for much more than that.   Hot sauce options are slight - you've basically got a big community bottle of Cholula that you might have to "borrow" from one of the other diners. If that's a dealbreaker, just bring your own potion and keep it secret. :) I'm gonna next time I go. Cholula is just not hot to my seared 'buds. But that's my problem, I guess!

wpnHmPd_B5fslw4SxpxHtw.text: Yassou Greek Grill Cafe is some of the best Greek food I've ever had. The restaurant is very casual, and is a great place to have lunch. Portions are very large though. The staff is very friendly and kind, and food was out in a reasonable amount of time (10-15 minutes) and was so flavorful and tasty. The location was also fairly easy to find. My favorite dish is the gyro and chicken skewer. Great place for lunch and also for a quick bite.

gwedBVjusP1BgN8FZD0LFQ.text: Staying near the strip, drove 6 plus miles off the strip to this place for Greek food. My husband was getting a little anxious about driving so far out of the way, but it was well worth it!! Food was delicious and filling for the price!!   Definitely recommend this place if your looking for delicious Greek food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro Plate

uz3uNt3FGt20sMwJNAxv_g.text: I don't know. I've been before and enjoyed the food and today I somewhat enjoyed the food but the experience was just so blah. I get it - some places the employees having attitudes is part of the experience. Is this place supposed to be like that? If so, then forget the rest of my review. If not, then I found there to be no customer service. The employees are all yelling at each other. They don't seem to have enough people working to deal with the in person orders and to go orders and they seem so stressed out about it. They've been open for years though so I can't imagine it's anything new. The older gentleman in the back is always there working hard and is a nice contrast to the rest of the folks.  The food we got was tasty, I particularly liked the salad. The hummus is not my favorite and on a side note it was a decent portion of hummus served with 6 tiny pita triangles. My kids dipped and finished the pita in 10 seconds. Can we have a few more triangles for this big pile of hummus? No, it's $1 per pita. So another $2 was necessary to add to our $50 bill so my kids could eat the hummus. I don't mind paying for extra things but that seems unnecessary especially considering the small amount to start with.  So maybe a good place to go on a hectic lunch break, but not for a weekend lunch with your family.

ybl1KeVrA0K43_q521Fc2w.text: My friend recommended I try this place because I've never had Greek food before. I got the Chicken Souvlaki sub Greek fries for the salad. The chicken was pretty moist, the rice I wasn't a fan of. It was cooked right but the flavor was a little off. The Greek fries are AMAZING. I loved them so much, I'd order them alone. I also got a strawberry guava smoothie and that was super tasty. The hummus was good as well, I just wish they gave you more pita bread with the hummus. I'd go back again and definitely recommend this restaurant if you've never had Greek food.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Souvlaki sub Fries

lV0c3qXNQzKakHCqCt3oWw.text: Always good.  Service is ok.  Food is legit one of the best in Vegas.  Taziki might be the heat in Vegas

DNwUj6pTntbHUaGvBkSbjQ.text: Went here based on the reviews.  Food was ok, ordered the Gyro plate, no dressing on salad and meat was very salty.  Hubby had the Steak Gyro and it was very good.

VaKrXdBKSEgFdG2gOpOFBA.text: This place has grown in popularity in the last few months and it's been getting harder to come for my 1-hour lunch break considering they are usually backed up.   Regardless food is always great and staff does their best. Just keep in mind if you are in a time crunch.

Iuy5p1HlnM4N0JC05IxKOw.text: Best selection and flavor for tge best price! Get off the strip and enjoy some authentic Greek delights.

hs9-Zewxvsz0UUBiFudb-g.text: Hands down some of the best Greek food in town. Yassou is a family owned Mom n Pop serving up delicious gyro platters and pita sandwiches. The portions are big and you won't be leaving hungry no matter what you order. My go to is a super steak pita with Athens fries. The pita is stuffed with 6oz of tenderloin steak and grilled peppers while the fries are topped with generous helpings of Feta cheese. Combos run around $10+ depending on what you get. My friend always gets the steak salad and is never disappointed.  Service is always great as the family running the place treats you as one of their own. There is plenty of seating but it does get busy during lunch hours. Calling ahead for take out is the way to go. Opa!

tHo1eZTKNWnWrcgqnbw8Ww.text: Good food but my order (lunch chicken special) literally required only 1 skew of chicken to be grilled took over 35 minutes on a not busy Sunday where more than half of the tables unoccupied. Other peeps came behind me got their food and I was still waiting. I asked after 30 minutes waiting then was told it's coming. Really? This is a self-serve type of eateries so thing must move fast. They must mess up the order of who came first. If you want a quick eat, this is NOT a place for you.

n4HNx6XkF8zquJO75pgktQ.text: BEST OF THE BEST! They deserve each and everyone of those 5 stars. Great customer service. Very clean and well kept place. Delicious food. I've never been a fan of Greek food but this place changed that. I highly recommend it. I've been here multiple times and it never fails.

WMdrvivgdlTTZbr20SZ3HA.text: This is the first place I ever came to in Vegas for gyro's;  like 20 yrs ago and it's just as good I remember.  Everything was fresh and hot.  Fries were delicious.  If u looking for some gyros to grub this is the place to come.

eKyaCGVhDq8Ys5Fw1ZqSEQ.text: Great food at reasonable prices.  The baklava is a little heavy on the cinnamon for me, but everything else was delish.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gyro and Spanakopita plate! I also got the baklava which had a little too much cinnamon for my tastes.

u9Qbxew7PgHE0JBVt0XuCA.text: What a nice Greek spot in the middle of the desert. For many years I would pass by this place but never got the chance to check it out. After work, I finally decided to complete another restaraunt that was bookmarked in my app for awhile. I'm so happy that I did, because I had great experience at Yassou. The moment you walk in this place, you'll notice the Greek artwork and typical blue and white motif that is allover the restaraunt. There is a cool story along the wall about the history of the restaraunt. Greek music in the background is played throughout and the open kitchen provided a cool interaction between guests and employees.   Onto the food, everything was simply delicious from the Lemon Chicken Pita combo with Greek Fries to the Chicken Souvlaki meal was spot on. They make really good Pita bread and the Tzaziki Sauce was delicious. The Chicken was tender and really seasoned just right. Every bite of my Lemon Chicken had a refreshing taste yet balanced savory flavor. Another item that stood out was the fresh Baklava, very good and made just right. Great amount of sweetness and crunch with a moist texture. I would come back to try out more of the other dishes that they offer in the near future.  Another cool thing about this place was when I went to use the Restroom, I notice that there is a Patio to the left side facing Charleston Blvd was a cool dinning option during days when Vegas has mild weather. The Restroom was clean but I had to share this experience because when I used one of the Restroom. I immediately notice a blue bottle to the corner and couldnt contain myself because it was Windex. All I could think of was, "My Big Fat Greek Wedding!" LoL.  2017 Yelp Review #31

sq4KBtUJD_6K4Xp7n-BxTg.text: This is the real deal! And this is coming from a Greek that used to live in Greece. This place is fabulously delicious. Very fresh and very friendly! I live in California but  I will definitely be back to eat here again.   In the meantime all you locals should go there now!!!   I had a gyro, saganaki, and a dipla (diples)!!! Yum!

VMCl23JjA6CiZoUrpoY6vg.text: Good food, great environment, limited parking space, has to pay for extra dressing bit over all its ok

fkRQUq7dEjKd9FnKbMJ5sw.text: This is the best in town.  I've been living down the street since they opened.  The food is always fresh & amazing. Unfortunately, there was a slender middle aged Asian lady with long black hair that ruined our experience.  She was unhelpful, had a bad attitude & seemed to be annoyed/bothered with anything you asked of her.  However, the mix girl (small nose ring) @ the cash register was extremely sweet, warm, welcoming & greeting EVERYONE with a smile.    The owner or his father weren't in today - I will def be calling them during the week to advise them if our experience as I wouldn't want her to mistreat any other customers or have that bad apple ruin that place.   On a positive, the best place in town!   A MUST TRY!

pL85-XVws_ZOAPZpeYl3VQ.text: Great food and great service! Very cute place to eat and relax! The patio is nice too! Highly recommend:)

UeDlpWZ49DEyZhmF7RkpzQ.text: This place was bomb! I had the gyro plate and my girl got the gyro & steak plate and we loved it, my son even liked it! We be going back that's for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I was so hungry that I had to eat my gyros plate. Well this is the aftermath. Lol!

GDQ2duRHEVZgFlvPSPYpIw.text: Pro tip: The Gyros are full of good stuff so for an extra dollar you can get some extra pita bread (definitely tell them you don't want it cut up though because they did when I ordered it and it completely defeated the purpose of me trying to make an extra gyro. For that they lost a star.)   My bf and I came in here and ordered the big fat gyro and the super lemon steak pita. The onions are really sharp and give you that extra crunch to your pita. Pair that with the Greek fries and you're set for an extra delicious lunch. The fries are exactly what you want. Crispy and lightly dusted with fresh parley and feta cheese. Some places can over do it. My dish was great but it was falling apart (which is why I needed the extra pita). It fell on my dish and suddenly I was full. My bf really enjoyed his meal. He typically orders his gyro without any lettuce. I keep all the good stuff in. It's a perfect hearty rainbow meal. And if you're like me you can save some for a snack later.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super lemon steak. So big it fell on the table.
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The big gyro.

2SAe8NH_wo8cgUzcWDbhqg.text: if you enjoy the Greek Festival at St Johns every year but cannot wait till September to enjoy the delicious offerings of the Greeks, than this is the place to go! I swear they have the best Greek food I have ever tasted. They are located on Charleston & Buffalo so that makes it a great stopping point for me after work or after my daughters gymnastics. The prices make me super happy too. This place has an interesting setup with a few tables inside the restaurant, an eating area outside but enclosed and a few more tables outside that are not covered at all. The kitchen is open which I love, because you know they are cooking food fresh and not throwing in any surprises. Yes I've seen that movie "Waiting" way too much...and? If you are in the area or feeling the need to stuff your face with delicious Greek food, make your way here.

R4O0uRciXGvGT6ks2MBLOQ.text: I LOVE Mediterranean food, and I have tried a lot of restaurants in Vegas, and California. I was stoked to try this spot after reading the reviews (I even ran a block in the rain to get here!), but it was mediocre at best. My absolute favorite thing in the world (other than maybe koala bears) is koobideh/luleh/lula/ground beef kebab. They didn't have it here!  Major fail.  We ordered a chicken kebab plate, their special fries, and a gyro salad.   The chicken was dry.  For me, that's inexcusable at any med place.  Their whole deal is grilling things.  If you can't grill meat, don't open a restaurant that specializes in grilling meat. Period.   The fries were kind of nice with the spices, and feta bits, but the cut was a bit too thick, and they were overall a bit greasy (even for fries). The salad was pretty good.  I would eat it again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it either.

Xykog-RX5oASDsXdExMmkA.text: This is my fave Greek restaurant. Now granted I keep ordering the same damn thing, but baby its done to perfection. Its ran by a real Greek family, and they are super nice. They seem to know all of their regulars. So go there you won't be disappointed!

gCOtCXqGuMVVyKEphDy38A.text: The food is always seasoned just right. They never just overload on spices and hope for the best. I have ordered the chicken souvlaki here several times and it always tastes the same...always delicious.   I visit duting random times so I don't really know when they're rush is like but there are always people going in and out of the place. The service is always friendly.

PXzX893qzlN1M42njIAjag.text: I returned to the "Yassou" grill, to see if they had returned to their original recipe for the lemon based salad dressing, certainly a house speciality and worth the trip across town,  sorry to report they have not, and serve only the oily inferior blend, sad.  (sure wish they would rethink the dressing change,   old dressing a 10+, new version a 2-

wFEGj4opAmo8rqnH_mMgqg.text: I usually come during lunch hours ,and its always crowded.  I came on a Saturday night...and it was just as packed.  I can see why...the lemon chicken pita is fantastic!  And very generous with the portions!.  Also the spanikopita and hummus were just as tasty.  I've known the owners since they ran Lou Christian Dry Cleaners.  Their customer service was spot on there...and equally good here.   Just wished they gave you more napkins. ..

oKGK94by7xvdUg0QHNr_zQ.text: This place is a hidden gem! The food was really good. I had the Souvlaki beef/chicken plate and my bf had the Moussaka plate. The meat was tender and cooked perfectly. The salad and rice are made well too. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the fact that the moussaka was really soggy. The place is very clean and the staff is friendly. FNJPqRzPy3Zs6z8veBqcgw.text: I can't believe I have been driving by this place for years and never stopped in! My husband and I just dropped by for a gyro and it was as good as it gets.
