557KVQ2H9BH_aiDBf94rYA.text: Yassou is not only the best Greek food but the best food PERIOD. I've come to this restaurant A LOT of times and they have been nothing but courteous, fast and efficient. To top it off the food is always the best, every time I go its like the first time going all over again. Love Yassou, I will be back again and again

vhnsXxEO_rpYW_cIe4DcMw.text: I LOVE me some Mediterranean Cuisine, it reminds me of my time spent back east hanging out with my Greek, Persian, Spanish, and Turkish friends and first being exposed to new ingredients and tasty cuisines for the first time. It also reminded me of my time spent at the Wine Spectator Restaurant at The Culinary Institute of America at Greystone where the menu items we made covered flavors from the Mediterranean Regions, from Paella, Moussaka, Dolmades, Kofta, and Skordalia, to Avgolemono, Lavash, Taramosalatta, Spanokopita, and Baklava we did a little of everything. Also taking Cooking courses with Mediterranean food authority and chef Joyce Goldstein was a great bonus.  Wifey's not as big as a fan as I am, so I kinda had to sorta beg and plead and twist her arm to check out Yassou Greek Grill Cafe since we were close by...(It worked!) Yassou was a good find! Perusing the menu, I see Taramosalatta, a dip made from cured fish roe, potatoes, lemon juice and olive oil. I love that stuff and I order it as a starter."Whoa!?!?!? you even pronounced it correctly!?!?! Great choice!" The guy behind the register says with a surprised look...(Refer to above paragraph)  We also shared a Lemon Herb Chicken Pita and a Souvlaki Combo. The Taramosalatta arrives and we dig in. Yassou's version was okay, but I'm used to a stronger taste of the cured roe, and I didn't really taste the potato in there, more like overkill on the olive oil. Every bite of the pita was delicious as was the combo, but the beef skewer was a tad on the dry side. Overall, a solid meal, and I still have to try out a few other spots that were highly yelped (Paymon's, Zaytoon, Parsley, Great Greek, etc.) ALOHA!!!

Also tried the steak and chicken kabobs and they were amazing.. Juicy and moist...  The pastitio is good too...

MQHPfZDPi2F4JIZkpTZs4A.text: Customer service here is wonderful. Everyone is friendly and helpful.   The seating inside is limited but theres another area where people can sit too, its an inside patio.  The food is well super delicious. I love the grape leaves with meat inside my favorite. I have had the gyro and its so tasty. The meat is just right full of flavor exploding in your mouth. The Greek fries are my favorite fries anywhere. My go to is the lamb and chicken plate. Both meats are flavorful and good portions. Rice is made to perfection and the salad too. I haven't had the desserts but im sure they don't disappoint.

EiYy8XbeXUCcQKdTXEkfng.text: I felt bad about the stars on my last review. The gyro was good. But the service and experience needs a little work.  Maybe I came at a bad time on a bad day. I still think the prices are a little high compared to my regular place. I might try them again.

qNASb_uyOQG6zu2mtYBoKA.text: Have been obsessed with Greek/Mediterranean food for about 2 years now and this place is the best I've tried so far. Even beating out bigger chains like Luna Grill in California, whom I do love when im in town but if there was a Yassou in Cali I'd never step foot in a Luna Grill again. Not only are their plates mouth watering but the portions are large and very fairly priced. Large portions, financially savvy, and healthy?? It'd be irresponsible NOT to eat here! 5 stars without a doubt.

EDCtXWe-W45sK1I-Mm5f1g.text: Yassou has the best Greek food in town and is family owned and operated, which is nice because everyone who walks in the door is treated like family as well. This is always my go-to when meeting friends for lunch. The food is always freshly prepared and affordable too.

lvO06LAlTY6lQjAra8MW_w.text: First, this place gets busy during lunch and there are always patrons up until closing time, It is a real food find on the west end of town.  Yassou Greek Grill Cafe is my favorite little Greek restaurant in Las Vegas.  This unassuming restaurant serves up some of the most delicious Greek food in town.  My favorite is their Chicken Souvlaki platter.  It is served with two skewers of savory, tender chicken and comes with a small salad, buttery, lemon rice, warm, fresh pita bread and cool and creamy Tzatziki sauce this meal is very filling.  Their menu has all the standard Greek favorites such as Gyros, Spanakopita, and Dolmades. Other notable menu items are the Greek Fries served crispy and hot served with spices and feta cheese. The atmosphere is casual and friendly. The one drawback is the parking lot is small and hard to navigate any vehicle larger than a Mini Cooper. Yassou Greek Grill Cafe is located at 7871 W. Charleston near Buffalo, their phone number is 702-798-8989 daily hours Monday-Saturday 11 a.m. to 8 p.m.   Now open on Sundays and the food/quality is excellent.

5GnWQpV6E-Jh1g65rAnoYw.text: Great quick place to stop for lunch. Since my friend lives in Vegas now, we actually get to try local spots and not just touristy central. She suggested a gyro place, and I was in. I opted to keep it simple and tried a gyro sandwich with everything. Overall, good amount of meat and flavor. The taziki sauce was what I'd expect, but it could have used some more. Luckily my husband got his on the side so I used some of his. We also got hummus as a side. Pita bread was warm and fresh. Service was friendly and nice, with staff greeting everyone as they walk in.

pyWgriry_cCgQ3v4tIfIbQ.text: I've been coming to this restaurant since it opened. This is an amazing little cafe. Food is always good. It's not fast food. But it is fantastic food. It's worth waiting for your order to come up. If you are in a hurry and want to take it to go call ahead.   Peter and his crew are always on the move.

ueJ0Agd0pqKHR-lwSzoo4g.text: Highly suggest this place for great Greek food! A key thing I look for is the Tzatziki flavour and it was awesome! Try a chicken souvlaki plate, you get a generous amount of chicken, Greek salad, lemon rice and tzatziki and pita. Reasonably priced. Was super impressed by the service when we recently ordered take out and realized it closed in under 15 minutes but we still called to see and they let us place our take out order! Will definitely be back.

Z5sHEB4w-Yi8FUQkzCyGHw.text: Food was awesome. Great place. Very Clean. Service was some of the best I've had! Counter person was very helpful as I was a first time diner.

O8w_uMa-EZOBJ1YsnszX-A.text: Absolutely delicious!! First time trying Yassou today, I had a major craving for Mediterranean food so decided to stop by here and I was so satisfied with everything. I got the chicken pita with Greek fries and drink and everything was delicious! Service was friendly as well, definitely will be back!

ALijk5uhJwPyAiEXtO5smA.text: Holy mole, this place is amazing.  The food is so good and flavorful.  I ordered the Lemon Herb Chicken Pita and my husband got the My Big Fat Gyro, both were amazing. Food is made fresh and well worth the wait. This place is a gem !

ZbR0wpSo7MD8ynzgazOQ2w.text: I read someone else's review who had ordered the same thing as I did, and we share the same sentiments. The chicken pita & Greek fries were not good. The pita was dry like it was three days old, and the sandwich itself had no flavor. Then oddly enough, on the last bite I hit a mouthful of pure salt. I had to drench it in tzatiki to make it somewhat enjoyable. The fries were hard--not crispy but hard and there was zero flavor as well which is hard to imagine. Hardly any feta, and I threw them away after eating a few. I never add salt to anything but everything needed some sort of seasoning.   The people at the counter were nice, but I don't see myself returning.

ndvk6ToGRuRZpBR9XZp49w.text: Had a rare craving for gyro-ish type food so stopped by for a chicken on pita with feta cheese fries. Not cheap, but the sandwich was good sized and clearly made to order. The chicken was delish, well seasoned and browned nicely. Not overly spiced or seasoned. Often greek places put on too much sauce, but this was pretty taste. I can't tolerate normal cheese fries with the liquid cheese that tastes like it was made in a chemistry lab, but the fresh feta cheese and spices was a perfect partner for the well done, crispy fries. I would definitely come back for round 2.

WmwmX7orI-dagQQFopJgIA.text: All I can say is freshness is key. I just love love love it here. Everything is prepared so neatly and nicely. Tastes great and the employees are amazing.

huV3OowYZgut7Ma11WcUCg.text: Family owned delicious food... I'm really obsessed with the athenian veggie plate right now, but the steak Souvlaki is absolutely out of this world too.  Everything's so fresh and filling... Its not cheap, but definitely worth the price especially for the amount of food you get.  Yum yum yummy.  oh and try their greek fries... SO good...  I crave this place.

uUdtDDOtuXMWA7FvwwLA0Q.text: Working is Vegas this week. Stopped by this place for lunch. I got the "My Big Fat Gyro" lunch deal--gyro, fries and a soft drink. Ouch, $11+ wasn't so much of a deal. Nevertheless, the gyro was tasty. Pita bread was soft and fresh. Meat was tender and flavorful. Big basket of Greek fries that I couldn't finish.  The fellow running the place seemed friendly. The place was certainly hopping at lunchtime. The soda dispenser is self-serve, and I made sure I got my fill of refills, since the lunch was just a tad pricey.  Certainly not the worst Greek I ever ate. Would I eat here again? You betcha.

RjhFRTTeZaETEk2ZyLcxHg.text: The food here is excellent!  Minus 1 star for having Faux News on the TV... what is with these businesses who feel it necessary to show you they can't think for themselves and need fox to tell them what to think.. honestly I usually won't frequent a business that does this... I hope they get the message.

QxgY8xV_OPe4xnXGGxSmZQ.text: Okay, this became my very favorite lunch time spot because my office is (somewhat) close by and THE FOOD IS SO AMAZING. TOP NOTCH, FRESH CRUNCHY VEGTABLES in my salad, the most amazing dressing for the LEMON CHICKEN SALAD, literally it is to-die for. I had Given a bad review for this spot in the past because I was irritated with the system. I would call in my order from work, as i would never have time to wait in line, but then sometimes I would get here at prime lunch time rush hour and have to stand in the endless line just to pay. After I left the review, they entirely made up for this and tweaked the system, and would then allow me to run to the front of the line to make my payment and dash out with my lunch just in time to get back to work on time. THEY SAW MY (kind of rude) REVIEW AND MADE A CHANGE IN THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE. Jeez. Again, top notch, top of the line kind of place right here. thank you, and I love your food, Yassou is da bomb.

1Gdg85Xt_lz7ejLjrDoXmw.text: Co-workers rave about this place so I decided to take a detour on my way home and stop by for lunch.   All I can say is:Yum! this is one of the better Greek restaurants I have eaten at. I ordered the gyro plate. It comes with a Greek salad, rice pilaf, beef and lamb, and pita. I took a seat and minutes later they brought out my plate. The meat is so tender, the pita was nice and warm and the salad was fresh. My only complaint was that although the rice pilaf was soft and fluffy it was a bit too salty for me. But I still ate it and before I knew it my plate was empty and I was stuffed.   As I went to the coke machine for a refill one of the cooks came out for the kitchen and asked how was everything. I still had a mouth full of food so I gave him a thumbs up.

44tn-KF7gfwIhCp05TceMQ.text: Really great Greek good!!! I am obsessed with this place! The workers are very nice and you see the owner back there working in the kitchen. It's a nice hole in the wall kind of place. I love it!

pI7nIAq0FcTOlCkHDLgOEA.text: Best food in town! I could eat here daily. It's a cafe' style restaurant and stays pretty busy. Try the Chicken Souvlaki plate! Rice, salad, pita, and juicy chicken scewered.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yassou Yum!

j1S3Y18R1wlRE4oJTP0SvQ.text: Wow this is probably the best service I have received from any restaurant in Las Vegas. While it's hard to find decent Greek food in town, I would have to say that this is probably #2 on my list. Plus they still accommodated us when we showed up 15 mins prior to closing. There were a couple items that prevented it from getting a 5-star rating. So let's break down the food.   A great way to help judge a Greek restaurant is by ordering their hummus and we did just that. They provided quite a bit of pita and croutons for you to dip in your hummus, unfortunately the hummus had no flavor. There was no lemon zest or taste of olive oil that normally comes through at other places. Heck I'm not much of a salt person and even I thought it needed some sodium.   Next up, we had their Greek fries covered in Greek seasoning, feta and parsley...I thoroughly enjoyed these. These would be so good with a gyro!  Now the main dishes - Your steak souvlaki was overcooked and tough to chew. Your chicken souvlaki was the savior as the robust flavors bursted in my mouth. Ah yes! Your lamb was tender and flavorful. Surprisingly it wasn't very greasy either.  Your tzatziki sauce wasn't as thick and tart as other places. I could swear it tasted more like sour cream than Greek yogurt, but whatever, it was still good. The rice was instant rice which was ok but I love me some homemade rice. The salad was good, mine just had a bit too much dressing.  The owner is a great guy and constantly checked on us to make sure we were satisfied with the food. Though it seems pricey, I thought for 3 people it was a great deal especially all the food we ate.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro &amp; Steak Souvlaki
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro &amp; Chicken Souvlaki
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek fries

1af4GE9TDV4ttiYhrxyFWA.text: Yummy Yummy Yummy! I love Yassou. This place is really laid back, the perfect place for lunch. The food is amazing. I always order the chicken gyro plate with a side feta fries (can't resist). The portions are great and the food is always fresh. Definitely one of the best Greek grilles in Las Vegas.

afpx6oGMHUy8UbggNU17ug.text: LOVE. God I miss it.  Run by a honest-to-goodness Greek family, this place is home-cooked Greek food heaven. And the portions are huge- if you get a plate, you'll have a meal for tomorrow too!  The ambiance isn't great, but let's be honest-- few places in Vegas give you that. If you're in Vegas, you aren't there for the scenery. So get over it.  I digress. Back to the food, oh God the food. The gyros are whopping fistfuls of juicy, perfectly seasoned delight. The spanakopita is just flaky enough to give you the feeling that you're eating something healthy-- but it's Greek, so you're not. The steak souvlaki..... sorry, just choked on my own drool. Perfectly tender, marinated, I'll even lick the skewers those beautiful chunks of meat are served on.  Every time I'm back in town, I make sure to stop here. Still haven't found an equivalent in my new city. I no longer believe that is possible.  ...Now I'm depressed.

Oce-2AOlIStw4l8D1ZWEYw.text: I'm new to the area and asked a coworker were I could find a Greek restaurant. This place did not disappoint! I was skeptical about the wait time because I decided to go inside to place an order for take out. The wait time was short and the food was fresh and delicious.

Oq96s0u8jKerA4Dff2NtAA.text: Hard to beat the food at this place.  The prices are great and the portions huge.  The environment is homey and inviting.  A great spot for lunch.  Try the chicken lemon soup, I hear it's great!

Az086uaoHEEFl57GK-O5sQ.text: Best little bit of money you will spend. Food is made to order and always tastes super fresh. I love the plate with chicken skewers, rice pilaf and salad, a perfect $10 meal. Check them out.

gVU_6IHAiz7GEIMIbS6ysA.text: Love eating here. I have been coming here for years now and they have never disappointed me. I don't think there is anything on the menu I haven't tried. Gyros, salads, pasta and pizza. Everything served here is fresh and awesome. Great customer service and great greek food. What more can you ask for?

2utZct7adp79U8eA4lyJpg.text: I have been coming here for five years now and every meal is great. I highly recommend this restaurant. They are fast, friendly and the food is always fresh!

luFuLIXw3f1QWrNdxZJD_g.text: I am never disappointed when I come here! The food is amazing! I feel like it's really made with love! Sometimes the line is out the door. That's how you know its delicious! The only thing I would like to see is a different set up maybe move the soda machine down so that the line is not interrupting guest that need a refill. Other than that I love this place and I will continue to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Im in heaven

SEsafsDyUGqIieFjZ9k71g.text: Even though I have never traveled to Greece, I feel that every opportunity I have to indulge in Yassou I get a little taste.  First and foremost the staff and atmosphere is great.  The cashier who is there almost everyday and is most likely a member of the family, is fluent in Greek.  One of my friends is studying the language and soon found himself being schooled by the cashier.  The food is quite good and I have had many items on the menu.  I still prefer Market Grills Gyros because you have the option of hummus over the normal spread.  It is also slightly more expensive then market grill so be prepared for that.  But I think the experience here is more authentic.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro Plate

uCKf5ilOeiuFaLIS_CwGZw.text: This place has the best Greek food we have ever tasted.  It's our new favorite spot. The people are so friendly and it feels inviting   I love their Greek pizza.  My husband eats the youri and chicken plate.  I give this place 10 stars if I could.

lo8XBIE6NTE2Ej_jCJTU2A.text: Located off of west charleston just past buffalo. The food is great. Only been here twice and will definitely be back. You get lots of tasty food for your $$. I ordered the double chicken bob. Nice lemony tang and just the right amount of spice. Tender and juicy! Includes rice and Greek salad with pita bread.  5 stars! Check it out for lunch.

zgH_rycBZxiOQgDBD1PXyw.text: Love this place.  Grateful that Yelp friends J. and C. introduced me to this place.  Fell in love after one meal.  The Greek Fries covered in spices and feta cheese were SO good.  Nicely crispy and perfectly complemented by the spices and LOTS of feta cheese.  They went perfectly with the equally tasty Olympic Veggie Pita.  Soft drinks are self-serve and refillable, a plus on hot days.  Parking is ample in the lot but might not be able to park right in front of the restaurant.  Dine-in space is more than you'd expect from looking at the place from the road but probably gets completely full at peak lunch/dinner hours.

T6UsQHWizj8LhRaI85TP-Q.text: This place gets great reviews but I thought it was just alright. Maybe I'm missing something... The steak kabob was decent, but the chicken kabob was better. The portion size of the combo platter was pretty big -- large enough to get two meals out of it.  The super lemon chicken pita was good. Full of chicken, lettuce, tomatoes and other tasty stuff. It's also messy. Grab several napkins especially if you plan to eat on the go.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The super lemon chicken pita
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and chicken combo platter

5TKtNhQGoBbXt_hWmqp2Og.text: Overall good food and would return for another meal... Our experience began oddly... As we were ordering, we were told there was no mango for smoothie... Jokingly, I told  the guy he was fired-- and he was ready to walk-- bad day apparently. After settling our order we sat and were served someone else's order... Which ended up a treat for all of us involved in the snafu (hope the kid who made the mistake isn't punished too harshly-- we left happy) we received the wraps given us in error, plus a complimentary potato caviar dip which I would never have ordered before this but now we will!! We enjoyed our dinner and have lunch for next day too!! And we'll be happy to eat it!!

3jRxV3uNysnRrIBAMbMcSA.text: My favorite for Greek food with a diner atmosphere and low overhead pricing.  Sometimes there is a wait as the food is made to order, but it's worth it.  Some items are prepared ahead of time and reheated to order (saw the moussaka taken from the fridge/freezer and reheated) but still made from scratch and delicious.

4qwspmi0HcLiFdwZthvzCQ.text: Ordered their Greek Lemon Drop Soup for my Greek Grandma and she loved it.  We'll be back to try some more of her favorites.

434VHTnXOu-nPapv6Yhiog.text: Seriously good. You will not be disappointed! I had the super lemon chicken gyro with Greek fries!! Mmmmmmmm!!!!! Wish this place was where I lived!

HNhI_6LqIqP4_QcxwnjqNw.text: Took my food to go: big fat gyro, Greek fries and extra tzatziki sauce. Love this place for both the quality, quantity and price.

YXsqdI43HYVSYjdcNWzheg.text: My favorite greek food restaurant in Las Vegas! They have the best gyro meet in town! Everything is fresh!  They always include feta cheese too.  It's locally owned and the people who work here are very nice!   The only downside is it only works til 8pm. I wish they worked til at least 9 and may be til 10pm Fri and Sat night.   But always stop by here for lunch any time I'm in this part of town!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek gyro lamb meet plate!

gbGGJRBqTA9WtpdB5rGglw.text: This is my favorite Greek restaurant in vegas. Sometimes their service is slow but it's because they are so busy because the food is so good! Service is always friendly though. Food is delicious!!!!

fGNL7W1skbPUFKfcxpv-_w.text: I absolutely love this place. Nice family restaurant and amazing Greek food. We stop by every time (at least once) we're in Vegas and have shared this place with friends and family and they all love it too. Everything I've tried is great but the my big fat gyro sandwich is my go to.

PoKtfRbmey5Yj3swcB1EBg.text: So delish, Jeff was friendly and greeted me and introduced himself right away. This place was recommended to me and  I read their great  reviews and had to try it, even though Mad Greek was a block away from where I was and I knew they wouldn't let me down.  well.......I'm soooo glad I tried Yassou!!!  I too recommend you give it a try, it's great food, affordable, clean and they're all friendly.

Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Fat Gyro

aMKOf_Rfn_7socC5N87L1A.text: We found his place on Yelp, and will never order a Gyro from another place in Vegas as long as we live here!   The first time we came here, the owner was super friendly- even gave us a couple pieces of meat to sample. We ended up each getting a platter combo each (I got chicken, he got steak) but it ended up being too much food for us. All the meats they serve here are amazing, and but what really blew the meal out of the water was the rice pilaf!!   Since our first visit, my boyfriend and I have since come up with our regular order; we each get a Yassou Gyro, an order of rice to share, a couple sodas, and extra tzatziki sauce. The only thing that would make this place better is if they put more tzatziki sauce in the rear of the Gyros, usually it's all up front so when you start unwrapping the tail end, it gets dry. :(

lRZGSAxQ67t4ijVpLdgpyg.text: Best Greek food ever! Seriously I can't stop eating here! We came here 3 times in one week. I have had the lemon chicken gyro and it's soooo soo good! Chicken is juicy and has the perfect amount of lemony taste.  This place gets really busy at lunch so leave enough time to get your food. Owner and staff is also very friendly!

KwI86yr16FADb2_g0OU68A.text: Love the food. Usually service is great too   Today service was terrible- the cashier, which is what dropped the rating down. He argued with another person who said her order was incorrect then went and tossed it back with the rest of the food with a visible attitude about it. Was t very pleasant when our order was taken. Owner wasn't in as he usually is- must have a big impact

EveYxDZax-Hnz2Gf0fN11g.text: I use Pete for catering often!  The Greek salad is amazing, and he truly prepares the best gyro meat in town...the lamb is so tender and flavorful that it melts in your mouth.

nHxJ-GdNajT6hAOqDSpkQg.text: Decent. Open daily.   Very nice workers. Seems to be maybe family owned?   Came mid-day (around 4pm) - they had a lot of chairs flipped on tables to clean (between lunch and dinner time i guess where its not so busy.. still weird) While i was eating, they were cleaning around the restaurant. Upon entrance to the restaurant, almost had the feeling they were closing soon ! i had to double check the hours on the front XD !   I had ordered a steak and gyro plate. The rice was not that good. Steak was over-cooked and dry. Gyro meat was good but didnt make up for the previous too because it didnt really have any accompanyment to eat together with. Another sad thing was the pita bread couldnt be opened to make pockets for me to stuff and eat like i can at other Mediterranean/greek places.

F8bX4f0s41QAThCPXKJk2g.text: All I have had here is the Greek Salad and the Greek Fries.  With that said, let me tell you how much I love both these items....together...one on top of the other!  It is a marriage made in heaven and before a big test I must have this for comfort!  Will return after the stress of nursing school has left my life to try a Gyro that I have seen in many reviews :)

rhFnZMRR_mpD1fj6Gkhd6Q.text: I love the food here but service is clearly an issue.  Went to eat here with my boyfriend and it's like they forgot about us.  There were only two tables in the restaurant, and people were coming in and placing orders to go.  About three of these to go orders that were made after us were given out before they decided to cook ours.  We arrived with plenty of time to eat but because of this we got our food very close to closing time, and felt like we had to rush to eat.  Not cool.  The food was great, but the service ruined the experience for us.  We're not terribly picky people or anything either.

H8xK0GYFi8DCHEfCc4TGSQ.text: I love this place. Everytime I go I get a consistently tasty gyro. The staff is always friendly and food is always great. This is my favorite spot for gyros in Vegas.

nvEkVuYeO-GORx7ywZsorQ.text: My favorite Greek place! I always order the Gyro salad and steak souvlaki plate and eat the leftovers the next day!

k7eG-hR0pvLbPjpAQnoBqQ.text: This is the best Greek place in town we are NEVER disappointed!! You have to try it. Say hi to Christian and Pete

C6lqbxbA8nqNxS_6uAeReg.text: We tried Yassou today, as we've been looking for good gyros since leaving Ohio where a strong Greek community resides. We each ordered the My Big Fat Gyro, and one of us had the salad + rice pilaf for an extra $2.49 while the other got the fries.  The gyros were not bad. They are a mix of beef and lamb and definitely worthy of the Fat name. We did not find them to be better than the gyros we've had in Ohio, but they were still good. I think much of the flavor came from salt, to be honest.  I was surprised by the rice pilaf, which gets high reviews. All I got was rice cooked in chicken broth- basically, yellow-hued rice with nothing more in it. That's not pilaf.  The Greek salad came with no vinaigrette- no salad dressing whatsoever. It was Greek by virtue of the feta and single olive that came with it, I guess.  The American fries were fine- just normal.

-ZTXaiFZeRbrFu1WROfNjQ.text: Never disappointed here. Everything is great! Food is fresh, fast, and delicious. Perfectly cooked gyro meat. Wonderful iced tea. The staff is friendly and completely on top of things.

bpyH2RHmLKV8erbqj0hg-g.text: We had the Greek Salad and Beef Gyro with a side of rice pilaf. I must say it is one of the best Mediterranean restaurants here in Vegas. Definitely coming back for more

G9igQkBdU-taP6UciMKU5w.text: I love my Greek food!  Yassou doesn't dissapoint.  After trying multiple dishes at this location I have settled on the Souvlaki Combo, delish.  You get your chicken and steak kabob's, salad, rice, pita/hummus.    I usually come in an hour or two before closing and the food is still up kept.  My Souvlaki Combo never dissapoints, either protein is always cooked perfectly.  One time they were out of rice and offered Greek fries as a substitute.  It was not bad at all but I like the rice better. The dining area is usually kept clean but there's not a lot of seats inside.    There was nothing unusual about the place or food except for maybe the restrooms.  They're not gender specific so pick and choose one without feeling weird about walking into the wrong bathroom.  Deserts:  Baklavah, really good.  I had to stop eating it because I didn't want to have a heart attack afterwards during work!

Rm9kL3om5PQJhBq7IbppFw.text: BF were in the area and hungry so I popped in on Yelp to find a place and Yassou came up. I also saw that there was a coupon for $5 off $20 here: citycoups.com/yassougree... so we were sold. When we got there, the lady at the counter is firm that you MUST print out the coupon off the website. Kinda a bummer considering I was already in front of their place, saw that ad and because of it decided to come in. We shared- Super lemon chicken pita sandwich ($6.79)- the difference with the super and regular lemon chicken is theres more meat and feta cheese in it. I think the super is the way to go since the feta helped meld the chicken, lemon, tzatziki all together. I think this is definitely something I'd get again and recommend getting here. Gyro and Spanakopita plate ($8.59)- the gyro meat is pretty standard good, salad greens were fresh, pilaf is good, pita is soft. I appreciated that the spanakopita wasn't greasy, but it was just missing something for me so the plate over all was just okay. It's order at the counter and find a seat so I don't have much to say about service other than what I stated above. Prices are reasonable and it's a cute little place If I'm in the area, I might stop in for that super lemon chicken sandwich but so far my overall impression is that this isn't I'd go drive all the way down for.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanakopita and gyro plate
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super lemon chicken pita

RYI2A-QlP3-2PPspGGHI4Q.text: Best authentic Greek food in town. Privately owned and not a chain. I go here all the time for the great quality and full menu.

N31zcHD7JUDajT2RQ8s-iA.text: One of the best Greek places in town.  I have been here on a couple of different lunch outings.  We may sit in different seats every time we dine at YGGC but the one thing that never changes is the friendly service AND the super tasty, fresh chow.  The veggies are crispy, the meat is succulent (first time typing that word, thank you spell check!).  Beware the parking can be a bit insane depending on when you eat.  Remember if you have to eat fries, eat the Greek fries.

5PAF-n6r-Nuesx5_PBRFJg.text: Excellent food. Layout and atmosphere are strange. Feels like they can't decide if they want to be a restaurant or a fast food joint. Not saying the food is that quality, just the look of the place makes it feel that way. Was not at all what I expected. Definitely more of a quick-casual place than a sit down lunch as I had expected.  Back to the food though. Ordered the "My Big Fat Gyro" and it was delicious. I wanted to get another one. Had Flame broiled beef & lamb with feta cheese. Also comes with Tzaziki sauce but I'm not a fan of that so had them hold it. Didn't need it anyway.   Kacey ordered the Souvlaki Combo with Chicken and Steak. The chicken was really good. Steak was just ok I thought. A little tough for my liking but that may be the way its supposed to be made in that dish.  Thought about trying the baklava but it was just sitting out uncovered on top of a display cooler right next to a table where people were eating. I'll pass.  Service was decent for a quick casual spot. I'll definitely be back. They should really do some updating and freshen the place up a bit though.

NwtHiFQATvXaZOSDfTPghA.text: I am a freak for greek food and I had heard from my co-workers that this was a great place. Being that it is right down the street from work, I decided to try it out today. I took an early lunch and showed up and there is already a line to the door. Good sign. I ordered a greek salad with gyro and lemon chicken to go. It took close to 30 minutes to come out. I understand that they were swamped, but if it's like that everyday I suggest hiring more than one person to take orders and run orders and have more than two people in the kitchen. Highlight was that the salad was amazing. I will be back, but I will likely call in my order next time so I don't have to wait so long.

PZ8VeSwAXSwoJKrcKfrn-w.text: On their menu it says "Greek food never tasted so Greek."  And I agree!  We found this gem because it is located next to Hottie Hair Salon.  We came during lunch last week and the place was BOOMING!  We had to pile into a line that was poking out the door.  Every table was taken (except for outside) and we were worried that we wouldn't be able to find a table big enough to accommodate our party of five.  Luckily, we came a bit later than noon.  By the time it was our turn to order, the tables had cleared out some and we were able to grab a seat.  I was torn on what to get, but I was kind of hungry so instead of opting for the "My Big Fat Gyro" which comes with fries and a drink, I ordered the "Gryo Plate."  The plate came with beef and lamb, greek salad, rice, pita bread and tzatziki sauce.  It took about 10 minutes for our food to come, but the sign at the counter says to please allow 15 minutes.   At this time I was so hungry that I grabbed a piece of pita, put some meat in it and tzatziki sauce.  I took a bite and I couldn't help but be startled by what I did next.  I uncontrollably said "WOW!"  I had surprised myself when I did that, but it really was that good.  The food was fresh and delicious.  The plate offers very large portions.  I felt like I got a bargain for the price that I paid.  The employees were efficient and friendly.  The place was really busy and I could TASTE why.  Next time I come I am getting the "My Big Fat Gryo" special with american fries and a drink.   I am hoping to eat there again soon for lunch.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Fat Greek.  Steak Fries, Gyro and a drink for CHEAP!

cgN6MH1bAg7LB1C93_E5yQ.text: This is one of our favorite local spots in Vegas for lunch. The food is consistent and delicious. This family-owned and run restaurant is a great option for a delicious lunch or dinner. We often share an order of Saganyaki (fried cheese!!!) and then it's either the Big Fat Gyro of the steak souvlaki pita for me!

ET4eXGDe1FwavzKQzoqNJw.text: My husband and I have been coming to this restaurant for years. They have the best hummus in town ( in my opinion). The food is always great, the staff is always friendly. We've never had a bad experience. Love this place!

AhMUg_Kb-0PjjDGSM8Azkw.text: So amazing not gonna lie just orgasmed in my mouth eating this place.. I'm definitely coming back to this place best Greek place in town by far

mWpSA86JZy4I25FzCanurQ.text: I love this place! Best Greek food in Las Vegas...even better than Greek food I use to get In NYC!

GxyGnwGwZLu7JFUqE_rG0A.text: This place is AMAZING. Authentic, and delicious. There is a huge selection and everything you might want is represented. They even have pastitio, which I rarely find, and it is absolutely delicious. All of the souvlaki selections are tasty and the portions are HUGE. Even the rice is fantastic. The food is consistent and made pretty quickly despite being extremely busy at all times. I'm serious. If you like Greek food....come here.

3Uy4eJNjiUONNQv3B0uimQ.text: Food is AMAZING!!! So fresh!! And the most pleasant professional staff ever!!! Vegas' best kept secret!!

RJhgm7-89p5tRYJzOA57aA.text: Favorite Greek food in Vegas. Prices, portions and service are great but the food is AMAZING! Trust me once you go you won't ever stop going back. Of course ordering to dine in is always best however, I've also ordered for pick up and for delivery (through door dash) and have never had any issues. The food is always delicious. I definitely recommend the Super Lemon Herb Chicken pita as that's my number one choice but all of their options are delicious. Enjoy!

vJb_DTarxtkkkLSID2Y8Lg.text: This is mine and my husband's spot. We could eat here every day! We love the food, we love the staff, we just love it all. (Oh and best pita bread ever!) Thanks so much to everyone at Yassou!

-SscV-CSfwbAX1hPgaxFBw.text: Great service with even greater food! Thank you Christian for helping me locate the restaurant on maps it gets you lost in a residential area. Definitely a regular now only place that satisfies my Herculean appetite

8mXcWa-jaExpCJNICLOM8Q.text: I just had to say that this is absolutely one of my favorite Greek food places to go to. I've been coming here for years & every time someone asks what's my favorite Greek food place, I always say this one. Everyone is super nice here! Peter the owner always has a smile on his face, along with Christian & Sarah. I go there so much that Sarah even knows my order and even my voice when I call in :) also, my family always order catering for little house events & they are always on time & quality of food/freshness is always on point. If you haven't tried this place, you should definitely make an effort to do so. I promise you won't be disappointed!

ZTKSbOSt8cBIuTRu3_tgPw.text: Very good.  overcooked fries last 2 visits. Best Gyros in town in my opinion. Nice restaurant

AdYNF2s1rPo6OceS5h2ziA.text: The owner is so friendly And loving. the food is by far the best.  excellent customer service !!Stop by and  grab a meal you won't be disappointed and if there's a line It's worth it !!!

TUBVzrHgslBMje7rB7P-cg.text: Been going here longer than I can remember. I usually call my order in by phone and the timing is on point for collection. Not only is the food delicious beyond words but the portion amounts are generous and excellent value. The steak and chicken plates are succulent, full of flavor and every bite is just joyous. You always get a warm welcome and treated and greeted like a family member. Thank you Yassou. Cadillac Al

KX-p8GaVQiTGw0DPPV3_oA.text: I being I greece and tried their amazing food, we are lucky to have this piece of Greece right here by our house!!! The best part, is a family run place and you can feel the love in their flavors!!!

bYptroqJdUHhzIgES8cnsA.text: Hands down the best Greek fast food/Gyro/Souvlaki place in Las Vegas!!! Spanakopita are wonderful....Rice Pilaf is superb.... Only thing on the menu I don,t like are the Dolmades...  One question though....They have chicken souvlaki, pork souvlaki and beef souvlaki....                                                                                     WHY NO LAMB SOUVLAKI??????  Still....Highly Recommended :-)

OHmEfHvI52klRTJ_S14gSA.text: This use to be my favorite Greek restaurant in Vegas, a few years ago I had the worst experience and was beyond disappointed, I found two long black hairs in my salad, so I never wrote a review on that experience, I just never returned. Chris offered to remake my salad, but I just could not enjoy it like before. Ok so this weekend my husband recommended I try it again, so I agreed , big mistake! I was serving the dressing on my kabob, and was was disgusted again, found a short thin hair in the dressing!  I told my husband don't ever ask me to eat from this place again!!! So gross!! I would hope that they get their employees to wear hairnets!!

JpIETENVkci4yOC8pVuBfQ.text: Great first time experience for lunch today.  Co-worker and I are fans of Mediterranean food and have Yassou's a try.  Great food - made to order.  Friendly staff made the experience that much better.  Will be back!

_KEjLsEWA5A8TrgdjyhbxA.text: Skip this place, go to Khourys.   Really good food, if you can actually get what you ordered...they have messed up my order three times in a row. They are pretty big mistakes- chicken instead of steak, plates instead of sandwiches- and they never fix it. Somehow I end up paying for the more expensive item as well even if it's not what I wanted. I have kept coming back because it tastes good, but the frustration and disappointment is becoming too much.

KmiZ4j8Cga9RhQNGZIwIuw.text: This is one of our go to places in Vegas whenever we come down! While we enjoy good food, we're not huge Greek food fans. Yassou has changed us. Whenever we visit, this is automatically on the itinerary! We LOVE it!! You need to try this place!!!!

gRRz1dkaSgixPnDt5LZOUg.text: I had lunch there and ordered the chicken lunch special  to go.   My order took over 25 minutes.   The girl at the counter was nice enough to give me a cup so I got some diet coke.  I waited another 5 more minutes to get my lunch.  As I was leaving one of the cooks yells out in front of everyone at the restaurant "water cups are for water".   Really,  I waited over 30 minutes to get my lunch order and he has the nerve to do that. They should have given me a free drink for the long wait.   They just lost a good customer.  The food isn't great anyway and the place is dirty.   Food on the counter looked like there was mold on it.    Sultan's Grill is way better Greek Food!.  YASSOU LOST MY BUSINESS!!

K8Ff8SfHtzmFnEDimxuVVQ.text: Their big fat Gyro and Greek fries are my favorite, I love the ambience and even when it gets a little busy the staff is always kind. Definitely give it a try

yZ-QnPC0dB-PAeo_9sAvog.text: Amazing food!  If you're looking for a great, family owned business with a friendly staff this is it!  I love the spanikopita, which is crispy and delicious, and the rice is great. Highly recommend!

Z8zol-aKXT_xi4mux9p2zQ.text: Love yassou Greek grill cafe. This place has been around for years for a good reason. They're food is really the best Greek food fast, in Las Vegas !!!! Love going there.

_iEWJcCXRJeJtCorANfdMA.text: One of my favorite places to get Greek food! The plates are so good, rice and gyro, steak plates, pita, you name it--Just get it to go, because the atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired.  It's more cafeteria style than restaurant.  But the food is very good.  The steak in the steak salad is juicy and flavorful, and just the right amount.  The salad greens are fresh and perked up with herbs and a rich salad dressing.  The gyro sandwich is very generously stuffed with lamb and pork.  The french fries are meh.  The Greek fries are not quite right, either.  But get the hummus and pita instead, which is much better than the grocery store variety (if you've been getting by on that kind.)  The baklava is quite nice, rich, and not too sweet, but really sticky--in a nice way.  Try the sparking Greek water.  Call ahead and order for pick up.  It is much better than waiting, if you're going to take out (the best way to do here).  They can get backed up, and depending on who is up front, it can be a bit slow.  But believe it or not, it can even be romantic here, in the evening.

wrQ7tOyAnS6Z46F61xediQ.text: This is my new regular and FAVORITE spot for a healthy and delicious meal!  The owner is super friendly and so is the staff.  I highly recommend the Greek salad with beef - super tender and flavorful!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad with steak

PVy4DGftNzjhiEu7dohg_Q.text: Omg! Soo good. I came here on recommendation from a friend. I will definitely come back. Go the gyro plate.  It comes freshly sliced gyro meat with buttery and lemony rice pilaf and a salad with feta cheese sprinkled on top. Around $10. The portion is large enough for two to share. Will come back for sure.

usWoYrq6yJT5BYFQh3HkCw.text: Amazing food and service. Great place to go. Love it always.  Yum yum.  Best gyro shop in town.  Great stuff.

pl5_lfmdtbj-x_cC3rGX9w.text: Okay, this is pretty much a brand new restaurant. So, maybe they're working The Kinks out. I ordered the filet Kabob. The menu says filet mignon. Yeah, I don't think so. I'll try again and update my review later. The stuffed grape leaves were not bad. The  humas was pretty authentic.

B8yBK38IwpkTOno_MJdYkQ.text: THE BEST GREEK FOOD IN VEGAS hands down!!!!!! Family owned and operated they always care about quality of their food.  My husband and I have been coming to this place for years and never ever had bad meal or bad service! Unfortunately we moved to a different part of town and cannot come too often, but we definitely make sure we visit them few times a year.  I can never get enough of their rice! Chicken souvlaki and Greek salad are my favorites. As well as their "Greek lasagna" - pasticio.  My husband loves their gyros.  We bring our family here every time they visit out of town. Everyone we brought to Yassou, loved it and wanted more :) Amazing food!!! Nightly recommend!!!!!!!

tPxvQF_rBN5CJjh1Ho-yMw.text: Okay seriously I freaking love this place. Everything here is delicious the owner is always here working with his son. It's just amazing food with great service!!

hSfa8i687iRaR6T_R28_aQ.text: the restaurant is located at Charleston and Buffalo. Their menu has all the standard Greek favorites such as Gyros, Spanakopita, and Dolmades. They also have Greek Fries which is served crispy and piping hot and drenched in garlic, spices and feta cheese.   I love their Greek fries and Big fat Gyro and it was enough for two people. The price is decent and the service is good. You order at their counter and they deliver their food to your table.  The atmosphere is casual, clean and have outside seating. It is good place for me to bring a  small get together party.

vG7VcwM952funY1vNg9_TQ.text: I love this place! As a vegetarian they have a lot of options, but my favorite is the veggie gyro with Greek fries! Everything I've had here is delicious. The restaurant is clean and the service is great. I would definitely recommend it, 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie gyro with Greek fries! My favorite

5frWBsteh-FPDLkHkPte_g.text: Best Greek food in Vegas!!! The Papas family always delivers. Can't go wrong with any item you order.  Make it a must eat joint

NQq3tW4QGuq_AGD9nkojvw.text: Omg, if you want a fabulous fresh meal, this is the place to go.  Their salmon is out of this world, the best in town. The lemon sauce is wonderful and the fish is fresh and moist.   We have been coming here for many years and have never been disappointed.   The staff is friendly and the owner takes pride in his restaurant.    You will not be disappointed.

IHVLUtd5WjY5K6J0j_IPFw.text: I had a last minute dinner party for 20 people on a Tuesday!  I called Yassou's and ordered chicken and steak souvlaki, with salad, rice, hummus and baklava.  The food was incredible...as always!  The meat was perfectly cooked and beautifully prepared.  I have ordered catering from here 5 times now, and they NEVER let me down!  Opa! And thank you from one Greek to another!

RwrPrj3TWTHrKzrqeHJxDw.text: This is our go to simple easy yummy favorite. Family favorite. And we love the sweet awesome workers. So happy to go there all the time. Bomb town chicken

BQm5-7O5ZOZo9GmXhsqI5A.text: Good food. If you order a gyro (I always do!) you might want to ask for sauce on the side otherwise they just put a little bit right on top. Besides that it's always been awesome!

eJbE0WYXJ4BVOXkkKlllDw.text: I've been coming to yassous for 9 years and I'd say they've stayed consistent throughout all these years. I tend to always order the same things bc I'm a creature of habit and it's just really tasty.  They are family run with the dad cooking in the back most of the time and his son running the front. I get the avgolemo (lemon rice soup) mmmmmm you must try it! Also the big fats are insanely good and you can't forget dessert with there scrumptious baklava. I highly recommend and will continue to come here as often as I can. Great customer service.

Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach pie is to die for
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro and spinach pie combo with rice pilaf and Greek salad

wjVUS33wJzWuJSchdVUTvQ.text: I wrote this review on Google but felt a need to stress how I feel on Yelp as well so here is my review:  Oh man!!! Words cant begin to express how excited I am to have found such an incredible greek restaurant. I just spent tons of time in Greece and didn't think I'd ever be able to recreate the experience of eating the most delicious, homemade, WARM dolmades. At first I ordered the lemon chicken salad which was to die for but then I figured I'd try an order of the dolmades. Best decision I've ever made! The food came out quick, was reasonably priced and truly outstanding. Jack was helpful, nice and answered lots of my questions. He was fantastic, polite and patient with me. What a great experience- can't wait to come here as much as possible and become a regular :) thank you for such a lovely and authentic meal.

X1cJtjT9IdLjHHAs-kjuZA.text: Great atmosphere authentic feel and food we really enjoy coming here . The souvlaki is amazing and the have the best tzatziki sauce love it . Try the Greek fries !

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Souvlaki !

P9xYSgY7GDv5_XCMzfqd6g.text: This place is so delicious! The restaurant itself is a bit small and tucked away, but none the less the food is  good. The portions are pretty generous and the prices are not bad.

2K-9z8WkeyZgFWexb4IpXA.text: The Big Fat Gyro is the best I've had in Las Vegas, though I'll try to convince myself to order something different the next time I come here. Why? Because that damn gyro is as big as my head! I couldn't even finish it all. Garlic fries were good as well. This is an order at the counter and take a number back to your table kind of place. They'll bring it to you, don't worry. The place has a casual diner style ambience with a nice patio and super friendly service. The pricing is perfect as well. For two people, we only spent $20 on two big fat gyro combos with greek fries (blue cheese and garlic). The restaurant and parking lot were absolutely packed when we came, and I can definitely see why. This is clearly a local gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro chicken souvlaki plate

9NI7qAEMQm0C7nleAL4NVw.text: This is My favorite restaurant in town best in vegas.I eat there 2 to 3 times a week the food is fresh the price is right and the service is great it's a family owned business everyone should try it you'll love it you wont get better than this

1UGWYu-iprUXmoCJIiMzXA.text: Yummy! I love the pork skewers and salad! Lots of good stuff here. So far all I've tried here has been thumbs up! This place has a great vibe and location.

dvRRU-CxF69af2p9Lh7zQw.text: Best Greek food that I've had in town. I've been coming here for over ten years and I love it. The same family has been operating this restaurant for years and you can tell they pay attention to detail. My favorites include the hummus plate with the Gyro plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro Plate

_kgMCTTdYfwSl2H431RSYg.text: Had dinner here over the weekend. We ordered the gyro plate comes with salad n rice. Always fresh. I love their Greek fries. It's all very delicious. The meat nice n tender the pita bread nice n soft. The owner is very friendly. He comes n say hi to his customers when he has time. I never had a bad experience. I will continue to come back. :)

f3wRhOpc7IuAuBR0vMFGVw.text: I've tried my big fat gyro, the steak pita, and the gyro and steak souvlaki combo plate. Everything I've tried here have been insanely good. I didn't think I could finish the gyro and the pita but found myself devouring it. The gyro and steak souklaki combo plate is a huge serving. The steak was cooked perfectly. It went well with the rice pilaf and salad. The tzatziki sauce is addicting! I almost came back the next day to order it again. Customer service is friendly and excellent. An excellent choice to satisfy your Greek food craving!
