SBgXIpR4kmNA22-k8PjhzA.text: My wife heard about his place from a friend. Being part Greek I have yet to find a great place serving authentic taste! Until now! This place was great! Food was perfect and atmosphere was quaint and family friendly. Felt at home and very relaxed. Could tell from the moment I walked in food would be perfect as Owner was at front counter greeting you as you walk in and working his restaurant. A lot of love, pride, and hard work goes into this place.  Great food, great place! Will be back soon!  OPA!!!

VIT6bmkJr2reT_bvr-Ct-g.text: Super friendly service and food is ALWAYS good! I've been coming here for years and it has never let me down! The best Greek food in town!

c0ktBQrwneES7q4iHHQSyg.text: I Yelped this place before I took off for my trip to Las Vegas and I was determined to get here, even though I was dead tired from the drive and it was a little ways from my hotel. I ventured out and I`m really glad I did. This place is really good and hit the spot. I was looking for something quick yet fresh and healthy. I came to this little spot and was not disappointed.   The front counter person greeted me when I came through the door and took my order right away. I knew exactly what I wanted because I had been stalking their menu for several days online. I opted for their Greek salad with herb lemon chicken and a side of fries. Regular, please. I said "regular" and the guy corrected me and said "American". Potato. Poe-ta-toe. I didn`t want Greek fries that day, I`m sorry. Next time for sure.   I did have to wait a little while for my order(I ordered to go) but I didn`t mind. They were busy and I like places that are busy because it usually means that it is good. The salad to go container was filled to the brim with goodness. The salad was really amazing and they gave me TWO dressings(Thank you for not being cheap!). I thought it was really tasty and I wish I had one right now because I`m hungry. I want to go back and check out the rest of their offerings when I`m in town.  Go here. Go Greek. Good stuff.

MoLAkIbV13FmtZlq8GnH8Q.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!! Amazing gyros!!! Also love the salads here too!! So tasty and good family owned place! The gyro meat is the real deal here!! And the dessert is so good!! Baklava is so good and also the rice pudding!!!

Rxd7-iEyLiguK7JfX1e3Nw.text: If I could give Yassou's 10 stars I would do it in a heartbeat.  Absolutely THE BEST gyro (big fat) in the valley.  We have tried them all and if you want the best for Greek food then this is it.  Prices are very reasonable, portions are huge.  The owner works behind the line and he works hard - yet always finds a minute to look up and wave or say hi, especially when he sees the hubby's Yankees hat!  Awesome food, friendly staff, clean restaurant, great prices, you can't ask for anything more.

13xE5uEMzdj0uddhwuZP7w.text: so i tried this place twice just to make sure before my review. To me this place is just average. It wasn't great and it wasn't bad. i just think the rating of 4.5 stars is a bit of an over reach. either people don't know what above average is or they have no taste. the first time was the gyro platter second time was the big gyro sandwich. Both times the meat was dried out,was not moist or tender and was just an overall uninspiring meal. I also don't like being nickle and dimed for extra sauce is it really gonna break you guys? offer a proper size of sauce with each meal then customers wouldn't need to ask for it and be charged 50 cents extra. I guess i have been exposed to much better and therefore I am more critical. It seems that in las vegas anything approaching average is considered out of this world,I have seen this at many restaurants here.

llwWY1EqsiLZTA_nY_ULqA.text: Was craving a good Gyro and after a Yelp search decided on this place! The reviews do not lie, one of the best Gyro's I've had in a long time! Got the Big Fat special which includes a Big Fat Gyro, fries (which I upgraded to greek fries for a small upcharge) and a regular fountain soda. Total came out to about $12 which is not bad because the Gyro was definitely big, fat, delicious! The fries were also very good - nice and hot on the inside, crispy on the outside, just like good fries should be. Highly recommend and will come back again next time I have a craving.

akdTO1DbDcNrg-bS41K2OA.text: This place is clean and bright, nicely decorated and seemingly well managed. I went here for lunch with a bunch of other ladies for a meetup group last Sunday. Whoever got there first was to find seating for all of us to sit together. There were 14 of us. My friend and I were the first to arrive, so took a look around and saw that there are three options for seating. Most people sit inside which is the same place as where you order (at the counter). But they also have an outdoor patio and a separate dining room enclosed in glass which was not open. So I asked if we could all sit in that room and they said sure and opened it up for us.  We were able to get about 4 tables put together where we all sat in a row on each side of the tables and on the ends. They brought everyone's order out to us in a reasonably consistent time. We didn't wait too long for the food either. No one had any problems with their order as far as I could tell and we had a great time with great food. Lots of the ladies were saying the food was very good.  Personally, I ordered the Super Lemon Chicken Pita. It is the larger of the two Lemon Chicken Pitas but not much more money that the smaller one. It was delicious. I forgot to tell them no onions, so I picked off the slices of red onion. I was glad they were not chopped fine!  When we left, they were loading up a van for a big delivery of food. I was impressed that they handled all of us unexpectedly at the same time they were preparing a catering job. And just as they did with us, they brought the food out to the van quickly with several people carrying things out.   I would not hesitate to return here or recommend it to anyone. Great place and I will be returning!

hdoY7gnztvcvl-PFX7fKKg.text: The workers were kind and greeted us well, and I recommend the big fat special if you're really hungry. Their gyros are amazing and their Greek fries are really good too.

8nL-ObnKtQVDxWnpGWokow.text: Busy place! We ate here on a Tuesday around noon and the parking lot was full. Food took  a while to receive, but it was worth the wait. I ordered the Souvlaki combo - grilled chicken and beef skewers served with rice, greek salad, and tzatziki sauce. The total with a soda came out to about $13.00. The chicken and beef were seasoned very well, a little dry, but still very tasty. The rice was absolutely amazing though, full with flavor. My friend got an order of the greek fries and they are a MUST try! Super crispy and tasty fries. Thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Souvlaki combo

7cMvrmi11eQTh4AzA8UovQ.text: This is by far the best Greek restaurant in Vegas. The gyro has been seasoned to perfection and the portions are generous.

b5JE3_RDON_SC-pr-LWZTg.text: I guess this would be an okay place to eat if you're leaving the Social Security office down the block and are literally about to die of old age and want to have one last gyros sandwich before you go. But otherwise, meh.  We had lunch here and it was unremarkable. A Greek salad and gyros sandwich were both without any standout features. French fries were obviously from a bag, frozen. Not worth the calories. The sandwich had too much lettuce and not enough onion on the gyros sandwich, so it was bland, and tomato diced, and on top, which made the sandwich unnecessarily messy.  The service was friendly and the dining room was bright, spacious and sunny - and the presence of a coffee bar is definitely a plus - but I won't be back.

OaYVf5UjDQJz3tq49QGkvA.text: What a waste of 40 minutes. . My husband asked where our order was and they said it was coming out next. 15 minutes later, still no food. Gave our order to some other table. Asked for our money back then left. Can't say if the food was good since we never got to try any. Will NOT be going back - even for take out. This is my first negative comment about a restaurant on yelp. I always like to write about great service and food only but I'm fairly pissed that no one there really cared. Need more employees to handle the crowds.

wL0XM9OaOv6bRV_I1vWL1w.text: I had the big fat gyro...it was okay, but the main issue I had was that it was so salty.  My boyfriend had one of the plates, and he did not like the excess salt content either.   We were drinking water hours afterwards.  The place I think needs a little TLC.  Pictures do not depict what it is really like.  The bathroom was really dirty, a real turn off.   I doubt we will return.

eB_ZiTjtSDfkJNBV23AxOQ.text: if you want experience a family run Greek restaurant this is the place to go. it is by Summerlin area, ample parking and very friendly staff. the food is fresh, delicious and good  portions.  restaurant is clean and gives you the Greek vibe with all white interior with lots of Greek photos and accent pieces. The prices ranges from about eight dollars to about $12 which slut bag. check out this place with your family.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H0aRPgNVGfSTWOI6ZptIPw.text: Good food good environment, went around 2 pm they weren't busy but it took 25 minutes to get our food. The people who ordered right in front of us (same items) got their food 15 minutes sooner.  I will go back again I just hope the food doesn't take as long to arrive. Without the wait I would give 4 stars.

J6TPneBXNfARyKUuq33Xuw.text: Best Greek Food in Las Vegas!!! Seriously the best ever! Whenever I get the cravings for Greek food or if anyone I'm with asks where to find good Greek food I always bring them here.   So if you've never been to Yassou and want recommendations on what to get I'll give you a few of my personal favorites.   As far as sides go, I always get either the Greek fries which are perfectly seasoned with big chunks of feta though out or my favorite the spanakopita which is perfectly flaky with the spinach always hot and the feta blended into it and melted all the way through. If you want to stay traditional then they have great hummus and soft pita as well.   On to the main course, I always get the super lemon herb steak pita which is amazingly tantalizing. The pita is always fresh and warm with tender with juicy bits of perfectly marinated steak and chunks of ripe tomatoes and slices of onions and lettuce and feta. It comes with a slice of lemon. Sooooo good! Also the Chicken Souvlaki is pretty good too. But the pitas are always bomb!   For dessert I always get the baklava. Theirs is the best! Fresh honey dripping off every bite.   Like I said if you want the best Greek food than try Yassou. I think it's as good as it is because it's family owned and you can tell they really care about giving their customers the best food and service they can.

DyT9qIJD03WqxA7542pz1w.text: Yassou!!! We are very pleased with our choice to try this restaurant that we found on Yelp. We loved the gyro pizzzzzzzza, and the pasticio and dolmadas were just like our YiaYia makes. We had good, friendly service and a great lunch. The prices are very reasonable for the quality and amount of food. Only $50.00 for four adults and one kid with drinks. Plenty of food. We are from out of town, but will come back next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro pizzzzzzzza, wow, amazingly good flavor!!

Pbjzn2GNgFJNg3nvG1XbQQ.text: I have to say that Yassou is THE BEST in the business. Coming from the east coast and from a Greek family...this place has been my salvation. I cannot rave about it enough. I highly recommend it!!!

GnKx9DsDQyYLBJNINMMhPA.text: I ordered the Fat Big Greek gyro with a Greek salad for lunch. I had high expectations for this place because of the reviews and crowded restaurant. Unfortunately they were not met. They used white onions rather then purple on the gyro, wasn't too fond of that. The meat had no flavor and they provided very little tzatziki sauce.

Q4NXwVDPPcxs5a5NCqEaCA.text: Have enjoyed great food but last two times I called for delivery (a week apart) they did not have a driver available on a Wednesday night and today after visiting their website and ready to order a substantial worth of food I was informed they don't deliver unless it's a large party? Please change your website as it is misinformed. You guys have great food but being let down again does not persuade me to visit again.

eZkbaYKDVJCa_mY_HeeIZw.text: I heard great things about place but but the one reason I'm giving this place two stars is because of bad management. The one time I went there to get their legendary lemon-herb chicken soup is when they were out. And, it was only 3pm. I was still recovering from a fever so my trip to tget food took way longer. I'll probably give this place another try sometime but until then this place has left a bad taste in my mouth--so to speak.

3q9-zixznvM6aj8XKYd6lg.text: I was staying with friends in the area and wanted to try something different for dinner.  Thanks to Yelp with my search for a restaurant nearby, I found Yassou's.  My friend's meal was delicious as was my grilled chicken in a lemon marinate.  The grandson of the original owner came by our table to welcome us and to make sure we were happy with our food.  I wish I had a similar place like this back home.  The good news is that my friend, whom lives nearby, can't wait to bring her husband here, knowing he will love it.  And when I come back to visit, I will definitely be back to try another dish!

BvL9BFVQ8PevIt3Ok3GOSg.text: I don't usually review places...but this place deserves 5 stars!!! Great food, awesome friendly staff! I live close by and come here often! Several times they have brought us free hummus and bread! I bring all of my out of town guests here!!

txWCI514HFY9n9jXuOv4Yw.text: The first thing you notice when you walk in is how clean everything is, as well as how good the food smells. We ordered gyros and the Greek fries. The food was great, everything tasted like it was made with fresh, quality ingredients. Service was above and beyond as well. So good. We will be back!

-ObpfHKaDeSc-T8IhPJrRg.text: Regular customer for several years.  I have to say the food is consistently delicious.  The fresh dolmades are excellent, best in town hands down.  Everyone is always friendly and helpful.  I've tried several other Greek/Mediterranean restaurants but Yassou's tops them all!  Worth the $, the quality of the food + large portions are totally worth their prices.

SnjJrAN0fB0w0pVak_Hyhg.text: I tried this place for the first time yesterday. I ordered the Souvlaki Combo (beef and chicken skewers with greek salad, rice pilaf and pita bread). The beef and chicken skewers were seasoned well. The beef could have been more tender. The pita bread was my favorite. Very fresh and soft. The thing that ruined it for me was the rice pilaf. This is the first time I have ever been served yellow rice with a greek dish. I would eat here again, but would pass on the rice. Maybe try a gyro instead.

5woR4ujQZ_FsQlylY4X6KQ.text: Fantastic food and fair prices. It's hard to find a good Greek restaurant, but we've finally found it and that's yassou. All the meat tastes fresh and yummy.

2ERJwveUf-GcS8Mg41ABVg.text: Always a perfect five star eating experience in this place. I'm in the restaurant business and I can appreciate when a place goes the extra mile to make it fresh with quality ingredients.

lJ_dfM92pc0BCK-VE_JJhA.text: The food could have been served hotter, the gyro meat could have been moister and more flavorful, the staff could have been a lot more knowledgeable and friendly, and the soda machine could use more carbonation. Too many other Greek food options in town for me to ever consider returning.

Ymyi1WCRidV2kJ6YVEa9RQ.text: The food is awesome! Like, really delicious! I've done both take-out and eat-in here, with good experiences both times. The dining area has great natural light, and a good atmosphere, though the greek carnival-sounding music was a little louder than necessary when I was there. I docked a star because there were ants crawling around in the bathroom and in the secondary dining area. Perhaps that was a temporary issue, but it raises concerns about cleanliness.

DPaNSBBVElgE5ZkOuvFF_w.text: Excellent food and good service gives this little gem a 5-Star rating. Being a picky eater it is always a plus for me when the restaurant can tell me what is going to be on my order and hold certain items from it. I know it sounds very basic but you would be surprised at how many places can't do that. While we tried several of their dishes I have to admit my favorite was their house Gyro. If your in the area and looking for something a bit different you won't be disappointed here.

mJDkkZGlWZlHG7iA4Fk45Q.text: I love this place! I have been going here since they opened and not only is the food excellent the family is always glad to see you. They started small, but have expanded there seating and staff to accommodate the rush.There are so many things on the menu that are excellent and I usually order a side of Spanakopita and Taramasalata (with extra pita) to start, as I like to take it home to snack on later. The portions are generous, and I am always torn between the Chicken Salad or the Super Chicken Gyro, both are fantastic. Allow yourself a little extra time during the lunch hour or call ahead as they have a big rush of people and the parking is terrible. There are very few spots and it is difficult to maneuver through the narrow parking lot when its full.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What to order?

DJCzJhdEQCiwx3pAsViEBg.text: Absolutely delicious and excellent service! The gyro meat was so moist and the hummus was great! Best bakalava around! I will def be coming back and recommend you try it. The people who were working were very welcoming.

FQ8xdl74BS6WBxC4bhUB1w.text: The Yassou Greek Grill Cafe was one of life's little happy surprises.  Although I've lived in the area for over thirty years and they have been open for seven, this was the first time I walked in the door (due to the yelp reviews I read on my phone). The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars, was that it looked like my home office at tax time (a bit unorganized and cluttered) with half of the chairs upside down on the tables in the middle of the afternoon.  The service was friendly, and was told that they get very busy at lunch time.  The food was superb.  It was the best Greek food I've tasted since I left Chicago thirty years ago.  The dolmodes (thank goodness not vegan) had it's ground lamb and rice spiced to perfection, and was treated to love in its lemon sauce.  The spanikopita was probably the best I have ever tasted, with its filo dough layered and flaky, and very pleasantly spiced.    If I was blindfolded and served this food on a porcelain plate with silverware, I would have paid 50% more for the meal and would have thought the food was a bargain.  I can't wait to go back and try the pastitsio and moussaka.

aLU9PitPd3vyN9YuPofuWw.text: I'm no expert on Greek food, but I've had my share of souvlakis.    I ordered the Steak Souvlaki ($8.99) from their lunch special menu from 11 am to 4 pm.  It came with a side salad, rice pilaf, and pita bread.  There were four pieces of meat skewered along with a side of tzatziki sauce.  First off, I think I was expecting something else.  I was expecting more of a souvlaki wrap, as this is how I used to have it.  So that part was different for me.  It was okay, nothing spectacular though.  (I soon learned that most souvlakis served here are with pita bread, and not wraps.  So I'll have to keep my eyes out for that.)  The Husband ordered the Moussaka "Ground beef, eggplant, and potatoes layered and topped with Bechamel sauce" ($8.99)  It did sound a lot more appetizing and once I read it off the menu, he was easily sold.  It was okay and he said he's had better.  We also downed it with a Greek soda - blue raspberry.  Overall, Yassou Greek Grill Cafe was a decent Greek food experience.  You go up to the counter and give your order and pay.  They'll give you a number and you take a seat and your food will arrive a few minutes later.  They were pretty busy the weekend we went, so they are doing okay.  It didn't have me screaming for more though.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Souvlaki ($8.99)
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moussake ($8.99)

5mbyFe8pj0d3WsKkFw2d1Q.text: Came in today and got Awesome food ! Really love the way they cook everything and the Greek fries are the best ! They can get understaffed sometimes, but overall the food makes up for everything. If it wasn't for my 30 minute break I could easily stay here and enjoy my food and willing to wait for my food! Great place!

pqkQlwePzAUJUjBbCTdqWw.text: When I am craving Greek food, this is the place I come to. The Big Fat Gyro is the best Gyro I have had in town, not lacking in anything. Have you ever had a Gyro and thought that if it only had more of something then it would be better? Not the case here, the name explains it all. Its big, its fat, and it is yummy.   There are also a lot of other sandwiches stuffed and sides. My favorite side from here is the Dolmades. There were canned Dolmades on a shelf and I'm not sure if that's what they are serving but it definitely tastes better than any of the other places.  It's not the cheapest Mediterranean food joint but it the food justifies the prices IMO. So far I haven't had anything better along the lines of Mediterranean fast food so this is my top pick for now.

EMIauLgiTnj7fSp2ZUvZNQ.text: Big fat gyros, Greek salad and baklava were all wonderful! Would do the 10 mile drive again!

mFw6CEi02_pR7N5j6A6gdw.text: Some of the best Greek food in the city, but the hours are a disappointment. Who closes at 8 p.m. in Las Vegas? Do they not want to make money? If you do catch them open, try the lemon-herb chicken pita or any salad here. Delicious. The restaurant itself is charming and Mediterranean, in a family-style way. A bit cluttered and campy with mass-produced copies of old Aegean art and the de rigueur travel posters, but the staff is warm, welcoming and willing to accommodate any special request.  The only disappointing item on the menu is the baklava. It's among the worst I've had anywhere - shocking, considering these folks know, and produce, great Greek food. They should change the baklava immediately. It's a gaping hole in an otherwise very solid bill of fare. Don't miss this place.

ALeyNBFznJ_p80Tr00ftrA.text: A sandwich fit for a hungry man. That was the only thing running through my head as the waitress placed down my enormous gyro. A combo with American fries and a smoothie comes in at a cool $10.99. It might seem like a lot for fast food, but once you see the gyro it is not outrageous. What is ridiculous is the thought that any single person could finish this colossal pita sandwich alone.   Yassou does give a generous portion of meat, veggies, feta, and tzatziki sauce. I was torn about the meat, because I love the crispiness, but it was also a little dry. With the amount of yogurt based dressing, it is easy to overlook. I am glad that I split this meal with my sister. By the time we finished, we were both out of commission and ready for a nap.

H47wkuena0N8TcXH_3tvHQ.text: My favorite Greek restaurant..try the super chicken pita sandwich.  The rice and Greek salad is the best in town.  Their baklava is so delicious.  Everyone is friendly.  You can call ahead and order on the way if you are in a hurry! 100%

6aG3jxEs7i9KQ3llqEJhZg.text: Best gyro in Las Vegas.  The meat has so much flavor and is so soft and crispy.  The pita was also soft and the tzatziki is very good. Fresh vegetables on it also.  Very very good.   My wife also ordered a salad, which she liked.  I ordered spanakopita.  I wish the phyllo was a little more brown. It was very pale and didn't have that great of a crunch.  The spinach and feta mixture inside was good.  Not great, but good.   I will be back when I get a craving for a gyro.

545eEH71Sw3cOFKyjMHRMw.text: Not really that great of a place. The gyro meat isn't that great here. 60%-70% of the time it's dry or old.  The salad is put in with the rest of the food on takeout causing it to get warm and humid. Souvlaki is alright.

Jz5GcBivjZUEFDV5p1hYVw.text: After trying a drive-thru greek stop and a couple others on Sahara, we decided to hop on to Charleston and give this place a try.  It looks so fresh and inviting in the building it's in, and because it's one of those places that you would normally drive by on a regular day, I wanted to see if it was any good.  My husband is the Greek food lover, while I am just so-so on it.  We ordered a lot--the stuffed grape leaves, two big gyros, some dessert, seasoned fries, pita bread and hummus.  Everything tasted great--the gyro was in this soft, yummy pita with some feta cheese and veggies.  The meat was really good, too.  Nicely seasoned.  The hummus was my favorite, and I had to order extra bread to finish it off.  I didn't eat the grape leaves but my husband said it was really good and had a strong herbal flavor to them.  They made this honey pastry cake and it was mildly sweet and sticky.    Overall, the food was great for a Greek stop and we frequent that place when we are in the mood for that kind of food.  The owner is there working once in awhile, and his son is there all the time.  Having a family work the business is a great sight to see, and ensures for me that they care about their food and therefore the quality there will always be good.  If you like Greek, you should give this place a shot and see if you become addicted to it or not.  Lots of yelpers are fans, and although the good was great, I'm not a total fan.  For me to give four stars it has to haunt me in my dreams.  Still, great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus with pita

aHNFsSfmDtivRhNV4_AZ3g.text: I got the gyros plate and it's delicious! Service is fast and it's a fun Greek atmosphere. Must go!!

tWVXUA4arBePLexr8UxSqw.text: This has to be some of the best Greek food I have ever tasted.  I ordered the Moussaka Plate and it was amazing. The dish itself was warm and flavorful (not to mention filling!). The pita was freshly made and was the perfect side for my meal.  The owner was working his tail off to make sure everyone was happy and the staff was very kind. My wife enjoyed her meal as well (I forget what it was).  I will definitely be going back here. The tea was tasty and hot (boom!).

X6AxMDeMqzX9IbqWHJ6Atw.text: Ate at yassou today for the first time with a couple of friends of mine that raved about it.  I'm hooked now!!!   I had the Souvlaki combo and it was delicious!!!!!   The rice pilaf was fantastic, and the hummus and tsatiki was phenomenal!  My friend had the Veggie plate, and I think I might have to get that next time.   The Rice Pudding for dessert was EXCELLENT!!!!!!

dNC65MPOqgSwbB7AUV54EQ.text: Perfect for me.  Excellent place for a 1st date or quick, tasty & healthy meal.  Just went 1st time here yesterday.  It was freaking fantastic!  Seems like the owner knows everyone, because he didn't recognize me and started to help me make some decisions.  He then offered me a sample of some rice & greens, which appeared simple to the eye, but surprisingly delicious, light & fresh.  The portions are very generous and everything I had (platter of stuff) was simply perfect.  The owner truly cares about his quality of food and gave top notch service.  Other reviewers complain about the service, I assume the owner wasn't around at those times.

oqGA4tV7R7lKQ5vaZ0HsAg.text: Yassou!! This is a one of a kind family run restaurant with excellent food and friendly owners. If you want a recommendation the Big Fat Gyro with Greek Fries special is excellent. All of the food is great and they expanded their dining area to accommodate the constant overflow of diners that they had.

8DM_Kap6FZRVrpCEj8UbEA.text: I've missed having a good gyro sandwich having lived in Chicago.  This one today was really good.  My second visit here. Today's gyro and fries were not even hot.

O4rFJqPFZJiNHkXxOBgpew.text: Fancy and awesome Greek restaurant. Very healthy and fresh meal.  They have special for lunch (11-4) , chicken lunch special.  It comes with pitta bread ,chicken skewer , rice , and salads . Just 7.99. Good price with yummy and healthy meal.

M6QsAUdbskV6CHHjrPhGoA.text: Decent food, decent-sized portions, reasonable price.  Tried the Super Gyro, it's good, and the Chicken Souvlaki Plate is tasty with good sized portions.

P5_ZRn01ltuX8JMeixrglg.text: Absolutely delicious!! I have worked in the same plaza as Yassou for a good 2 years and STILL manage to crave Peters cooking daily. It doesn't matter what I'm ordering it is never anything short of amazing. Everyone who works here always makes sure I am well fed and taken care of. Highly recommend for anyone wanting a delicious lunch or dinner!

FjFgOrcRqDMxkniBjZB9Uw.text: Immaculately clean to go along with the outstanding food and fast service. Family owned and operated and it shows in how everyone shows ownership of the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A whole gyro to himself. That&#39;s how good they are!

tLx6K6fP-jIjholou5BcGQ.text: I can really appreciate some good Mediterranean food. Mediocre Mediterranean? Not so much... As far as it is from my house, I doubt I'll make the drive all the way out here any time soon.  KABOBS: Doesn't Mediterranean food revolve around grilled meats? The steak souvlaki was a little tough, quite flavorless, and dry. Given I did take my order to-go, but the 15 minute drive home exasperated an already existing issue. The gyro meat was pretty tasty! It was thinly sliced and quite flavorful unlike the beef chunks they threw on a stick.  SIDES: The combo plates we ordered were supposed to come with greek salad, rice, and pita. The pita was stone cold and they were out of rice--they replaced it with extra salad. We also got an order of the garlic fries. Basically, french fries packed with feta and some garlic powder. I've eaten better at the greek festival.   The kabobs and the rest of the sides were somewhat lack-luster. But we really enjoyed the calamari. It was just as delicious as the stuff I get at Firefly. But the dipping sauce it came with was disgusting . It was some stale tasting butter concoction.  After this meal of good and bad, I'm kind've over Mediterranean food at this point. After finishing the whole meal, I couldn't substantiate that the $25 I spent plus gas was worth it.

wv7Mgja_2WiUj0GKb-LuiA.text: A solid place for Greek comfort food in a casual cafe-meets-deli atmosphere.  Everything we had was delicious and served promptly.  My lemon-herb chicken pita went down very easily: savoury and herby and all-round yummy.  Hubby had a veggie combo with dolmades, spanikopita, etc. and enjoyed each bite.  Major points for food deliciousness but a star taken off for dirty floors and slightly sticky tables!  (I've made those comments about other places....broken record? or just over-observant clean freak?)  Staff was not as friendly as I expected them to be, but I'm still giving 4* because the food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

__ZRkl2zz1XKFpvV7laQJg.text: The Big Fat Gyro is ridiculously big and fat....their Greek salads are fresh and delicious...add steak, chicken, or gyro meat for a reasonable price...hummus is smooth and silky...my only complaint is that street access to the place totally sucks and the parking is very limited. Otherwise, great!

Tn5WTQ-Cf02Qzn3dSqNlng.text: It's kind of like walking into a mass production restaurant. If looks like everything is made on an assembly line. The gyro I ordered had old, limp onions on it. The onion's tasted like sweaty armpits. The Greek french fries had way too much salt on them. I threw them out. What a waste of money.  I have never gone back.

SUoo63qdmYO643hsvfKzog.text: I love the atmosphere! This is my favorite seat in Greek place hands down! I usually get the gyro salad or plate and am never disappointed. I also never leave hungry, if anything I have left overs or another snack or meal. The desserts are as good as the gyro meats, if not better!

Gcbrjx6pVtspV4Q4vAyijQ.text: A favorite place to get greek food. The value for your money is amazing. I've been going there for years and most of the time I could barely finish the portions. My favorite dish is the Steak Souvulaki plate which comes with two steak skewers, salad, rice, pita bread and amazing home made yogurt sauce. The greek pizza is amazing as well. There's a family feel when you get inside, it's almost like visiting your grandma for lunch. Very nice friendly people, and can't say that enough the best greek food in Las Vegas. It's a must try joint

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. must try the steak souvulaki, juicy tender beef, pita bread, salad with fetta cheese, rice and awesome yogurt souce

B5qsQS_N-yns_6gQRvcy6Q.text: This is my go to Greek spot in town. Food is always delicious. Great portions and an affordable price.   The Chicken and Steak Souvlaki Combo is the business.

pJbPeg-6x4nKVbw6mdo-ZQ.text: I was going to this place since it opened. The owner is a great guy. His two sons are complete idiots who don't know the hospitality business. I always ate the same thing. I finally tried the hummus. It came with one piece of pita. I ate the pita and half the hummus was still on my plate. I asked the older brother for another pita slice. He says that will be 80 cents. That's it. You don't treat a good customer like that. I haven't been back. Now I go to Paymons every week. Better food. Better prices. And much better service

2Y0AEvOrPeczLuMR8w3bAA.text: Great food, packed place. Playing Greek music in the background. Glad I found this place, I'll be back soon!!

Y9BH0T6hl1wMk5tmOHcLqQ.text: Very good Greek food.  Plastic plates and utensils do little to decrease the pleasure of their friendly service, well prepared food and very reasonable prices.   A must if you're in the area - but also worth a drive.   Go.

ZGkeURk91yKtgP794Wk0Cg.text: Money.  For $7.95, I had a beautiful plate of Greek goodies.  Chicken Souvlaki lunch special gets you a fresh greek salad (the Kalmata olives are not pitted.  Don't crack a tooth!), 3 or 4 pieces of hot pita bread, a skewer of chicken and onion pieces which are really well seasoned, and some of the best rice pilaf I have had in a while.  A fountain drink adds $2 to the total, but for $10, I left very satisfied.  Lest I forget, there is a quiet little patio if you go through the restaurant.  Service was passeable, if not overly friendly.  Interior was clean and lots of lunch regulars.  Can't wait to go back when I am off the wagon and try the Greek fries!

XCPI8-rVv0ci5tnfumqFUw.text: Yassou is a place I have visited many times over the past several years. I can always count on them having delicious gyros and fries. I love the My Big Fat Gyro and I order it without onions. My friend ordered his without tomatoes. I know, who doesn't like tomatoes? Haha.  I was a little disappointed the last time I was in there since they got both of our orders wrong. Not a huge deal, but definitely disappointing. I also asked for ketchup and they forgot it. It's the little things that make or break the experience at a restaurant. If they had been busy, I would understand. They weren't busy.   If I was reviewing the quality of the food alone, I would give them 4 stars. Due to the not so great service, I felt I had to deduct one star. Makes me sad, but I'm sure I'll be back.

ZWriEMUXpWzmE3M6S18SSw.text: Thing I like most about Yassou is the lemon herb marinade/sauce that they use on several of their items.  They do this well.    Generally speaking, I'm not going to go out of my way to eat here.  I think there are better Greek/Mediterranean places at about the same price-point...and most of them are sit down places with more comfortable seating.   The gyros are solid here...they do their chicken gyros better than average...nothing else telling my stomach to tell my brain to come back here though.  I do love their black and white checkerboard tiles :)

rf1G5eVr1dr6GmLVe2BrsQ.text: Favorite Greek spot in LV!!!   We always take our guests here and make frequent stops for our fix!! We always sit outside and love how they checked on us.  Order the Souvlaki plate or anything Steak!! Their meat never disappoints!!   Amazing food, service, people, and yup... Again... FOOD!!   Thanks Peter and Christian!!!  PS I want to touch your hair!!

4Zhe6PymC4WtLPtz_351Ug.text: This place is awesome! I ordered the gyro-spanakopita plate and it comes with so much food I had to divide it into two meals! My husband ordered the spanakopita plate and an order of dolmades (stuffed grape leaves with ground beef) OMG! They serve them with this lemon sauce that is so delicious.  The service is great and the prices are reasonable.

W2iwpIAkpKKAMTZfNEfT6g.text: I stopped here with my neighbor this afternoon for an early dinner.  I had the Chicken Souvlaki and she had the Gyro plate.  We each requested no rice and extra salad and they were very accommodating.  Their tzatziki was excellent.    My only complaint with any place like this is the plastic plates and dinnerware.  I know it's common in places like this, but it still is something I don't like.  I brought home a piece of baklava for dessert, and it was quite good.  I will be back.  I'll probably do takeout the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Souvlaki with salad, pita pieces, and tzatziki.

fhxrblZNFq6JyTMVJONbnQ.text: Hands down the BEST dolmathes (stuffed grape leaves) in Las Vegas. And I've tried them in every Greek restaurant I've been to. Their Avgolemono soup is delicious as well.   The service is great too. Everyone is friendly and they even remembered me after coming in only once. And they were crowded that day.   So between the service and food quality, I think I've found my go-to Greek restaurant when I'm in Vegas.

oDO72pYyKGmie9TAKD2HUw.text: Easy 5 star....here's why :  Not only was it the best tasting gyro I have had to date, but it was one of the best priced lunches.  I went with the combo, gyro, fries, and smoothie shake for $10 and change.  The gyro was great...I think the feta cheese puts it on another level.  The fries were kind of plain...wish they had a sauce or seasoning....just get another cucumber sauce to dip the fries :)  The smoothie was surprisingly good...a nice touch, instead of offering a soda with the combo.  I would have went with water otherwise.  Also had a chicken pita sandwich...zesty lemon and herbs...also a good choice.  Can't go wrong here!  We will come back again!

6QZa2oRaLxpV1NVGXBvSIQ.text: We shared hummus, chicken souvlaki, and the best rice pilaf I've tasted. Service was friendly and quick. Not a fancy place, but for great food at reasonable prices this hit the spot. 5/5 for the rice and hummus alone, it's good enough we're grabbing some baklava for the road.

CVCZhAccy1Ij3XF_pxtqXQ.text: This is always my go to for fresh, healthy, delicious fast food! Call ahead and pick up or order in. Their kabobs are so perfectly grilled. The salad dressing is on point, and I have tried SO HARD to recreate it at home- but no. Ive been eating here for YEARS and love this place!!

07ynF21Fc4ytlMJHlncJ5g.text: I had seen the building many times but hesitated to stop and try the food until I read the reviews. Lovely place. Clean as a whistle. Great service. Ordered dolmades and Greek salad to go. Fresh and delicious. Enough for lunch the next day. Will be back when I am hungrier to try the other goodies on the menu. How lucky to have found this spot of Greek heaven I can walk to from my place.

u2tN_UwiHjTpVspWSQ1FAQ.text: My wife and I were told about Yassou by a friend of hers, and they were right on the money. There is something about walking into this place and you know that it is going to have amazing food. It's set up like a mom and pop deli/restaurant outside the city limit establishment. No fancy entrance but not run down. Lot's of Greek flavor inside.  We ordered the gyro's (of course) and Greek fries. Simply amazing. The food took about 7 minutes or so to arrive at the table. Good size portions, I got the Big Fat Gyro, and I'm just happy to have finished it! The staff there is great! Very friendly and helpful. They could tell we were new there and were quick to point out some of the more popular items on the menu. Will be coming back for sure!

BpbPKhSY8hNomLypc9BOAA.text: Great Greek food for lunch or a quick dinner!    The lamb/beef gyro was excellent!  We ordered the hummus before our meal and it was perfect!  Friendly staff and reasonable prices!  It was busy for a late lunch, but the service was fast.

hWtbwJjkSgmFPfY-ihr4gw.text: Love this place come here ALL the time but today sucked.  I had to come back for taziki and then there were no tomatoes on my gyro.. really frustrating  Super bummed I'm sick and all I wanted was a nice easy pick up meal.. having t come back really sucked.  Not sure why there weren't tomatoes on my gyro when they are included in them all the time... prly won't be back for a while as this happens twice in a row. Please pay attention to what guests order... they even read it back to me and still didn't get it right. I'm not one to review on yelp but this really pissed me off

THjBfd5oAv0fHmb26-UsIA.text: This is by far the best Greek Food!! Never disappoints! Seems to be always better than the last time we've eaten here!! So much flavor and tender! We even has a family dinner plan for my 60th Birthday and was pleasantly surprised either survive and quality of food! Just popped in for quick dinner tonight and the service was just as amazing as the food, checking to see how everything was and if we needed anything! Love love this place and it has become our favorite place to eat!

NNc6QwLUO4hprTFLPGefgg.text: This is my favorite place in the world for Greek! It's not just the amazing staff/family that I love, it's the food! I've recently been to 2 popular spots recently and I was so disappointed. The consistency Yassou manages to have with their food is perfection.....it's always delicious!

PWTNFb4UPDqEQqb_Zyvsvg.text: Very good! The products are fresh and tasty! The big fat gyros is sooo good! Try the baklawa! It's amazing!

-Olpa8YAxwbsCUEKelmW3w.text: Best fast greek food I have found in Vegas. Good portion sizes and fast service. Family run and owners typically working hard to serve good food!

os-tSSGpX8tcElXFfG4xAA.text: It was my first time here. I met my friend for lunch. We had a great experience! Food was great!! Staff was super friendly. The owner came up to us and checked on us to make sure we were enjoying our lunch. Definitely will go back and recommend this place if u r looking for a good Greek food!!!

KbN7qfNNN4BZpd0yMIVQOQ.text: This is a mom and pop joint for the Mediterranean food.  The chicken kabobs were really good, and the Greek salad was okay. I think I had the lemon herb chicken or something like that. Everyone seemed to love their dish. Prices are quite modest as well. I'd come back since the workers are super sweet and they have great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad with lemon herb chicken
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken kobo plate

XYG9auGqTY-4nBpjO2s-tA.text: I come for lamb gyro with rice everytime I visit Vegas. Taste good and good quality ingredients.

-KojAOsG_BnjrhwUhuRj-g.text: This place is great.  Whatever I order,  it's always delicious and fresh.  I think the old guy with the grey frow is the owner and  he is still cooking.

ksxGHOi3NA8dLAw0ZuQ6wA.text: Still love love love the food here.  I've yet to branch beyond the Mini Souvlaki Special (one mini steak skewer, one mini chicken skewer, rice, salad, pita, and tzatziki sauce), with a side of Greek fries, because it's sooooo delicious and filling. It's great when dining in, and even better when I send my partner out to bring it home.  Yassou has become my go-to takeout spot for nights when I'm feeling too lazy to drive or cook! I'm posting a photo of the up-to-date menu, since it's not available on line.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yassou&#39;s menu as of December 5, 2016.

FG7djpTOeOsDBd0HQ-iauw.text: Attempting to eat a little better than usual, I had my eye on a salad for lunch. I have wandered by this restaurant on many occasions and finally decided to give them a shot.   They were packed for lunch, so I put in my order and found a seat to sit and wait. It took a good amount of time since there were a number of orders ahead of me, but once it was ready I was so excited to dig right in to my lemon chicken and gyro Greek salad.   There was tons of meat, feta, onions and kalamata olives to accompany the lettuce. I didn't even feel the need to pour any dressing over it, since it was packed with so many delicious toppings. The salad really hit the spot the well-cooked gyro and chicken made my day, it was so delicious.   I plan on making this a regular on my lunchtime rotation and I look forward to trying many more menu items in the future. I might call my order in ahead of time to save time.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro and Greek salad
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken and gyro salad

Cfk-RYuJMAqHep7M17k8Og.text: Gr8 Greek fast food w/quality ingredients and a big menu.  Casual atmosphere w/good service.  Hype is True here. Vegetarian and carnivore selections are delicious. Generous servings and good service. Recommend the Greek Plates and desserts. Yummy pita and gyros.

LEVfyBgF79aUoawd03NJsA.text: Efcharisto! It is impossible for me to truly express my gratitude to the son of the owner of Yassou, who, despite the long take out order line out the door, continually asked my mother and I if we were satisfied with our meal. Satisfied hardly does this excellent Greek Restaurant justice! The souvlaki combo was composed of moist, succulent chicken that just fell off the skewer and the beef passed the same test remarkably well. The owner's son, who waited on us, made certain that calamari was available and placed our order. 10 minutes later we had our food. Terrific portion sizes, delectable entrees and sides, and mixed greens on the side for those of us who want to up their game when it comes to nutrition. Best Greek food this side of town? Hands down the best! Thank you for being close by and I will definitely be back soon as well as often!

KyDlWfynHSVUhIzLUdME9w.text: What can I say, best gyros!!! Got to get a big fat gyro with those feta fries!!! I have tried many gyros around town and no one can compare. I don't know what about it makes it different?!?! I've tried adding some of the things on this gyro to other gyros at other places and it still doesn't compare. Super friendly service-I feel like they know me here ha ha. Love love love! If you like gyros--try it!!

w9g05zi99xfv9dA4jWNALA.text: So I've been coming to Yassou about once a year for around ten years or so whenever I would fly in to visit my parents.  Now that I'm living in Vegas I've had a chance to not only become a regular here but have had a taste of other similar restaurants within the valley.  Every place has their strengths and weaknesses but at the end of the day I tend find my way back to these guys, even though it's a bit of a drive for me since I don't live close.  They always ask me how the food is and I usually tell them (sarcastically) that it $uck$, which of course is the exact opposite of the experience.  Great food, great prices (check out the souvlaki specials), and most importantly the owners and their employees are great.  As I'm walking out the door at lunchtime, reiterating my sarcastic response to how I enjoyed my meal, Christian responds by saying that he'll see me back for dinner.  If I lived closer that would probably be True  There's definitely no shortage of good Greek restaurants in Vegas.  If you haven't tried Yassou, definitely do.  And if you have and decided to only give them one or two stars, all I have to ask is, what medications were you taking that day?

CWIXqHsPipGzovnlv-4u6g.text: Love this place!!! I always order the Souvlaki combo. The meats are perfectly cooked.

dgQOX8dY_NfvVOxx8PIvPg.text: This was the first restaurant I ate at in Vegas, and, 9 years later, it continues to be one on my favorites! The gyro, souvlaki, and spanakopita are all absolutely delicious!   My parents come from Ohio every year for Christmas, and we eat here at least twice because my mom loves it.   Great, family run business. If you're looking for amazing, affordable Greek food, this is the place.

L0OYpzxCfh-uD4xAuoCQsw.text: The gyros and steak souvlaki was legit, the portion size was perfect, the price was right, the restaurant was clean with plenty of seating and the staff was as friendly as they needed to be. I honestly can't say anything bad about this place. If you like Greek food and you're in the area, stop in and see for yourself.

sRORNeD1mamCAiH5fHSdWw.text: Let's put it this way, I don't eat here enough. The food is delicious and the quality is great. I love how passionate the father and son are about running this business. They're always working hard to keep the food flowing and the restaurant clean.   My only problem is deciding what to order! I usually end up getting a gyro, lemon herb chicken salad, or the mini souvlaki special. There were a few occasion that I noticed the meat was ever so slightly on the dry side. More of an observation than a complaint, nothing that a little lemon or tzatziki can't fix. Everything is well seasoned and flavorful. I'll have to come back more often.

l-OxUPtweQui2L3eoVjXqA.text: This place is pretty good. I did order a gyro plate and it definitely wasn't a gyro. More like a deconstructed gyro? Pretty hard to eat. The food took a while to come out and there isn't any parking. It is definitely a family restaurant and I loved that!  The food is good but the inconvenience of the wait time and how hard it is to eat I don't think I'll be back.

_CTQgczS_h0QR4MAk86n0Q.text: We really enjoy eating here, place is always clean, staff is friendly, but most of all the food is delicious, and reasonable.  We tried other Greek restaurants, but this is the only one we keep going to. We have brought other people with us, and they enjoyed it also, and have gone back. Matter of fact we just finished eating there, we go at least once again. Hope you all go and try this restaurant, I assure you you won't be disappointed.  P.S. Not related in any way to the owners.

aRnlaPXDfkBpe96F5m8f3A.text: I called and pre ordered my meal.  My order was taken correctly, and when I got there the lady was nice no issues with that.  But the flavor wasn't what I was use to.  It didn't taste like some of the greek places I've been too in the past.   The salad dressing didn't have much flavor, and the chicken was just blah!  Looks like people like it, there were a few customers in the place.  It just didn't work for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LUhAd2QOgRS8pK5p4aAAjw.text: Been going to this spot for a year now, it's the absolute best all around. The food, the people and the atmosphere. I order some of the dressing on the side to make some dishes at home but I can't stop coming back for the real deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Salad Lemon Herb Chicken

BdtGHCC1OxCwzh85dXJfew.text: We recently moved and quickly started looking for a good Greek place. I spotted Yassou when I was driving home from work. We checked the reviews and decided to try this place.  The food here was excellent. We both ordered salads and my husband tried their lamb dish. Admittedly it wasn't quite what we expected but great none the less. We will be ordering from them again.

7all8fBHEmVQR04iiIyaqg.text: Very disappointed! I called to place my order to cut down on my wait time because I have groceries in the car. The woman who answered the phone said it'll take 20 mins. I showed up at 18 mins and the food wasn't ready yet - understandable. She told me they'll call my name when my food is ready. I can tell they were busy so I patiently waited. 20 mins passed, nothing yet, 25 mins - nothing yet. Then, I saw her looked at the bags that were already on the counter and she called my name after the 30 minute mark. That's just poor customer service and inefficiency on their part. So all together it took 48 minutes to get my food!!! My groceries were waiting in the hot car for 30 mins!!! I had to throw away my eggs, yogurts, and milk! It cost me more money than it should have been. I don't think I'll go back. Their food hasn't been tasting that good in the past couple of trips anyway.

OgGtR7G7N8XNEphApw6xHA.text: I don't know if it's a family business and that's why they continue to employ the the worst staff I have ever encountered. Whoever the skinny cook in the back is should be fired immediately.

61dYF9F_wIzsbMojsBWkjA.text: Yummy Greek food, got the Steak lemon herb Gyro wrap it was really yummy. I got the combo with the Greek fries and they're so yummy. It comes with feta cheese, herbs. Service was very friendly and prices are reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak gyro
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Fries

wVjsPlbZy2X4m-TjxKOGig.text: I admit I am a fan of this place. I have eaten there for years... really for years. I tended to order one or two things and was always very happy. I just didn't get board with eating there and I found myself there more then every week.   About two months ago I ordered something new...Moussaka an eggplant & ground beef dish with potatoes layered and topped with Bechamel sauce. It was so good I went back 3 times in just one week.   Last month I ordered the Salmon plate. A large 8 oz center cut filet and a Greek salad... OMG so good.   The quality of food and the size of the portion... it's hard to know how they do it. The prices are amazing really amazing.   I have owned and operated a very successful restaurant when I was younger and went to culinary school.  I also have been to the Greeks Islands and Athens. This is the best Greek food I've had in the states 100%  I'm sitting here think I will try the Spanakopita... Spinach & Feta wrapped in flaky fillo next. I'm really looking forward to lunch Tue at Yassou.

GjeUm7vxVoUjndOLkqncWA.text: Looking for Greek but not wanting to spend a ton?  Here is where to go.  The food tastes fresh and the salad is scrumptious   We usually order a few different options and all share. The shawarma here is craveable and the gyro with enough tomatoes and sauce is great.  The pitas have never been stale and fries with feta are a evil genius snack.

yD9kARsgSCaRg1h1Kzui9g.text: This place is the best! I'm here every week! Chicken lunch special is my go to favorite; marinated chicken on a skewer, Greek salad with onions, tomatoes, zucchini, feta and onions, fresh pita bread with tzatziki sauce and lemon rice. This fills me up all day long. So healthy, delicious and a great value. When it's cold outside I recommend the avgolemoni soup; homemade delicious blend of creamy lemon, chicken and rice. And I can't forget the baklava - crispy, cinnamon, nuts with a splash of rose water. My boys like the Greek fries topped with feta and parsley. Delicious fresh brewed iced tea and fountain drinks to choose from. Many other Greek favorites here too.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro plate. $10.99
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken lunch special $8.69 11-4 daily.

-NkjGcu7uSXuymTU5GcnOw.text: Just had lunch, new on the menu, great shrimp plate.  THIS PLACE IS THE BEST.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp plate

iOF0gSfBZR_JyRDh3gp1SQ.text: Still my Favorite go to Greek restaurant here in Vegas, Thank you guys for always giving your best, I never leave disappointed.

e5TbQwXG3yvYEhrLjIHlXQ.text: Honestly, this is the best greek place! I love Greek food since I am from the Mediterranean and this place has such authentic flavors! I always get the gyro plate, I feel like everything that comes with it works in such harmony. The salad with the olive as well and the rice and pita bread compliment the gyro meat perfectly!  10/10 would reccomend !

Db0UdadzgO_Mg64KIJS-HA.text: I have tried a couple of Greek places in town and wasn't too impressed so far, but Yassou was just what I was looking for. I had used Postmates to do delivery, and had hummus with pita, chicken souvlaki, greek salad, and yellow rice.  The hummus is pretty good, and they give you a lot of pita bread to dip it in. But, the pita bread isn't really all that great for my taste though. The rice is great here, and the chicken is well seasoned, moist, and delicious. The Greek salad is also on point. So for a take out Greek, it is my new go to place.

-Ll_f1AHVBc5GxZpmgMP8g.text: FIRST OF ALL.... I love this place! The food is fresh, delicious and most importantly AUTHENTIC! Been going here for lunch since January and never had a bad experience. Christian is an amazing person so is the father. I had them cater my function for 60 people and there were zero complaints but tons of accolades for my choice of food for my daughters graduation party. So good and I did my homework with lots of other "Med cuisine" throughout Las Vegas, this place is NOT close to me but worth the trek!

gK2nWgsZfQJQfqosKbl9NQ.text: Everything is always good and fresh- we have gone there for years and wonder how they do this so consistently?? Excellent place to have greek food!

qASvnz1X7vRUnz6lnk3WxA.text: My husband and I often road trip from Idaho to visit family in California, and when we drive through Vegas we always try to stop at Yassou for a bite! It's a little out of the way from the I-15 but definitely worth it!  We found it when we had a hankering for Mediterranean food (which there is a strong lack of in Idaho unfortunately), and immediately loved the ambiance, the authenticity, the fact that it is a family owned restaurant, and especially the food.  Thanks for the great food again today, Yassou! See you next time we head through Vegas!

30g9ZrK7IjjkrmH-YLSuqw.text: My family, co-workers & I love this place ! We're from Henderson but, we will drive all the way to Summerlin just for this restaurant. Staff are always friendly & service is great.

hBRkUFOEj_XAUWBg9_x7aQ.text: I have eaten at Yassou for the last 8 years since my boss introduced me. Their food is always picture perfect deliciousness. Having gone for so many years they know me by name and make me feel like part of the family!  We also do catering orders from here for business events and our staff looks forward to it every time! Every company rep always asks where this place is.  I'd give 3000 stars if I could!

8ExhS4FM2vi60-B-ta3E3w.text: Great food, long long wait! Everything is fresh and delicious. The chef is first class cook. Two areas to eat. Too bad parking is horrible.

D30qhk1Lges_IOaIXw8wEA.text: A fantastic restaurant. The most wonderful service and excellent food. We left feeling full and really valued as a customer. Can not recommend enough!!! Just fabulous!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QBHMPqwfJBfGaWurwfF5yA.text: Best greek food hands down baby.  Owners 1 of a kind people.  Work their asses off.  Great guys.  Came to my wifes work for one of their families bdays and boy they spread the love tipping everyone and treating the staff like gold.  1 thing i will say is the portion of saginaki seems small but taste good.  Best gyro ever.

TMMKSxGxOz_P12aLLU1yuQ.text: This is my go to place for Greek food!! I love their  vegetarian options.  I love the veggie pita, the Greek fries and the spanikopita(spinach) plate, ooh and the Greek pizza.  Everything is so fresh.  The salads are green, the salad dressing is very tasty, everything doesn't taste like it's just been sitting out all day, then warmed up.  Oh, and i love the cucumber dipping sauce that comes with the spanikopita...It's da bomb.  By the way, the prices are great.  Any time, a meal for 2 is about $20... that's a deal in my book!! Oh and omg, I forgot to mention their baklava.  I think it's the best in town, ever.  So good, that I ordered a pan of it for my bday party.  It was a hit and they made the whole process of it very easy.  I just had to return the pan the following day and got my deposit back for it. The owner, the son and the staff are very friendly and they take pride in their business.  They know their customer's faces and names.  Since I live close, I'm kind of a regular, haha.  I also love taking my friends and family who are from out of town to this place.  They always tell me how good the good is and how fresh it is.   Give it a try, even the vegetarian menu, I know you will like it too!!

U6gL5YUmfv8imsCpQ0rZng.text: Amazingly delicious food! Hands down my new favorite Greek food go to! The chicken is cooked beautifully and has great flavor. Even my 2 year old ate an entire skewer of chicken!

CKRDrAtPO77gjpz7dEEYqA.text: Best Greek in town outside the Strip.  I always get the Gyro Plate here for lunch.  Just sucks they close Sunday's.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro Plate.  So Yum!

vCt9Nq1iAWVy6WVsKfYnbA.text: It was nothing crazy. Nice lil family operated restaurant. Reminds me too much of my own family....

A5XgLHk_GOZTNYhgg-rq0g.text: Went back on Sunday, the food was still delicious! You really get your monies worth of food here. I can't wait to go back. Actually I've been back about 5 times since my first review. The food is so good!

sZWtLu_XnjfY4o-2LN7Ssg.text: A bit expensive.  Service is slower than average, but the food is really good.  Gyro patter is good.  I especially like the rice.  The salad is also very good.  Domadas are very tasty - especially with the lemon dipping sauce.  The place is quite large, and seems clean and airy.

bC_dKqXL4l69imlVyJFQXg.text: The Gyro's here are just ok,  Meat is not very spicy, too much lettuce in the Gyro.  The lemon Chicken soup is not good.  It tasted like campbell's with lemon juice added.  Very disappointing.  Dear Yelpers,  I need help! Please let me know where the best Greek Restaurant is in Las Vegas!!!

MCrzZWFWy318Pn3dNKy8ww.text: As the Greek Festival approaches and we see those placard reminders just about everywhere, I feel it's time I review the Yassou Greek Grill Cafe.   After the disaster that is the Mad Greek, I was afraid I would be inclined to allow my distaste to taint my review of Yassou, so I made sure to try it a couple of times.  Don't ask me to remember the names of my orders, other than there's always a gyro and usually some dolmades. What I do remember is that they always put my Tzatziki sauce at the side. Don't get me wrong, I love the stuff, just not always slathered on like they do at some places.  The gyro was really good, with the perfect combination of ingredients so you could enjoy each bite, with sauce or without.  The dolmades are always wonderful - just knowing they're hand made is a huge plus n my book.  I am so looking forward to the festival next month, I hope the food there is as good as Yassou does it, or better even.

LA6FBo6hPEZGRmttRIA_NA.text: This place rocks! I think it is the best Greek restaurant in Las Vegas. I've been to Greek places in several States and this place still is the best and the price is good too.

HGsg8BplyWNcm8rf92ZSdw.text: Love this place! Peter and his family are the nicest people and make the best Greek food in Las Vegas!!! If you haven't been please do!

_s-y9zbGLWYH-zmHphk4yA.text: LOVE and obsess about this place! Completely on the other side of town for me but one of the best Greek spots in town, fore sure.  The Big Fat Gyro, any meat, I tried the chicken and it was super flavorful and juicy. The Souvlaki Como, also an amazing pick, however, after a couple visits, I have decided the Gyro is my fave! Don't think you can go wrong with anything on their menu, especially if you're a fan of Greek food.

vPUtxtd6aA4Q_UKxc3YT3w.text: Favorite Greek spot!  Their pita bread are delicious !  Souvlaki combo is my favorite!

RkcGvPFa6gyhAuklTJRsyA.text: The Yassou gyro was really good and fries w/ feta cheese were tasty. Only reason why I'm giving it 3 stars is because I felt the portion was small for the price.

pP44P1rOBjybQIj-ezeAtA.text: A fantastic mom & pop Greek joint. The ambiance is mellow and casual w/ a walk up counter and comfortable seating. The food came out quickly and was really fresh. I had the Gyro and my wife had the Souvlaki & Chicken skewer plate. We also had the Feta Fries. The meat was fantastic, the salad/veggies fresh and crisp, and the seasonings on everything spot on. Cheap, quick and tasty. Fantastic.

0axznvuxiw_1UJb_B-ypvQ.text: Satisfied desire for Greek but not the best.... I love Greek food and have had many places. The spanikopita was not balanced... Way more dough than spinach and cheese. The salad was also not proportioned and I don't remember Greek salad with well done croutons. The hummus was good but pitas were Not made there as seen in the bags sitting on the counter.  They also were disorganized for a busy time of day with people snapping rude comments running around. One girl was nice and tried to be helpful but the guy then overpowered and was short with her even right in front of us. Now I love spanikopita so I guess my search continues.....

ErVVXR4vYqtl87puLQNI2w.text: Consistent delicious Greek food every time! The Greek steak salad is my all time fav - salads CAN be tasty and Yassou does an awesome job at that. The gyros and grilled chicken are excellent as well, and the avgolemono soup, as well as the dolmades. Love love love all the time.

QnUTfGdEsa5r1RsuQZYtgw.text: We did end up returning to this place and, while the service and atmosphere did not change at all, we thought the food was very mediocre. This would include our rice, fries, grape leaves, and chicken. We have had better food elsewhere, which is really disappointing because we had high hopes for this place and were willing to drive across town to eat here. After a meal this time, we both looked at each other and asked what we thought? Independently, neither one of us wanted to return.

mqaOWnO4FXPqYzA21y4v0Q.text: The meat on both of our plates were raw. Bright red in the middle. Customer service was rushed and wanted us out because they wanted to close. Not a good experience and we will not be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our meat was raw like this on both our plates due to rushing us out the door so they could close.

JzvN9CiGD-fPQBCcaITJCA.text: I have be n coming here for easy 6 years and it's better every time ! You guys are the best keep up the great work chicken lunch special is still my fav and I would still recommend to go food from 11:30 to 12:45 super busy but well worth the wait either way

UIYS8-C9gET4le9vD2_sDg.text: This is one of the best Greek places I have ever been to.  I used to live and work nearby and then moved to Arizona about 3 years ago.  When I come to town I make sure to swing by and have lunch.  My favorites are the big fat gyro, dolmades and spanikopita.  The tzatziki sauce is bomb!  This place has grown over the years as well, so it's nice to see them be successful.  Love Love Love this place!  Thank you for always having great food!

K8HBIG8fdpf-9UjmBgHYNQ.text: G'Damn that was tasty! Got the Big Fat Gyro and a side of Rice Pilaf. I became full halfway into eating it but it tasted so good I finished it. Five stars!

9bP9PoWXIUknoPzw6dHfwg.text: Never disappointed by Yassou!  Today I catered a luncheon for 12 and everyone loved the food. It was ready for pickup on time, hot, tasty and great all around. Was told that it was the best greek food they had in Vegas!  Keep up the great work.

6DASpiadNNLpvFO_f-eFZg.text: Expected so much more with the great reviews. Over 20 min wait on the food and the chicken souvlaki was extremely salty and seemed to be covered with a lot of vegetable oil. Greek salad was okay but not worth the price.

LgW1L_xbXOz2bX8tfShupA.text: Huge gyro... really good feta and cucumber sauce...but when I see packaged store bought pita... instead of homemade? It is really a turn off especially for the price you pay.

yRsjvYXALCXjBjGdXFznOQ.text: this is the best gyro restaurant in all las vegas! i have been coming here since i moved here they are original and authentic come check them out

IbnocVtm9V8_N-mP-S75gQ.text: Came to try this place for the first time.  The food was really but really good !!!  The chicken was cooked soooo good, not dry but well done.  This place is my new favorite  and I do recommend it to anyone

Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0VwutEwLbu_Y0bxE_RbUjQ.text: Delicious. This place is NON-STOP busy, I knew it had to be worth trying. I'm so glad I have found a GOOD genuine Greek spot in this city!  Go! You won't regret it. The owner is a good man. It was obvious how much his business means to him.  So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!!!!

-_2sna0bndyat1SwjMkhvw.text: Amazing food! I got the Super Herb Lemon Chicken Pita and it so good. It does take awhile to get your order so be aware if you are in a hurry to preorder. It took over 15 minutes to get one pita but at least I know it's fresh.

8ECI10ZrTssXblyxok4ZHA.text: Love this place. Every time we are in Vegas, we try to drop by. I brought my family here, I brought my friend here and everyone loved it. The only gripe, this past weekend, they were out of teramasalata.

GAykrnHOEnxyEJeCXPL_KA.text: Grest food. Phone in order ready when we arrived.  Christian the owner is very har woeking and friendly. Love this place.

Zhsck_ZcA-wCLItiRyPVTQ.text: This has become my favorite place for lunch. Their Greek salad with chicken is my favorite dish but I also love my Big Fat Greek gyro. It's a family run business and the food is consistently fresh and delicious.The prices are very reasonable. I have brought friends there and they love it as much as I do.

g7Lstf6pOuB4kQiaiSxggg.text: I feel it is necessary to begin my review of Yassou by mentioning that I may have a slight obsession with Greek/Mediterranean cuisine. I love everything about the food - plain and simple. To give some perspective, I eat Greek/Mediterranean cuisine 3 times a week on average; and I refuse to order from any other restaurant in this category. Why? Because Yassou has thoroughly impressed me every single time.  Let's start with service quality. I would give these folks 6 stars out of 5 if it was possible. From my understanding, Yassou is a restaurant run by multiple generations of a single family - a family that is truly passionate about what they do. As soon as you step foot in the restaurant, you get the feeling that every employee loves where they work. In a perfect world, every restaurant would evoke these sentiments in their customers. And how about the food? Outstanding food quality and generous portions makes Yassou my absolute favorite Greek restaurant in Las Vegas. Always fresh and high-quality ingredients make every dish a winner. I'm a huge fan of both the greek salad and the gyro + chicken kebab combo plate. The protein is perfectly seasoned and bursting with flavor, and the rice is nothing short of delectable. Do yourself a favor and give Yassou a try!

Z1WIi8Z8U07PeaT7tugHMQ.text: Best is Las Vegas, hands down!  Never disappointed and I refuse to go anywhere else for Greek food.  Mouth watering chicken, delicious lamb, and flavorful steak, I think I'm addicted haha.  Don't get me started on the service, they treat you like family.  If you're looking for the best Greek food in town, you've found it and trust me I guarantee you'll be hooked like my entire staff and I.  I really can't say enough about this place- highly recommended!

OavcaYqqjvNJaBukEXucDQ.text: This place is fantastic! The owner was very accommodating when I asked him about what options were vegan! He made a beautiful veggie plate and made sure that no mistakes were made with feta cheese! The price for the taste is ridiculously cheap and the employees have great conversation skills and make you feel welcomed! Loved this place and I will be coming here again for those amazing dolmades and salad!

glK9GKNCBgmxu5qR0Dx71A.text: So let me start off with I'm a food driver and I'm usually delivering this food on one of the platforms although today I thought I would give them a try for my lunch. The people are always welcoming from the from all the way to the back where usually I'm greeted by not only the cashier but the guy that runs the show in the back. It took about 15mins for a steak souvlaki plate which is more ham reasonable when everything is made to order. The meat was tender and juicy it came with some veggies also on the skewer which just helped enhance the flavor no doubt the rice was some of the best I've had in town and the pita bread was made to perfection. The fries were just fries but to be honest after the bread steak and pilaf I really wasn't interested in the fries. Thanks to the entire staff I will be back!

-S_VIiT8pPgvwWBWuaIDsw.text: Went to many greek places and this one is hands down best in Vegas.  Others should follow suit.  Everything is good and this is def a friendly family business.

iqnI54oqXOAqGnQEO3tRtQ.text: Yassou is our favorite place for Greek food! Here they make everything fresh as you order.  You must try their grilled meat plates  - served with salad, Greek rice, pita.  Their lemon soup is excellent!  Their calamari is yummy!  Ask for Christian or Mr Papas!  They treat their customers like family!! We eat here at least once a week.  Price is also very affordable.

u0kho45oo27K_ljSc67K2Q.text: We have been going to Yassou for at least 10 years and have always loved it (and still do). However if today were our first visit I am not sure how we would have felt. First things first the cashier (I believe her name is Sara) was somewhat rude. When she informed my wife that the red caviar spread was not available she rushed my wife on making a decision on which sauce she wanted extra of. This may have been acceptable if there was a line but we were the only ones ordering. Christian was working hard on the line so I am not sure if he was aware of the shape that the restaurant was in, once again if this was our first time we would have a really bad perception of Yassou.  During our dinner there was another woman cleaning, not a bad thing but the mop water was so strong with bleach that it somewhat interfered with our meal. There were two couples that came in after us and each had a less than stellar experience. The older couple seemed to be almost harassed for asking for an extra plate while the young family seemed to get attitude for requesting the fries and pita they ordered.   We have been avid visitors of Yassou and have recommended it over the other Greek restaurants in town so it was sad to see today be so off. Christian and his family work hard to make it a great experience and I commend him for having such an authentic and delicious restaurant. Maybe there was something in the air or everyone was just way over stressed but today was really just not a good day at Yassou. I really hope stuff like this doesn't end up hurting them as it is our favorite Greek place in town.

tkMBAfSPxsA_D96LVrE3Zg.text: I've been eating here since 2006...  It's 1145am & every table is full....  The best of Las Vegas....  Thanks Christian & Peter

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LPLiIIP9Pn7Nup0s9BKMww.text: This Restaurant has been deteriorating yearly. The Gyros are average @ best. Meat generally is Dry and no longer Fresh. This is the 3rd consecutive time my order has been incorrect. How difficult is it to comprehend NO ONIONS ??? The order is repeated correctly, but the execution is Pitiful. We always Tip, but it does not matter.  I'm through patronizing this once fine establishment. I am always Fair and Honest with my reviews. Some Yelpers give every review ( or the majority of them ) 5 Stars. Others are not satisfied and expect perfection. I call them the "Haters". They are probably the competition IMO.  Yassou has lost a long time Customer.

1hobApAZNN9xJymq3-M6PQ.text: Honestly this place was horrible and I'm a huge Greek food fan! I probably have been to 10 different Greek food places in the valley. This place had amazing reviews and I was very excited but this place let me down in every aspect. First the customer service was not good and they had no emotion at all. Our food literally took 25min and it wasn't even that busy! The food was not very well seasoned and pretty bland! I would definitely not come back to this place and wouldn't recommend to anybody! Save your money or go to a better place like Market Grill Cafe

LlYdfZ4_u198ReJ-QJUR5A.text: I was honestly disappointed with my meal here. I was so looking forward to some authentic Greek food and this is way out the way for me but I found myself on that side of town and decided to try it out. The moussaka was good but barely warm and the spanakopita was severely undercooked. I told them and he remade it but it was still very doughy and not crispy like I'm used to. The service was spectacular and the people were so kind I wanted to like it all but I didn't. I did love the watermelon cucumber drink. It's sad that a drink was the best thing I had there though

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moussaka Plate Spanakopita

m-Q_BHSVdLffQvNnYWRvUg.text: This was our first visit here in a long time. We were surprised how long the table behind us was not cleaned. We arrived at 4:25 on Thursday afternoon. That table clearly has rice all over it, for the thirty minutes we were there and it was never cleaned. There was some damage to the wall as shown in the attached pictures.   We ordered Greek fries to share. Which had feta and chopped parsley on top. My sister ordered the chicken Kabobs with salad. Her meal came with pita bread and tazikie.   We enjoyed our flavorful and tasty meal.
