65X-KmPpl4_Hytf5Cmd6FQ.text: I came to eat at Yassou's while visiting relatives in Las Vegas.  They have been coming here for years and are very friendly with the owner. They suggested the Super Mini special for a taste of everything. I had no regrets, everything on the plate was so delicious! At one point, the owner even came over and chatted with us personally for a few minutes. It was a delicious experience that I plan on enjoying again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super Mini special - pork loin, chicken, and beef skewers with salad, pita, tzaziki and rice

IqNteXhDT8R8mmp8HacL3w.text: I have now eaten here over a hundred times.  Always fantastic.  What else can I say.  Father & Son family run business that is truly "Hands On"   They will make you fantastic food cooked fresh AFTER you order it all at a terrific price.  The owner seems to hire quite an interesting crew and I have to give a shout out to their work ethic and customer service.  Always Excellent.  Something that stands out to me is when the owner is not there the employees take ownership of the place.  I still get a perfect meal, terrific service and the guys cooking don't miss a beat.  Now that says a lot about how much they care about the customers.

A5uzseLKLcafMojn3eWbLg.text: Wow! The Big Fat Gyro is simply the best Gyro I have eaten. I am sold! I will be here quite frequently! Well done!!!

RcbhJocfkOP2qkTZ9oD70w.text: Came in with 30 minutes to close Ordered 2 meals and lady behind counter advised 20 minutes for cook to order.  No problem until I heard the continued rant for 15 minutes behind the grill some guy talking loudly about not being appreciated and got no lunch break today.  Not my fault and as a customer who lives Greek food I should not have to subject to it.  Get another job if you don't like this one.  Not to mention 10 minutes later another women came in right after me and so the rants continued .  I have not got my order so the food better put me in a better mood.

Sp4uVMk3FMBe_zFxu4rixg.text: Really enjoy their salads but the wait time is ridiculous. Even if you order in advanced be prepared to wait additional time. Don't order from here if your lunch is timed because you won't have enough time to eat it. It's taken me almost an hour to get a steak salad.

lyys55hMR7Ly8VAmEDEQpA.text: Good Greek food here, but they make a lot of mistakes so be sure to check your order before leaving when ordering takeout. They've messed up my orders before. I went to their website and contacted them about it after I got home but never heard back. Poor customer service!   Aside from their mistakes, I haven't had any other issues with this place and often order the souvlaki plates. Their gyros and spanikopita are also good too.

74ARXdZi-_4Bgp6yAE0YsA.text: Authentic Greek food that's extremely affordable and flavorful. Mom and pop atmosphere..great customer service . Owner is always there and working hard and going above and beyond. My personal favorites are the Greek fries, tzaki, chicken plate, and the Greek salad. Highly recommend. Support local!

DGbdk_knhK8UBRO9uM9DSA.text: As you drive up to this place is very appealing, clean and welcoming by the staff, specially Chris. We had previously order food to go and it has always been great, but today we actually came into eat as our family date, the food was just amazing and so fresh tasting. The price is very reasonable, and the little wait was worth every bite. Thank you Chris for the chat and making us feel welcome.

GmvVt1dbqf6N1O__kVfbBQ.text: Great service, food, and location. I got the big fat gyro for lunch. I would definitely recommend.

HReRm0phuUOY8vzhnzN3wg.text: Really great place for Greek food. I've never had a bad time here. One time they messed up my order and re made it quickly even though I told them it was ok I just wanted to inform them of the incident they came back to my table with a new plate. This place is great and they have a good variety of delicious Greek food. My get the souvlaki combo with extra rice no salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Souvlaki Combo Plate

mk4J7JCR86eixXH3hZq1GQ.text: I got the lemon chicken gyro and my husband got a skewer combo and we shared hummus, and everything was delicious and fresh. Everyone was very friendly and the service was quick. I will definitely come back!

gfKGM9pEA3iEM48vISVsfw.text: Waiting for my food for an hour and its for pick up and I called 15 mins earlier then only to find out it was just sitting there the whole time. I understand its packed and busy but waiting for no reason is a waste of time, always try to pay attention. Other than that the food is incredibly delicious and yes I will go back.

RUcKvLMb1-3CvVCud9py0A.text: This place used to be one of the top Greek restaurants on my list. Went there today with a coupon from the Entertainment book and discovered that they will no longer take the electronic version of the coupon, which I have used here before. Based on principle, I'm giving them a 1 star review. Don't offer an electronic coupon if you're not going to take it. Furthermore, at least post a sign that you're no longer accepting the coupon.

sXxunlKeHiupOtMk5NsNEA.text: Not bad for a quick bite. The gyro was fine, nothing to get too crazy about. The veggies on the gyro were fresh so they get a thumbs up for that. The Greek fries were slightly disappointing as there was only one tiny piece of feta cheese. I would give it another shot in the future based on the fresh veggies.

sx-49WaIiL8vyO6PbrUTzA.text: So yummy!! Attentive staff! The gyro was delicious and everything tasted fresh. The cashier was good and attentive and the staff is friendly. Best Greek food I've had in a while! Also the baklava is delicious and highly recommended!

vXdRdSCLcS7a_HFUqZLIwQ.text: The first thing that drew me to Yassou Greek Grill Cafe in 2008 was the building.  I'm a fan of Greek Mythology and had only had Greek food once before, and thought this place with the Greek lettering and broken pillar logo looked quite inviting.  Plus, it was very close to CSN.  My favorite thing to order is the My Big Fat Gyro w/o onions... because, well, who likes onions?  You get a great, heaping helping of lamb, tomatoes, lettuce, feta, and tzatziki sauce.  The Greek fries are also yummy-- I think they are sprinkled with a touch of lemon, and then lots of feta cheese.  The owners are amicable and if you're unsure of what to order, they can make great recommendations.  One of my friends hadn't had lamb before, and they sliced a sample off the rotisserie just for her to try.  They also sell the pita bread they use on their gyros.  I'm so happy that a mom and pop place that actually serves quality food is surviving this economy.

AfdMolgAn1U1YHPrlIbEIQ.text: Where do I begin? I always passed this cute little Greek restaurant on my way to my friends house until one day I decided to give it a try. Thank goodness I did the food was amazing you can just taste the  freshness and authenticity but also the passion the chef has for his cooking the minute I walked in I was greeted not only by the cashier but the chef came out to say hello as well I felt very welcomed and most definitely content with my food. You have the option of taking you food to go, eat inside the restaurant, or eat out in their patio which is what I did. :)

_TDO7DkUOvTRGw4M_v6EVA.text: I went here tonight for the first time.. My order was completely screwed up and didn't even get a receipt. I even ordered cucumbers with my hummus and the guy at the counter said sure no problem but I never heard him mention it to the chef.. It appears I got the totally wrong order even though I stood there with a number which he called out!! I would never go back to this place.. Paymons and even the Mad Greek blow this place out of the water for both flavor and service. The fries which weren't even what I ordered Tasted horrible too !!!

-3CK8hFETWQwYalZBFUxmQ.text: Recently, dined in and the food was fantastic .. Best Greek food in town. Their rice is always perfection.

TbKQpr6sSR6k1Obm9Ui0hQ.text: I've eaten here three times within a week. It is that good.  The Mini Souvlaki needs to have its name changed. It should be called "Perfect Souvlaki" because the portioning is perfect, and the food is perfect.  It's been only a month since I've moved to Vegas, and it's restaurants like this that make it easy for me to call a new city home.

OoocM6drxwCBDcZymIhAOg.text: I love the food... too many house flies for me to deal with!!  On six or seven visits the flies are terrible... with the open lamb meet it makes me sick to think about it.  If they do something about it then I will be back for sure!!!

ms59miJzzb305VmtfhgFMw.text: This is my first time yelping, but dear holy essence, this place is good.  I saw great reviews on Yelp and had to judge it.  I've had a lot of Greek food growing up and these people deliver.  Very fresh and tasty.  Fast, friendly, and perhaps cheesily but fittingly stylish.  Very impressed.  The standard lamb gyro platter was exceptional.

q-Aj-n7wFD6fZhhzdNGsEg.text: If you like real authentic Greek food, this is the place. My recommendation would be the chicken and gyro soulvaki. My all time favorite here. They also make the baklava fresh and in house. I cant wait to come back here. Christian and his father are dedicated to this family business and serving the community they live in. Keep up the great work guys.

dF3cYVCuQ4A5bbmDeZSQpA.text: Order, take a number, and when ready they deliver to your unclean table. They have a clean charming window light room, BUT it's locked so you have to wait for a dirty table to open up. Food is tasty though, and complete with a thimble size serving of hummus.

9sGrzlu_MuvLM_fdkR292g.text: I have never been disappointed with my food from here. I usually get the super lemon-herb chicken Pita and a side of Greek fries and occasionally I'll get a side of hummus. My taste buds are screaming  from all the delicious flavors I love how fresh and flavorful the food is, and that the owner always remembers me and my boyfriend no matter how long it's been!

XGhaTQgZowS1QNt0DBp2sg.text: If you love Greek food, this is certainly the place to sit down and enjoy with friends. The BEST gyro in Las Vegas.... I swear.... With a respectable price to accompany a large portion.

T-i0ouQLdYtDlC11-zdZ7w.text: It's quite a hike from the airport/strip. Wasn't bad at all but nothing to write home about.

YILLZCxovSByw_BTCHkLMA.text: I eat here almost 4 times a week! What's my order? "Gyro-Chicken salad, meat well-done  to go!" This is the best way to order, I know because I'm the "DUKE"  Chicken well done am I insane? No! Trust me when you order the chicken well done, it ends up being crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside because of the marinated lemon juice.  As for the Gyro being well done, that should be mandatory at all gyro places due to the questionable meat, but I make it a point to do so. Plus, i like my gyro meat that way because it ends up tasting like bacon.  "To go" because of the Panda Express rule. Your just get more and  It is served in a nice container with dressing on the side. If you order to eat there, it's served on a plate and the dressing is way too wet for the salad.     So the whole order is sort of like a chopped chicken salad with feta instead. I forgot about the small bits of fried pita that taste like heaven!

pqa_zNLP_kjpQALxn4Zl8Q.text: I've been here twice and I'm so sad I don't eat here more often ... the food is amazing, you have to try their banana passion fruit smoothie its amazing ( I believe thats what I had lol). I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Q3gOU-j8pPxIMUnKhn3TXw.text: It's been hard to find a good Greek restaurant here in the valley....finally found it!!!so good. Meat is cooked but still juice and tender. Great customer service too

LugLx8VjvSbgMGgQbgIG3A.text: The white guy behind the counter in front that packages up your food for take out is NASTY. he needs to stop touching his face, wiping his sweat, digging in his ears and touching his nose and mouth repeatedly w out washing. Just left the place and couldn't write this faster. I'm grossed out at his unsanitary methods. Great food, just a nasty ,dirty, sweaty, greasy guy giving it to you. Bon appetite!

_N31caDkoz8motVGfoPJow.text: Good environment. Love the Greek Fries. I haven't had much else. Also it's a Pokestop!

_kGaZsvu9d8ASEX2-9Ehfg.text: This is absolute best Greek in all of VEGAS and maybe beyond. I've had friends from Chicago tell me this beats anything they have there. We use them for catering as well. Authentic and the staff is fantastic. I would eat here every day if I could. Get the Greek fries.

Xo4ySIapRh1Gi4YVMudopg.text: This place was absolutely delicious. I just had the gyro, but there was just the right amount of everything. Definitely a new regular eat out restaurant.

6TrpSJMM2JWlFjGIbaE4Sw.text: Extremely well priced. Excellent food. Huge portions. Will definitely eat here 2-3X a month going forward. Nice atmosphere on all levels. One of my favorites for this food category. A MUST TRY! !!

vzGIQm3-MrBXM5rN5FGE2Q.text: I have been coming here for more than 10 years. The food is fantastic and the staff is friendly. We love the gyros and Greek fries. My favorite is the Spanakopita plate.

R8aEIQUY3esZVSBSvJHU7w.text: Got the spanakopita and a basic gyro. Both were really good but not the best I've had. The staff was nice and then place was very clean.   Despite not being the best, the spanakopita was pretty damn good. I once had the ultimate spanakopita at a fair and have been on a hunt to find one that compares ever since. I've run into some really narly ones while on this quest. Let me tell you, Yassou's spanakopita is not one of those. Probably the best I've had aside from them legendary one.   My only complaint is the sauce and neat were kind of pushed towards one side of these gyro.

qqjfaxtrC6s3Pt9b_JHhWQ.text: I'm obsessed with this place! It's vegetarian-friendly, but not vegan-friendly, because of all of the feta cheese. My personal favorites are the Greek fries & the spanakopitas. Spanakopitas are kind of like spinach & feta turnovers.  I should warn new-comers, they don't make falafels. According to the owner (who is a nice man that loves his restaurant), falafels are Mediterranean, but not Greek. He only serves strictly Greek food. At first I wasn't sure about the place, because of that, but it helped me try new foods that I probably wouldn't have given the chance otherwise.  It's definitely worth trying! I now come here at least twice a month. :)

Y32qRGBUVbHVFFtJ2dWpwA.text: Visited a couple times - mostly for special occasions. Service is decent but not outstanding. The food is what brings us back. Most recently we placed an order for pick up and 1) ordered Greek coffee which we received in a cup less than half full. Not sure if this is the normal serving?? 2) found a hair in our food. Never a pleasant finding.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hair in take out food

g5GT4Xk9rL56McdVBzGw8A.text: Their food is pretty good. But make sure to check your order before leaving. I've been here more than a few times for take out and everytime my order is wrong. Just disappointing.

4vEXDX-IZO92v_GVlL7rSw.text: No other Greek restaurant compares to this place. While it can be a bit pricy, it has never let me down.

D5dr0JTZHiL17rvMHFvkog.text: This little gem has been one of my favorites for years now. Wonderful service and even better food.

t68cjwtDnbylvM9XeMN12Q.text: Great find!!! :) yummy food! Yummy gyro! Yummy souvlaki! yummy yummy!!! And friendly service!!! We are coming back!!

xI6jDkVdoATiOhmvKGKRuQ.text: U cant go wrong with this place i love everything .....the chicken the steak salad smoothie bannas .yum yum yum

snJfNTaBA0i44qPvjF3SxQ.text: Delicious, drool inducing Greek yumminess. Decent prices and really freaking good food! Nicely air conditioned, pleasing aesthetics. I suggest the combination Souvlaki plate.

yhrlgEnm26n-c5n_2n3SfA.text: Not often am on that side of town. Whenever I do make it point too get my greek on! I think by far the best Greek food in Vegas. Everything on the menu is Greek heaven! I always get the gyros and spankopita! The gryos meat juicy, spot on cooked, as is the spankopita, and awesome greek salad (love the dressing, nice black greek olives, nice feta chesse, cucumbers) and rice. The price really REALLY affordable talk about food for under $10 get money worth! I tried the baklava normally never have enough room by the end. I had lunch with friends visiting decided too try much different things off the menu. Dessert was one of them. Nice. Really sweet and rich but then again that the only way I think of baklava! Music playing is authentic Greek music. You truly get that feeling of old school family (hold less then 80 people?) run restaurant. Not chain restaurant and tell the quality of the food feels like family secrets from one generation too another.   The staff is really friendly and visitors in town not normally eat greek food had questions. The server was very attentive and answered all of my friends questions.   The parking ample parking in front of the building the only thing gets me each time. I tend too miss the entrance for that little shopping complex. It tends too sneak up on you and that the only entrance for that shopping area. I had too turn around. Still for piece of Greek heaven so worth it! =)))

Em-4svGpfQzr4_uzqBdkTw.text: We were out running errands on a Saturday and had watched "Mama Mia" the night before, so were in the mood for some good Greek food! We did a search on Yelp, read the reviews and found Yassou! I was interested in the Souvlaki Plate and the guy taking our order pointed out a special that was less expensive and was a smaller lunch portion - which was exactly what I was looking for! The platter contained a skewer sampler of chicken, steak and pork and I asked for double greek salad instead of rice. All the meat was cooked nicely and seasoned well. The salad was fresh, the pita was fluffy and tzatziki was delicious. Hubby got the Big Fat Gyro and said that it was tasty and satisfying. We were too full for the Baklava but saw it and will have to give it a try next time! I highly recommend this if you are in the neighborhood and need a satisfying Greek lunch or snack!

3P41KaTfMIKpJ9mwreE6sA.text: I walked out rather than wait for what looked like good food.   I was all excited about getting calimari in a mediteranian restaurant.  Never got so far as seeing if it was the real deal with tentacles or the scrappy calimari steak made out of octopus served in California most of the time.   The lunch plate sounded very good...beware. The olives have Pitts...a good way to break a too th...but truly olives are more tasty with Pitts....so the staff and the owner wouldn't wait for me to pull up their 5 dollar coupon and wouldn't honor it on line...only printed out.  They tried to guilt me into why I can't I plan in advance and get my printer to link with my computer....not their business.  I will return with a caseload of tourists and my service puppy and see what they have to say...rude people...they refused another coupon for a mature couple who didn't show the coupon assertively before the order was rung up....thumbs down here...I walked out....no stevia...no napkins....no wait staff to take your orders.   I get that the owner is Greek...this is a mediteranian restaurant...they have hummus but no tabouli or Tahini...REALLY.....go to chick pea or sababa in summerlin....imho...ShadowZRanch

NLw4ACyVXhnj0hYSINgm-w.text: Consistently delicious!! The service and the food is excellent and never disappoints!!

Ke_t3VrvQJ22b1x75P4YdA.text: I heard about this place from a friend. Went durning lunch hour and line was out the door!  I never mind waiting when there is a line, just means it's good!  I got the chicken and beef skewer combo.  I forgot to take a picture, I need to remember to do that.  Oh boy, the rice it comes with is so good. It was fluffy and seasoned so delicious.  Everything was really good and you get a lot of food.  Definitely going back there is do much I need and want to try!

Zm6SppNPczPmqff56d3dKA.text: Tried it for the first time and was quite pleased with the service and food quality. We tried the Greek salad, humus, and two gyro specials.   All the dishes were tasty, showed some pride in presentation, and exhibited a nice mild blend of Greek flavors.   The food tastes clean and fresh.  The meat was evenly cooked and lightly seasoned.    Overall this is great place for a healthy, filling lunch.

Q37h9vrA5TNCZscrm_GU-A.text: I haven't had much Greek cuisine in the past. Usually my experience has been not good with gyro's but this place is the real deal. It's a great place run by a real Greek. You must visit this place!

MyEmA5H3vk3aUKxva06t0A.text: First time impression: I read reviews and thought this restaurant must be pretty good......NO!!! Had the gyro plate and meat was just like leather. Was thinking to make shoes out of it! I gave 2 stars only for the service...for the food 0 stars.

Gg82PnYZ7o9bl3FstHT5AQ.text: Nothing special, average food for way too high of prices. Food lacks flavor, people are nice. Way better Greek food in town

XZxMK-QmTBRjV9nroFd3Qw.text: Great food and extremely friendly staff!!! The hummus and pita bread is to die for! :) Would absolutely be back to this amazing Greek establishment!

jsnOHDe2K-7T9CZmFQe61w.text: This is our second time here and the food was great. The dining room could definitely use some love. It's a little cramped and getting to the outside tables is slightly confusing. The service was very friendly and I'm thinking this may be our go-to Greek place   If you're on the fence I say its worth a shot. Stop in and see what you think.   So far I haven't strayed far from the gyros but I plan on further exploring the menu (hopefully not at the detriment to my waist size ;) )

pk2T9F3jFTXeo_yRddh0Dg.text: Best gyros in Vegas. Family owned atmosphere. Great service. Excellent ambiance. Fresh ingredients. What more can I say about this place it's the best

khy05NpQjtasQfIlmwUGcg.text: Good food, close to my house. The food has never been bad, and most plates they serve are more than I can eat.  Unfortunately, the parking sucks, and getting to the location is very inconvenient. So while they are the place I think of when I desire Greek food, I don't mind finding an excuse to try somewhere else.

Lq8oVUtUvL6ULyLdfgr7SA.text: The best Greek food I have ever had. Will be back many more times. Suggest the souvlaki combo as it is a perfect mixture and shows how good the chicken and beef is.

sjb-MpY3AA0nswW8vMG6ug.text: My first time visiting this place, and I am glad I did. Came in for lunch  with some work buddies. Really fresh, and we'll priced. I ordered the lemon steak gyro, and some french fries. The gyro was the best I have ever had. The steak was cooked well, and very flavorful. I will definitely be back!

uMJiuIS4jUKUeOITjk_Sgg.text: Always fresh, tender, tasty... spanikopita was dry but the food's usually very consistent.  Good food, value...2 can eat for under $20

QfL2eeCP32nuScRDq1Ln9w.text: Whew just finished my meal I got the mini souvlaki special which is one bee and one chicken skewer both with about 3 pieces of meat on it, salad and rice and a pita. I opted for no rice and double salad  It was so good the meat was so flavorful and neither were over cooked, the salad was so. Great too! I looked at other people plates and everything looked amazing! Will def come back!!

jgv-dZsGLVBLn3kGZXrowA.text: Great food. Highly recommended, probably the best Greek food in Vegas.   Service VERY SLOW. Make sure to order in advance. Gyros meat is freshly roasted and shaved in the back; it doesn't get much more authentic than this.  Chicken Souvlaki was great; reflected all the classic flavors of Eastern Europe. Hummus was fresh, light, delightfully spiced, and tasty.   Enjoy.

w7FJ6tQO8cjYUeIMlySfZw.text: Love the chicken skewer plate, cute little lunch spot for me and my family, friendly service, but really... What's not to love?

uXHDc6RBOAohr1p8hAkTqw.text: This place has the best Greek food in Lv. Great atmosphere! I have come here 5 times in the last month. Im hooked on great food and above and beyond great service. All the staff are awsome!!! And also all the customers that patronage the place makes it feel like one big happy greek family!. All smiles here w this place. O ya it always seems to be full when i go so expect to wait 15 min give or take for food to come out.

8PIevtLZ_dEgbN2lOcOWiw.text: The big fat gyro is so yummy!  One of the best gyros I've had for sure.  The pita bread is delicious and moist as well.  We will be coming back for sure.

-Ycm8A-b3a-hQH3w4N9Ipg.text: Authentic! Amazing! Flavorful! Price is on point! Never a disappointing meal. Recommend this place to families too!

u7slQ4hmyB0ILyuYJKhFRQ.text: Woke up in the middle of the night craving a nice gyro.... Hmmmmm the feta cheese and yassou takes pride in the Quality...

C9XZ41_Fr_NsmeRVWsMZNg.text: I was looking for mediteranean And find this place with the help of Yelp!!It was lunch time and they had lunch special the chicken was good, not a 5stars because the service was little too long  and the table outside not clean but for the price i have no regret and Yes i will go back if i am in this area of town!!

wUcKD539krUAaOJK--_Uxw.text: Have been coming here for years now and again and again the food is always consistently good. We've tried almost everything on their menu by now and never at a loss as to what to order - it's ALL good. The gyro meat is one of the best we've ever had anywhere, very moist and has a great flavor. Service is friendly and reasonably quick since all food is made to order. I especially enjoy their lemon herb chicken souvlaki. I'm not a big steak fan so I wish they could also include lamb on their menu. The pita is soft and plentiful. The rice is a winner! Try the Greek Pizza - a pleasant surprise.

RlM5Dp4wqkW2eY-IiXXD_Q.text: Easy to miss from the street. Cannot enter if west bound on Charleston. Not enough parking and small spaces. When it was my turn in line the cashier took order from people behind me. The guy and his pregnant wife ordered ignoring that I was in line ahead of them.  Perhaps I should have made a scene, instead I went back to the end of the line. I waited while five other people who were behind me ordered before me.  I ordered Gyros plate to go. Was $10.15 (included tax). Soda was $2! Are you kidding me? Hello, you are not on the strip. Food was mediocre. Nowhere near as good as Shish Kabob Cafe. I realize one is Greek and other is Armenian, but items on menu are similar. For dine in, Yassou serves food on disposable plates. Cheesy. I would describe as overpriced fast food.  I was not impressed and will probably not go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyros plate $10.15 (includes tax)

l2JOynl6cBQN4rU5QABFIw.text: I was tired of McDonald's, Burger King, and all the other fast food restaurants I was eating from.  So, I yelped for places and found this with some good ratings and others not so good.  Needless to say, I had no expectations for this restaurant.  I figured anything that doesn't have anything to do with American fast food will be good for me.  Our order were as follows: 1.)  My Big Fat Gyro 5.79 Flame broiled beef & lamb with feta cheese.  This was tasty and had a lot of flavor to it.  Because it was so fat, it was hard to put my mouth around it.  That didn't sound too good, should I have written this differently so it doesn't so graphic?  All jokes aside, this is definitely a no joke gyros. 2.)  Greek Fries  $2.69 I have had better greek fries.  For some reason, this was more bland than the other ones I've had in other restaurants. 3.)  Veggie Spreads Plate 7.49 A delicious assortment of Hummus, Tzakziki, Taramosalata & meatless Dolmades.   I felt this one was lacking something.  The rice was just so bored on its own, and I found the salad to be just okay.  Everything else on the plate was pretty good.  As for texture, there wasn't much added to it.    I rated it A-Ok because it's just that, A-Ok.

7XYLktceBAfKR1VEzW12qg.text: The best place to get a gyro. Meat is tender, pita bread is fresh and the sauce appears to be homemade. People are friendly and service is great. No better place for Greek food

Bjh-TbLt7FkRncnfQ86FfA.text: We stopped in a few times and we always enjoyed our meal...its nothing too fancy, but real good flavors and huge plates that make your tastebuds happy :) Mmm...

x-VHJBESF1aMBpzEqrxC9Q.text: The atmosphere, food and service is superb. I would not hesitate ot return to Yassou and to bring my friends. If you like Greek and Mediterranean food you will love Yassou.

OccQg0OcL_8y2RK07DhT1A.text: 3 years later and this is the only place my husband and I go for greek food. The consistency after all these years is hard to find in resturants but they are still top notch. Nick the cook is always awesome and has been there since i started going.Thank you :)

RP48hvS4TXz3OiuyZKHMDA.text: We had Yassou's delieverd to our office and it was my first time having Yassou. I was enjoyed my meal very much, the traditional gyro was so flavorful and the chicken kabobs were easily eaten on the stick, i wasnt a fan of the baklava the ratio of filo and filling wasnt even there was to much filo and not enough filling but other than that the meal was fantastic

BtaxZhqXeVtjbY3l8i5Jgw.text: Very good Greek fast food.  The gyros and chicken souvlaki (kabob) are a good tasty combo. The place could be a bit more inviting inside and the orders done a little faster but the food itself makes up for all that.  I go back when I get a chance and nearby!

eI-zW57HqQe18RJMKtnsCg.text: I am a Greek/Mediterranean food fanatic.  After reading the reviews on Yelp I decided to give Yassou a try. I was pleasantly greeted by the man running the register. He seemed friendly on a personal basis with several of the customers there which is a good sign (repeat customers).  I decided to get Yassou gyro combo with Greek fries. I was very impressed with the gyro. It was delicious.  The greek fries were good, but not impressive.  The spices advertised must have left out.  I got regular fries with feta cheese and a little greenery on top, but they are only fries. I'll take a good gyro over fries any day. I look forward to trying out more of their menu.

RyPKoe9dqFYwL_4fsJ5gsg.text: I can honestly say this is a neighborhood restaurant that stays consistent.  The food is excellent, you cant beat the price for the well portioned meals, and the service is fast and friendly.    I've moved out of the neighborhood but I can say I'll go out of my way to come here for a great meal.

QmBOoqDusufWq6fkS2zvLw.text: I'm a regular here and the food is always fresh and consistent in flavor. The portions are good for the price. I usually get the combo plates. Friendly service and nice atmosphere.

0H5TXN9ytRLLm5KLSMVr0A.text: I've been going to this establishment since I was a little kid. It always brings back good memories. The employees are always great and the food is always spectacular. This is the best Greek food in Las Vegas hands down. I highly recommend it. What's better than supporting a family owned restaurant. If you want Greek food this is the place to go!

veo_GRTPTympi8rz1vYOdg.text: Best Greek fast food in town. It's so perfect. Their yellow rice is the perfect comfort food, as is there spanakopita and saganaki. Perfection.

YVI16CMM1yJn069kLlxbLQ.text: The service was so horrible. They really ruined my experience and would not want to visit again based on that. The star I guess would be for the cook with the curly gray hair. He seems nice and he was really working. A small piece of advice that I could leave would be for the employees to not go smoke on their break by the people dining outside. Also, there are no pictures up so if someone asks a question about the menu there is no need to be annoyed. One last thing, maybe you should bring everyone's food out at the same time. It's awkward for one person to be eating the the other person doesn't get their plate for another 15 minutes and they're left to eat alone.

7cMxNqPJ9yLhapr69Ai-0w.text: Mostly Greek men working the grill and counter. Quality food, attentive staff, lively atmosphere. Had the Gyros sandwich several times and finally tried a combo dish and did not disappoint.

gkEnOiUOylAAOTX0BgRhvw.text: Best gyro in town! Can't go wrong with the spanakopita and gyro plate. Excellent portion size and the dressing for the salad is amazing. Would recommended this place to everyone. This place is a must try!

3XJQnej_51SPMcChSguYQg.text: Yassou is one of my favorite Greek places!!  Homemade rice pudding, fresh food and great service!!  I've eaten here many times and I am in love with the gyro plate!!

1IcHoc27JutbvfjIf2WWnA.text: Good portions, good price, for good food.  I go to lunch here a few times a year as it is closer to the office than Paymon's.  If I am looking for speedy greek food, this is the place to go.  Stick with Gyros salad or Gyros and fries and you cannot go wrong.

iAYh5qnhac0-e83hoyGGmQ.text: I enjoy the little place and the location. I love that greek isle feel. I really enjoy the chicken pita here it is so flavorful. Love how you can taste the lemon. The only thing I don't like is the pita bread with the chicken platter because it is so bland but it does taste good when it's a sandwich. Lunch specials are pretty good here.  PROS: decor, location, and food

mMQ9Ry3LzUy3XQT9xEQn0w.text: Had a gyro and couldn't complain about it at all. The pita was warm and chewy, the meat was seasoned well and very tender and the all veggies were fresh and delicious. I can't wait to come back and try this place again and try some new items off the menu.

bLnQjZi00O1cjet-HJXwFg.text: Big Gat Gyro was definitely on point. However the dolmas were really not that great, meat was dry and way too much lemon. Will for sure try other items.

NkQNABfJZrFS3nlEtSjKmw.text: This is probably the best Greek food my wife and I have experienced in a while. It was all home made and tasted excellent.   Recommend to anyone who wants to experience home cooked Greek food. Not only is it Greek it is Great.

b5QkJU12O20lviu1K-6gyA.text: This place is truly the best Greek food in town! I eat here minimum once a week. The owners are fantastic people and they take pride in their food and restaurant. I highly recommend the slavaki plates. The food is cooked fresh and consistently great. The tazeki sauce is on point and I have to order extra because I love it so much.

slNDpfp-JZ0Ob5ZNvSLuDQ.text: Been here several times now. I must say these guys do a business!  They always have customers and even if it's busy the food comes out quick. I've tried the lemon chicken pita and the fat Greek pita both delicious  If you're on the fence about trying this place get off and just go. You will be happy you did.

2j3LnOqU1uWvepj8Gt0xrA.text: My husband and I LOVE this local family- run cafe for several reasons!    The BEST gyro sandwich " big fat gyros " with the right flavors and most delicious tzatziki sauce!!  Christian and his dad Peter run the grill and work so hard to pour authentic Greek goodness into every plate served!    I have lived in Crete and know authentic food- you don't want to miss this!! Ps: Baklava for a little something sweet is delish, and if you are craving Greek salad- try the " lunch special " plate- skewers of beef or chicken- or both- with salad, buttery yummy rice, freshly toasted pita bread, and that amazing tzatziki sauce!!!

xHYJQdA2xhJyyMfLzD5JYw.text: The owner is always friendly   he makes a special rice  Food there is very tasty everybody's friendly  Very nice place to take your family to go for dining

0xJEgUMTLq5MkEVlAqyMVA.text: My husband and I have been coming to Yassou for the past year. It has become my favorite spot for greek / mediterranean style food. My favorite dish is the lamb chops. They are great cuts of meat and they are cooked perfectly every time. When I'm not in the mood for lamb my second favorite dish is the grilled chicken salad. Yassou hummus is superb as well. Portions are great and they will adjust your order to your liking. The staff has always been very welcoming when we come in as well. Give Yassou a try, you'll love them too.

cLidNx12qmOetqBiY-tCxA.text: the best greek in town family run business  reasonable prices  good value for good sized portions the owners care and it shows

OEoRObakhAvIledG6szmEQ.text: This is a great family run Greek restaurant. The food is fantastic and made to order so it's always fresh. The service is always very attentive. It gets busy around lunchtime so there is a nice sunroom/porch outside with ac. I highly recommend this place for authentic Greek food.

-gWkKaykxUwsX_f0PiRxaw.text: We just moved to Vegas recently and were looking for a good Greek restaurant , and we found it with this place. We all got the gyro plate. Oh my goodness. Everything on that plate was amazing!  The only  complaints I have is the meat seemed to dry out as we were eating it from the fans above us as we were eating. And the place was not as clean as it could have been.  The workers were all very nice and we will definitely  be back. The food was just so tasty.

hZxGTENFzI8DdFjzBWOZYQ.text: Absolute best Greek spot in Vegas ! I am not Greek, but I still know this. Always super friendly service and great food !

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

40k6m0dE0xnVGcCFFph_EQ.text: Yassou has been my go-to place for greek food for over 7 years now!  Food is flavorful and staff is friendly. I always get the Super lemon chicken gyro and my husband gets the My Big Fat Greek Gyro with greek fries...so good!

NLe4VMEHU_wVAsKHTrLBeg.text: Amazing food, best Greek food in Las Vegas! I enjoy the Greek Salad with Gyro meat, my wife really likes the chicken skewers with rice. Friendly staff always happy and willing to help. It gets really busy around lunch time so arrive early. Great for catering as well.

Jj4ljWCCgtBuiUZxATBWbg.text: Love this place! The Moussaka is out of this world! Everything else is excellent too. I love that I see the owner working in the back and greeting people. Couldn't ask for better Greek food (I lived in Athens for 2 years). Please try this place....you will become a regular.

UMD0C9b3YdWoqZuu33RiIQ.text: So I had given it a good review before... because it was tasty... but I had ordered my food to go... when I actually dined there I witnessed much cross contamination. And I heard them refer to another guest as a chink in the dress... referring to an Asian woman...and they were bagging raw chicken next to the salads for prep... I was grossed out and couldn't even eat the salad there

bJW4q17XKqVBdhSamH01vQ.text: The food was good. Not great. Liked their salsa bar, ehich included a mango salsa that was really fresh and tasty. I went here a few weeks ago and check in. Just now dojng the review. Didn't take a photo and trying to remember what I even ordered. The restaurant had a cool bar in the back. I think they just need to do a good cleaning from top to bottom. Floors were not clean. Wonder what the kitchen looked like.

6FBHkDi-tkt4QCC3B0ZVsg.text: This is one of the best places for Greek food. They have an amazing selection of food and drinks. They get extremely crowded during lunch time, so be prepared for that. Otherwise, I'll be coming back here anytime I have cravings for Greek food!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NmB0KWCw_LLU8sbdlNlsbA.text: Yassou's is one of my favorite Greek places in town. The gyro meat is the absolute best. I drive across town just to get the Greek pasta. Only other place I had the pasta was when I was in Greece. The staff is incredibly friendly. It's a great atmosphere and most importantly great food. You can't go wrong with coming here.

kTPsLEJ48eieXRPr4c2piQ.text: BOMB A FOOD. Love the Greek food. And they're genuinely good not Americanized. Thanks for the rest service, fresh food and awesome company!

6H5y6erDGocUo1cBSm2bPw.text: Me and my husband visit almost weekly ( my favorite is the salmon ) OMG to die for.We have always been treated so nicely by everyone there.Pete the cook/owner  makes us feel just like family..I will always be a loyal customer. #IloveYassou

GUsKI4P96oAeofuaX8PG4A.text: My favorite place for Greek food, my faves are the deluxe Greek salad, the big fat gyro and you have to try the Greek fries delish! Friendly service and super good food.

5rVi1URgLF6EEcBRIj9HKw.text: Was here for lunch on 11/20/2010.  I ordered a Gyro (platter).  It was quite good. I love these and had not eaten one in a very long time.   I found the side of greek salad lacking a bit, it had enough cheese & dressing, but otherwise was all lettuce (only one olive).  I would have liked to see more "stuff" in the salad.    The "lamb" was a little dry, not ready to believe its always this way though. Having only eaten here once, this may have only been the luck of the draw, not sure. I will certainly try it again.

KMiLamyzDshLf6DWVZDGwg.text: Love this place. Come here all the time from across town. Good vegetarian options for me, fresh food and big portions. Family-run restaurant so that's a plus too!

pvCJ8sleWHXAyDx4e1octA.text: After three one-star reviews in a row, I'm happy to add this (what's going on with the businesses in Vegas?!)  Can't get enough of this place - the food is so delicious.  And the staff is great.  I sometimes pick up food to-go to take to my guy who lives five hours away in the mountain with no Greek, no Asian, no nothing food around and they are awesome enough to fulfill my request in separating certain things to prevent sogginess/etc.  Usually order the Big Fat Gyro, or the dinner places of lamb/beef.  I've had the chicken slouvaki and that was delicious as well.  I'm going to try and make some lemon rice because their's has inspired me so much.

K4VJriguE8CkKjlNwJwluQ.text: Definitely worth it!  First time I tried this place was by accident while looking for a place to eat.  All I can say is the food is just awesome!  I live in Las Vegas now and I practically come here once or twice a month.  The customer service is great as well.  If you get a chance, definitely stop by!

-a_qA01ZrhNS3ECOYg9Nxw.text: Great place great food. My family said they loved the food and they wanted to come back very soon. The price is extremely reasonable. Will be back very soon.

fRwXHRRz57aY-MpLhfOjKw.text: I really like this place-I even consider it better than Paymon's or any of the Greek places I've been to in Las Vegas thus far.  The prices are very fair for what you get, and because it is "fast-casual", you don't really need to tip-a dollar or two is sufficient (IMO).  Food is fresh and very good.  It's a smaller place and not fancy, but it is VERY clean and is quite attractive.  The only negative is that they close rather early for my tastes (around 8 PM), and I really like to eat around 9 on weekends.  It's definitely worth a try-it's sort of "out of the way" in a retail/office building next to McDonald's on Buffalo and Charleston.

vHhf3Q2D8ndTpoG0NYhUQw.text: Finally checked this place out yesterday. Trying to hit up all the spots I have bookmarked! Anyway, the service was very friendly and I ordered the chicken special for lunch, which was 1 souvlaki skewer, salad, rice, tzatziki and pita. The bf ordered the super lemon chicken pita. My chicken souvlaki was nice and moist, but the salad was drenched in dressing that seemed to be dumped on top of the lettuce and not tossed through. That's a pet peeve of mine...hate getting one bite of dry salad and then the next bite swimming in dressing. Small thing, but kinda ruined the salad for me--the feta on it was yummy though. The tzatziki was ok,  but I've had better. It just tasted a bit processed or something--can't quite put my finger on it.   Overall we both thought the food was good, but it wasn't so spectacular that I can't wait to go back. Don't get me wrong, I would definitely stop in there again for lunch if I was in the area, but I prob won't go out of my way to make a special trip over there.

lM-aldMMJbHyYb4byivmUA.text: Let me start by saying that I am not a huge fan of Greek food. This place is pretty fantastic. I got the lemon herb steak salad and for something so simple, it sure was mighty tasty! The chef is friendly and will make suggestions for you as well.

dpsuXpAE7I5hFIwZgkqrtg.text: Came in here today for the first time and WOW!! I don't know too much about Greek food and the boy Jackson and the counter was extremely helpful and guided me through the menu and gave me his personal recommendations of what to try. When my food came out I was very impressed with how great everything tasted. I will definitely be coming back for more!

Iq9NMyKqOCBVXFHcG0-QwQ.text: One of my favorite places -- super love their Steak Souvlaki plate! The steak is always tender, delicious and bursting with flavor! Once a week, we do a special lunch/cheat day at work and 90% of the time, this is where we want to eat :) The staff is also super nice and friendly.

VhVCRFdHoe6Vp_A613AJoA.text: This is probably the best quick Greek food in Las Vegas.  They also do the food at the annual Greek festival.  I love the gyro and rice.  The baklava is quite good as well.  The service is good and so are the prices.  :-)

NiEqyByIUbhXgVC9os7liQ.text: Here's the straight forward deal on this place. If you want a gyro they're great. Makes a good tzatziki sauce. Uses Kronos gyro meat which I like better than even homemade ones I've had and they must sell enough that Pitts are fresh. However, I wouldn't get a Greek salad or any of the sides like tiramusalata etc. I ordered a few because I love all those sides. They were very disappointing. Grape leaves were so so (there is one place that has by far the best in town). I was told once a week they make their own, but the ones I had tasted like the canned ones, which are fine but not what I was hoping for in a mom and pop place. Greek food is tough in Vegas, which is why it's generally first stop when I go home. I was really hoping for better, and I'll still go back when I want a gyro because really those were excellent but if I want Greek food, I'll wait till I head out of town still.

FXQVUg3PjCR9MoTJjDlkPA.text: This is by far the best greek restaurant in town. I'm a vegetarian so I always get the spanakopita and greek salad.

w-flxBBy4dyuLATUjkbTQQ.text: This family run restaurant is great! It was our first time so we asked for help and we received great suggestions. Food was fresh, fast and full or flavor. Lunch rush gets a little crazy but there is plenty of seating outside.

cHjFzi8RwB4YAFPpRtgrnA.text: YUMM YUMM YUMM!!!! Found this place on accident and couldn't be happier that I did. The lunch special is the best and can't beat the price! I love this place! Parking can be tough if it's during the lunch rush hour.

7DyuRSoZt3lxRiH9FmcY3g.text: I am a Food Network restaurant chaser.  Mainly Diner, Drive ins and Dives.  Not sure why this restaurant hasn't been profiled yet.  Great food, great prices.  Wonderful family owned business that takes pride in food quality and presentation.   I wish all restaurants had the same standard.  Worth the drive if you are from out of town and coming from the strip.

XY2G0XcU_iG9YAlDj7OCbg.text: This place rocks!  I stop by every time I visit Las Vegas.  The food is clean and tastes great! Prices are reasonable so you don't feel like your breaking the bank to eat some good Greek food.  They do make everything as you order so sometimes it may take awhile to get your food.  I'd recommend calling in your order if you're going to take-out anyways.

8yvigTIzKv-fy6AdlNwNzA.text: Probably the best gyros I had outside of Chicago. The only downside if I had to pick one would be that they are a little light on the sauce. The portions are generous and the veggies were just right. Their fries are a tad on the expensive side, but their portions more than make up for it. The service and cleanliness is also a big plus. I would definitely go back, but will order extra sauce on the side.

7Vsrjw3bdDWD1RhpGmsLLQ.text: I used to frown when friends would suggest eating greek food.  Till now.. Thanks to Yassou I enjoy greek food. The Lunch Special is a bargain!  Try it! The works and the owner are nice and don't seem to mind being asked question about their food.

350Fo2NVCnr1hor6YithTw.text: First time I had to wait over 20 minutes for a take out order. Even if they gave me a compliment drink for waiting. It was still uncomfortable waiting. Also, another issue after you get home and you find out your order is not exactly what you order is bad. I have came to this restaurant for the last 5 years but have moved to the southwest side of town. I guess being moved for about a year has made the service change. I will think twice about  stopping by and grabbing food on my way home.

shn0u6e2ZCh7vpEFT9Fp5g.text: Best Greek in Las Vegas!  Possibly the best Greek food I've ever had!  Went for the chicken skewers lunch special and it doesn't get any better that. Went back for dinner and was just as good.  Worth the 30 minute drive each way!

90e8lLYDaWtpQT6DWnD7IA.text: The best hands down! We've tried most of the menu all amazing taste, portions, and quality. My husband and I would be in trouble if we lived near by

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The absolute best Greek food!
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vsWuiilp6tARRU4bJJdspw.text: Nothing fancy here, but foods are good, people are friendly, about 20 tables here. I especially like their calamari, rice, and Greek salad. About half an hour drive from The Strip, but it's worth the travel!

10yPstcWLO2AONnLcgG6OQ.text: Indoor/outdoor seating. Authentic Greek food with an authentic Greek vibe. Probably the best Greek salad with lemon herb steak I've ever had. Hummus and grape leaves are a 10/10. Great service as well, everyone has a sense of urgency and very friendly. I'll definitely be back!!

dszit_F9D66euiay1HkNiQ.text: I had just finished my final and was hungry for something other than the burgers and tacos that plague Las Vegas Strip malls.   A quick look on Yelp showed me a highly rated Greek gyros about 10 minutes away. Hell yeah!  I arrive but realize the private parking is on the other side of the building. I parked by McDonald's but it was a 30 second walk to the restaurant.   I was immediately greeted by a friendly staff member who explained what the Greek Fries were and the combos and stuff. The Greek Fries are worth the extra dollar and change. I finished the fries before even touching the gyro. The whole meal was about $12 for a really good gyro (not too soggy, plenty of lamb or whatever meat, fresh lettuce, and onions mmmm), the awesome Greek Fries, and a fountain drink.  The atmosphere is great too. I enjoyed the Greek music and look/cleanliness of the establishment. There's an area outside and a closed off area.  I didn't see the bathrooms but I bet they're clean too.   Overall, really great experience. Excellent staff, good food, and decent prices ($7.89 I think for just the gyro).  I'd definitely come a lot more if I didn't live on the other side of town!

2QAIU1kMf1QlSjb1DaGFLA.text: Wow! This place is a local gem! The food is very fresh and usually cooked to perfection. The chicken is moist and tender, salad tasty and fresh and the pitas are excellent. I did try a piece of Baklava once and it was heaven on earth. This place is even worth a drive out if you're not in proximity. It is located near Summerlin around Buffalo and Charleston. Go see what all the hype is about at this place. You won't be disappointed!

t2sDA1zxR3c5YZlAzfLvYg.text: I ordered a plate and I'm giving it two stars because of the gyro but the spinach pie, rice and salad were bland!  The avgolemono soup was just ok! They put a thickener in it which I definitely did not care for!The service was just ok too! Cashier spoke like he was in a race and the server was not very friendly at all!  I'll come back for a gyro but nothing else!

qIffFAgZAqGMN1qDyP5GnQ.text: I've been coming here since I moved to Vegas, over 10 yrs now. I've tried different items but my Favorite is their Greek Salad, Just Love It!!They always have tasty food and great service. Definitely recommend you try it!

BL3ZB0KwEaHn1fYghr2GOw.text: Food was very good. Had the the lemon herb chicken pita. Very tasty. Lots of flavor. Staff is very friendly.

mQ5lUoykbxrqGz4JI-oaEQ.text: This is our favorite Greek place in the whole city. I love the home-cooked taste of the meats and dessert. Their tzatziki over a warm pita is heavenly. I honestly can't even go into detail about how good the food is. Just go try it!

YnnV3Te1Se8-LyWWMiRGNg.text: My large Greek salad, with lemon chicken, was missing the dressing when I got home and had a hair in it!!! $13 for that!!!

uQb4J20hPN7q9xery3JymQ.text: My son who lives in Summerlin recommended this place while we were visiting. We love Greek food and were happy to try it for lunch. Punch line ... The food was so good and tasty that we have since gone back a second time with in the week, this time with our granddaughter. I had the steak and gyro plate while the wife and gdaughter split the chicken and pork slovaki plate. The portions are big and everything is made after you order, so it's fresh and hot. Service is fast and friendly. Only down side... It's a small place and get be busy at peak eating hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yva76OilCoqpO4C_lZjXmQ.text: Went in for Some Greek food today I walked into the Greek Grill, the girl at front her nose was red as if she had a bad cold it was running and she was wiping her nose with her hand. I decided right then and there I am not eating here cause I don't want her handling my food and going food without gloves  Gross , walked out   Too bad , the menu look great ... But the lack of sanitary practices made our appetites go away

5T40w37Z5dfjAWkyso3UnA.text: Great place for lunch! I was introduced to  Yassou through friends and am so glad I was! Their chicken lunch special can't be beat. One chicken skewer (seasoned and cooked perfectly), rice, side salad (with the best Greek dressing ever) and pita bread w/ a side of tzatziki, all for less than $10. If you're feeling extra hungry, order the Greek fries - you won't be disappointed. Fries with feta, parsley, and I believe a squeeze of lemon (?). Yummy!  Be prepared because they do get very busy during lunchtime, but it's worth it!  They are family owned and nice people. They also own the dry cleaner in the same strip mall (super reasonable prices) so you can kill two birds with one stone!

VZwnGrX_JoGFRBj4p1XQDQ.text: Best Greek food in this part of town. Wife & I have been going here for at least ten years. The father (who cooks) and the son (who takes orders) are always so pleasent. Now to the food, always fresh,abundant, and tasty with reasonable prices. Get here before the noon rush as this place is popular.

zK-5OadD57N2-J5-2QpDPA.text: Being born and raised in Michigan near Detroit Greek town I was spoiled with amazing Greek food. Whenever I'm craving a gyro I come here to Yassous it's pretty good not quite Michigan Greek town good but it's pretty close. Service is excellent greeted right away by the guy that runs the place and he checked on everyone to make sure everything was good! Def my go to place for some chicken souvlaki & gyro

QS0c7glivZAZ9P5hu5WbxA.text: I've been coming here for years. It's the only Greek place in town that I have found is quick and easy and cheap. As for taste, no it's probably not the best I have ever had, but for me, I order the chicken souvlaki plate or greek salad with chicken and I am happy with it consistently. The pita on the salad is very buttery and I believe fried, so not exactly the healthiest, but good. The dressing is excellent and I always ask for it on the side since they tend to go heavy on the dressing. It somehow always seems to be mixed in every time, but when I ask them about it, they say it's the marinade from the chicken that gives it that taste or feel that the dressing was still mixed it, but they say it wasn't. The people working there know us by face now and it always seems to be the same people working, I know the owner is always there, but the other guy might be his son? He is always there too.   The chicken and rice soup is really yummy but sometimes they don't have it, especially over the summer. My hubby orders the steak skewers or gyro and isn't as impressed with this place as I am. Friendly workers, quick food, and affordable is a plus in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad with lemon herb chicken

kqm7KS-dXybv7XbOlOFN2w.text: This is one of the greatest restaurants here in vegas, the food is always excellent and the customer service is outstanding! I highly recommend coming here as often as possible!

Y7VqE62Pw7j66DwfVNFBGQ.text: What a great dining experience! We've driven by many times and always wanted to stop in and today we did! Greek music playing lively bouzouki, the wonderful smells of fresh food cooking and greetings from the staff. The place was hopping with a lunchtime buzz! We had a great meal that arrived in a timely manner and served by a friendly young man. So much food we took some back home with us. On our way out we stopped to refill our drinks and we were graciously thanked by the owner and invited back! What a great place!

6uvUhUGOiiS5Ar1soMk1hA.text: Yum Yum! Delicious, great service, great food. The chicken salad was so good and tasty and the chicken was juicy and lemony. I'll be back soon!

-K00R-qrNW-3tgzbkHcUEQ.text: Food is great. Service is lacking. Girl behind counter all though super nice is pushing retarded. You tell her one thing she does another. I watched it with my own eyes in the 30 minutes I sat in the restaurant.

2dZAsA20rcT1NsIkArb4Wg.text: Why in the world did it take me 2 years to stop and eat there?!!!!  *smacking head*   AWESOME food and best gyros EVER!  The meat is mouth-wateringly delicious and tender and the pita is always very fresh.  We also love their baklava, saganaki (flaming cheese), Greek salads, and humus!  All spectacular!  All their staff is very friendly and always customer oriented.  Not once have I had a problem that wasn't addressed quickly and made right, all with a smile and an apology.  Definitely not the norm in this town!!  The only downside I see to this restaurant is that it's so popular that they need more room!!!  :)

3UfZ-W3mWbAQnLJCm8JtkA.text: Best gyros in town. HANDS DOWN.   I randomly walked in about a year ago to see what it was about. i tried a specialty plate. ehhh. it was alright, but i noticed everyone around me had a gyro. and so i decided that i was going to come here again and try to gyro.  oh man was that a good idea!! i crave gyros from here all the time.  i tried a gyro someplace else, and it wasn't very good.  thats when i truly appreciated how good this small deli-like restaurant was. i don't like the yogurt stuff on it, so i always ask for them to put it on the side. then i have the option of taking a couple bites with it instead of the whole thing.   again, this is a locally owned restaurant. so go support them!

BI7ByluWx-nSvNw9PKQ2DA.text: If you like Greek food this is the place to go awesome food and make sure to try the saganaki!!!!

7J-nOBa5pY8slL5xsPuHNg.text: Love this place!!! We've been here a couple of times and we just can't get enough of the Greek Fries!!! It might just be the best fries in town :) The lemon herb steak pita was soooo good! I'm craving for it right now as I think about it! Hummus is yummy! And of course, the Greek Salad is something we'll be coming back for! What a great place! It is family run and you can tell that they take pride in preparing the freshest and best dish for you!

rPVrgQnJFOX6bHWCIClodQ.text: In a city filled with restaurants catering to nearly every palate with meals prepared by some of the world's finest chefs, Yassou is a find. Simply, an outstanding dining experience! Pita bread and hummus are to die for (great texture with a wonderful hint of lemon). We sampled the Gyro (incredibly flavorful and a generous portion) and the Chicken Souvlaki (great use of spices to enhance and  not overpower the food). BTW, the restaurant is immaculate, the decor is attractive, prices reasonable and you'll experience real attention to detail.  Service is friendly, helpful and responsive. We left in agreement  that Yassou was one of the highlights of our trip to Vegas. When we next return, you can bet it  will top our list of "must-dos".  Dr. William & Patti Urosevich

Dqk-As_6USWr7_nFhT4u2g.text: The food was very good and service great. The portions are not small at all from their appetizers, sandwiches or plates. They have a nice variety too.

VZPgwzvrra-r-TeLGqXh8Q.text: Again...fresh, tasty food.  Don't forget a piece of that scrumptious baklava!!  Best value in town when it comes to Greek.

XxQsCXEATlWiKin51I-iPQ.text: The best Greek food in Las Vegas.  It's nice to see a real family owned and run restaurant where they actually care about the customers.  The staff is always friendly and the food is super tasty.    Our family has been eating there since they opened and the food is consistently great.  The dining room area was recently expanded to allow more diners during busy times.    Go there and try it, you won't be disappointed.  If you are feeling daring, order a Greek coffee and have the owner's son make it.  He makes it perfectly.

berjyaGwkIjR1rOBFXwDnA.text: Been eating here for years. I lived in Vegas from 2006 - 2008 and that was my weekly Saturday go to lunch spot. Every time I go back to Vegas, i must stop in. Peter (the owner) is always friendly and loves to feed me. This food is authentically Greek as it gets. Feels like my grandmother is there cooking for me. I never really liked the "quick service" plastic plates here, because I feel it cheapens the food. Their food deserves fine china. I love it and my wife couldn't stop talking about the salad dressing (this was her first visit). They always do it right. A must eat for a trip to the West side of Vegas....

NvvHOQ5BuwcLf2aTIZmkxQ.text: Solid Greek food.  I preferred their rice to other places in town.  Nice and fluffy without being dry.  The lamb was also nice and moist and nicely seasoned and spiced.   The service was good but it's a walk up counter don't expect table side service.  I would definitely put this over the other places in town.

D5SC_V3aqdzKXcSprSIDBw.text: Great food prepared by Greeks for great prices! What more can you ask for. The moussaka was amazing! Thanks Christian!

X5F9jCllUDJw-WW5AuqjmA.text: Was on my way to Red Rock Canyon when I stumbled across this spot. Don't be fooled by the modern, chain-looking exterior. This is about as authentic a Greek dining experience you'll find (and as someone who lives in NYC, that says a lot)..  I ordered the big fat gyro and rice/greek salad. With a fresh iced tea, the total was $11, a True bargain. Also of note, the staff (from the son at the register to the owner, exactly as you'd picture a Greek chef, working his magic in back, to the pleasant food runners) couldn't have been better.  The food: the gyro literally is big and fat, but the perfect combination of meat (beef & lamb), veggies, tzatziki and feta. It's not too big that you can't pick it up, but literally perfect. A top 5 gyro among the many I've eaten in life. The salad and rice was good, but nothing too special. The Greek fries I saw headed to other tables looked delicious, but you need to draw the line somewhere.  Overall, amazing food, great staff and more. Do yourself a favor and eat here if you're ever nearby!

4vR7dzsfCSvCAVU8tQi3WQ.text: Best Greek food in Vegas had the Gyro plate, Was excellent great portion size pita bread was warm and toasty, came with a salad and rice on the plate lots of meat!!, best i have had yet, wish i would have know about this place sooner, wife has been craving Great Greek food since she was prego. Owner was very friendly, Great customer service A++, Would highly recommend!

LRjOVJg_wNsbAPGi1N418Q.text: This is the best Greek place in Las Vegas, hands down. It would be stellar based on the food alone - not only is it authentic and delicious, but you can tell that someone actually cared about what they were making. On top of that, the staff and service people are always polite, cheerful, kind and courteous. This is honestly the kind of place I could eat every single day and it would never get old. I appreciate these guys and definitely recommend anyone who loves Greek food (or food at all) give it a shot.

OnkB69hZH1Cky3TmWeFpOw.text: Can't believe the negative reviews that I read.........huh???  We must not have eaten at the same place?!?!?!? I consider this place to be far superior to Paymon's and all the other Americanized versions of Greek food that you can find here in town.  As for Lapriel H., that yelped about the man behind the counter was a Will Farrell look-a-like, etc. etc....................if you had read the literature on the wall, you'd have noticed that the man you're referring to is the owner, originally from Cyprus,  and  he spends 14 hours a day there both cooking and interacting with the patrons.  ~I recommend the Big Fat Gyro.......oh my, it's AMAZING!  It's a mixture of lamb and  beef and the meat is sooooooo tender!  The veggies are fresh and crisp and the feta is of a good quality!  The size of this thing resembles its name.......BIG & FAT! ~The Greek fries are fantastic..........a taste of lemon, parsley, salt and feta! ~And lastly, the Baklava.........what!!!!!!  I compare every single piece of Baklava that I eat to my mother's, who in my opinion, still makes the very best, but this was fantastic in so many different ways!  For those people who like Baklava for its traditional flakiness........this will satisfy your taste buds but with quite a twist.  It's covered with a honey sauce that makes it mushy to just the right degree......almost a cake like texture.  I can't describe it, can't put it into words..... ~It's a casual, near fast food type place with a very homey atmosphere!   A+

4KW7GANaagVp9q2lkH9cow.text: Got a lemon herb gyro it was bursting with juices herbs veggies and just plain great we also got a gyro plate with a very flavorful dressing for the salad rice really complemented the gyro meat the tzaziki sauce was very good only complaint is a very small piece of pita needed more

MBWVlo2-_5jqmJV-TTMKaA.text: IMO this is one of the very best Greeks I have ever been to, and I've been to plenty in England and here in Vegas.  Here's what I think makes it stand out:  1) It's a family run business with the owner always on hand to make sure the quality stays perfect and consistent.  Everybody we have dealt with there has been super friendly and makes us feel at home.  2) I know, it's really all about the food.  Well everything we've had here has been great:    Everything is made to order, so when you get the chicken or steak kabob, it's not been sitting around then zapped in the microwave like some places I've been to, instead it's cooked perfectly on the grill, the chicken moist and tasty (I recommend you squeeze a bit of extra lemon on it for a final taste burst), the steak unbelievably tender and cooked about medium rare for a fantastic juicy chunk of meat you'd be happy to find in your best steak house.  The donner kebab is nicely browned on the outside and very tasty; I've been to far too many places where they don't make the effort to brown it before slicing it off, it makes a huge difference to the taste when it's done right.  The rice is super moist and flavorful, I imagine they are cooking it in some sort of broth.  The side salad on the plate has a nice amount of dressing and a good variety of feta, olives (but only a couple), cucumber and onion to go with the lettuce.  The pitas are not home made (there are hundreds of them on display in packages) but they are very yummy, more doughy than the usual thin ones.  If I had one recommendation I'd like the option to have them warmed on the grill.  I think the prices are extremely reasonable considering the large portion size.  Friendly family run business, reasonable prices, great food.  We can't wait to go back.

LaDpKrD28J6_4-I90yIMEQ.text: I was recently fortunate to have been treated to lunch at this restaurant.  It was fantastic. The service was great, the portion size was very good and even if I would had to buy, it was very reasonable. I will definitely go there again.

2Lkub3F9LXOEUuL1Dt8ajQ.text: I am not an expert in Greek food, but what I do know is that this place is delicious!   Boyfriend and I usually get the gyro plate, but we've tried a few different things and no matter what we get its always soooo good and very filling.    I especially like the fluffy bread and the rice they give you with the combos, helps tie all the flavors together. Portions are generous and everything we've tried always has great flavor.   Let's not forget how friendly the people are, especially the man with the glasses who we think is one of the owners. He's always upbeat and welcoming when we come in that I feel very comfortable being there.   I'd recommend this place to anyone who wants to try some delicious Greek food at a reasonable price! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro plate to go

zN3S2d0VDMj98dnyjjjfMA.text: The Greek salad was amazingly FRESH and DELICIOUS!!! Loved the feta cheese! And the hummus and pita bread is to die for!!! The guy who took my order, who I believe is the owner; was so nice and polite! Thank you for an AWESOME experience! Will definitely be back!

hFonfLcLd5kYa3nuEybELA.text: Gyros Heaven for sure. We go at least once a week. Food is off the charts and sometimes the parking is bad like the white Range Rover that took up two parking spaces today at 330PM, but hey, their kids were with them so I did not shame them at the table.  Food? The best. Period.

lQZNM246fLKtjw0dro8Tfg.text: I wasn't even aware Gyros could get that big. Typically, I'm able to finish my lunches without getting a to-go box, but at Yassou is where I met my match. I guess now I have a snack for later. Vegas doesn't have a large choice of Greek establishments but if I were to choose one it would be Yassou. The Big Fat Gyro is pretty much all you need. I will definitely go back to try more items on the menu.

0z54Tc9E830I-_7jf6Qt9w.text: Favorite Greek place, hands down! The quality is amazing!  I've tried practically everything on the menu...all are good.  Don't look any further,  just come here. Spanokopita..a must get. Salads are always fresh, and compliment any of the entrees. Can you say gyros!? Get one..you won't regret it. They've been in business for a while,  and you can see why. Staff is friendly and they really know the menu.  They explain everything, and make recommendations. Love it! So happy we live close by,  and can come whenever.

33u474HF-gXG7f90gGhBuQ.text: Service was professional and courteous PLUS the food was DEEEELICIOUS at a great price!!!!! WILL BE BACK FOR SURE!!!

I2RJh2o_r1wE5W6M55aVXw.text: For Vegas there aren't many great Greek or middle eastern places. This place was awesome. I had the big fat gyro with fries and a drink as a take out order they didn't skimp on the meat and it was delicious. The pita was soft and flavorful. Fast friendly service. Will definitely return. Wish there was one in the north side.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fe61YENenekE4fh5P-AfSw.text: Huge portions, reasonable prices, and it tastes good? What more can you ask for.   I ordered a Greek salad with beef and lamb gyro on top. It was so delicious! My two complaints were that the olives not being pitted. I almost broke my tooth biting into it. My other complaint was that they charged $.50 for some gyro sauce. Which I think should come with it since it kinda was a gyro salad.   My girlfriend ordered a plate and it came with so much food! I loved the pita bread they have here because it's so soft and fluffy! How I like my bread.   Can't wait to come back and try their actual gyros!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek salad with lamb. Very good!

vo9HE2UiBCZwepJ-oFGMTg.text: I decided to check this place out after seeing some great reviews and being the closest Greek restaurant near me. When I walked into Yassou, I was greeted by Greek music and a bunch of Greek memorabilia on the wall. I love that kind of stuff and made me wish I was still in Greece.  I ordered the moussaka and it came with a Greek salad, tzatziki, rice, and pita slices. The moussaka had a huge crispy layer of bechamel at the top, but just a little too much for my liking. It tasted great though. The rice was cooked well and was seasoned great.  The pita was good and I love tzatziki no matter what. Everything to cooked for order and the service was very quick.  I will definitely be back in the future to try some different dishes!

37GN2cXXPTmARPMHj9DUqA.text: Service was great - food came out fast and was amazing. This is already a spot I love and have only been there once. I Will be returning. The dining area was clean - the atmosphere completes the experience.  Gyro plate Greek fries  Pork Loin Pita.... you really can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A single tear of joy came out of my eye when this was delivered to our table.... the Patio was also a good spot. #lunchdate

xxowEUyaBzJzskf2TSbe8Q.text: Poor customer service. Not accepting electronic coupons only to selected groups. Salat didn't have any taste and old

W1HY8mSzAvSuLaxgaL903A.text: I am, by no means, an expert or an avid fan of Greek food so it was an adventure for my mom & I to come here. We certainly do not regret it because we had a fabulous meal together at Yassou!  Customer service was great. Friendly people behind the counter, especially (I'm assuming) one of the owners who served us, asked how our food was and bid us goodbye on our way out.   The food is delicious. My mom had the Tuna Mykonos Pita, I had the Super Lemon Herb Steak Pita & we shared the Greek Fries. Mom loved her super chunky, lemony albacore tuna pita with tomatoes and onions and the magical sauce. Lol. I also had the same condiments and veggies but mine came with seasoned, tender steak bites. The herb and feta cheese-topped fries were crispy and were a great pair to our pitas.  The ambiance of the place is casual and I would expect it to be super packed around rush hour cause it's not a very huge place. I must say too that the place is warm inside, we were a bit sweating while eating our food even when sitting in a shaded table so that was a little uncomfortable. All in all though, we are definitely coming back to try the Gyro and the Rice plates since everyone is raving about them!

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Mykonos Pita
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super Lemon Herb Steak Pita
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Fries

tZdBBBCO_-H4X4DLhDk_Fw.text: My first visit was for lunch and I ordered the chicken souvlaki plate which came with a little bit of salad, the skewers, rice, pita bread and hummus.  It was all really delicious. The chicken was moist and tender and the hummus was smooth and tasty.  I will be returning! Too bad it's not closer to home :-)

feJ7Y9By13qNrtgSTQWWgg.text: How can I express my love for Yassou's?!?!   I love everything I have ever tried there and the staff always makes you feel welcome when you come in.  It almost feels like you are walking into a street cafe in Athens.  OPA!   I have tried a lot of things on the menu and everything is always great.  The meals are all big and will definitely fill you to the brim.  The appetizers are a decent size and easy to share.  The hummus here is really, REALLY good too!  Always a good sign for a Greek joint.    And the gyros....Oh the gyros!  I think they have the best Gyros in town hands down. In fact I often dream about the Big Fat Gyro and always wake up happy just thinking about. If you haven't been yet, go RIGHT NOW and get one, maybe two!  The meat is tender and packed with flavor!  The pita is so soft and fluffy. And the tzatziki sauce is amazing!  Yum, yum, yummy!  So the moral of the story is if you want some great Greek food, get to Yassou's now!

YBSYr52fiSA2khnEwTqVig.text: I've gotten takeout from here a handful of times with the fam. Everyone is alway happy and well fed. I'll update the review when I finally eat in, that's the only reason I'm unable to provide 5 stars at this point. The Big Fat gyro is my fav. And the grape leaves are yummy as well. Everything is always put together well and appears fresh.   Totally worth a try if you're craving Greek!

znjgi4NNS59wcCenByY3sg.text: Fantastic Greek Food!! We tried chicken souvlaki,  gyro and souvlaki plate, hummus plate,  spanakopita and the rice pudding.  Flavors were fantastic, portions ample, and the value was great! Would eat here again and recommend to all my friends.  They don't have falafel, that's really the only downside,  also a slight wait,  but well worth it!

t_4PsxhWm0rBgoh-Tpgt4Q.text: Yassou is my favorite Greek spot to dine in with super reasonable prices. I have tried many Greek joints in Las Vegas and Reno and it is by far the best. Their workers are always really nice and engaging.   I have dined in and gotten take out with both experiences being quick and efficient. My favorites to get are the chicken + steak souvlaki combo and the lemon herb chicken pita. I get the souvlaki combo when I want pita bread and their amazing rice pilaf (best rice pilaf I've ever had by the way). I get the lemon herb chicken pita when I'm craving that flavorful ultra juicy chicken. The chicken pita comes with an extra container of juice, like OKAY I SEE YOU YASSOU!! Serving the extra juices as if it's not ridiculously juicy enough. On top of that, the price point is really good for the large portions they give you.  Yassou never fails to deliver amazing food while still being pretty healthy!

r471LnQmVPKoHKzLqb7OTQ.text: This is THE BEST Greek cafe in Vegas!!  Gyros are huge and flavorful and the tzatziki is amazing. The staff is always friendly  Definitely a must go to! Check it out!

_40L0PiguzeCntIAmxlG0Q.text: We've always enjoy the food here at the Yassou Greek Grill Cafe.  Got the Deluxe gyros & lemon herb chicken... also the Big fat gyro...
