I have no room for the Baklava till later.... also they gave me a big portion of my favorite fries by following them in Instagram! :) this is the place you must go

Bs7Qj9K0QDBXbOUFNDnC7A.text: I've only tried probably about 5 different Greek food places but this has hands down been my #1 FAVORITE! Greek food has never really been my go-to meal but ever since I've tried this place I literally CRAVE it.  My boss introduced me to this place for lunch one day and when I tried I just couldn't get enough. She always orders me the Chicken skewer plate which comes with 2 skewers, rice, Greek salad, pita bread, and hummus. There's not one thing I don't like from that meal-- first off, the chicken is so juicy and flavorful, the rice pairs so well with the chicken, Greek salad is my favorite, and you can never go wrong with pita and hummus. Not only is the food delicious but they aren't greedy with their portions either-- it's a lot of food on that plate and I always end my meal with a happy tummy. I want to try more things on the menu but that chicken skewer plate is sooo good I feel like I just can't steer away from it.  I will for sure be back and I have already been telling most of my friends about this place. I literally had to get this again the next day after trying it for my first time so that my boyfriend try it too.

xysm0NhCXkEB714m39wGsA.text: The food is fantastic, the only gripe I have is that they charge $0.60 for extra tzatziki sauce or feta. I believe if you paid $45 for the meal they should eat the dollar so that the customer can come back again... I guess customer service doesn't exist anymore it's all about the dollar bill

zQlCNGZW-vhEu_AE4rODjg.text: I was in the mood to try something new because Las Vegas has a plethora of foods from cultures all around the world. Having seen the banners around town for a Greek Food Festival, I knew I had to try Greek food!  After doing enough research on Yelp, I decided on Yassou's Greek Grill. Their prices are affordable (~$10 a person) and their menu is easy to understand. It's not complicated, mostly because everything is delicious. My boyfriend and I usually get a gyro plate and a gyro sandwich. The beef and lamb meat is succulent (their lemon herb chicken skewers too), the pitas are warm and soft, the tzatziki sauce is refreshing- but the star (at least for me) is their rice pilaf.  It. Is. To. Die. For. Writing this review actually has me in tears because I don't have rice pilaf in front of me as I'm reminiscing about it. The food here is flavorful and yummy, and as a result has drawn a good amount of attention and a crowd! They can get busy sometimes, but they provide the best service that they can.  Yassou's is definitely a more diner/cafeteria style dining experience, so it's not the place to take a fancy date- but it is DEFINITELY a place for a rocking, delicious date with some authentic food.

kD2NwN8mkCG0BeipB8ptFw.text: UPDATE: I THREW UP AFTER EATING IT The food here is not very good. The "spaghetti" is not spaghetti. It is long thick tube noodles that taste like cardboard and are very bland. The salad just looks on appetizing because the croutons look burnt. The hummus is very runny and hard to stick on the pita bread because it runs off. Also, I ordered it from postmates, and I ordered saganaki which did not come. I am very disappointed by this because saganaki is my favorite Greek food and it was what I was looking forward to. Do not order from here.

In and outdoor seating.  Go to cashier, order and pay for your food, self help your drink (they have fresh brewed iced tea) then wait at your table with your order number for your food arrival.  Easy parking. Dependable.

ZEEgB6pVv9-RRrcBMlg3oQ.text: Awesome place for brunch. I was craving for some salad and yelp gave me this address. The servings are huge. Staff are very friendly and efficient. ZSDCdjT-kyjwTlzBLPfUTg.text: This time we were able to dine in.  Therefore I was able to witness, and be able to provide a nicer review.  I'll say it's better to dine in for the sake of no confusion as to whether they are speaking to you; versus ordering by phone.  Much more charming to have your meal indoors.  Cultural music is played, sorta gives the feel.  Their walls are white and blue as you would find iconic in Greece.  Although it was extremely warm walking in, they turned on the a.c. and it cooled up pretty quickly.  Yassou is busy during lunch hour, and they do work fast.  I saw them brooming up under tables inside and outside, cleaning off tables as guests were through.  Not so spic and span, but average dining areas.  It's great that they have outdoor seating especially right now in November afternoons, Vegas still has pleasantly warm weather, sunny and blue skies.  I'll give yay points for their food being tasty.  We ordered Greek pasta with gyro (spaghetti with brown butter imported mizithra cheese) and a Gyro plate.  They're winners; again a lot of food on one plate and average prices.  Cannot get over their yellow rice - so yummy!!!

m4-IDDg9-xsQIlEaySji7Q.text: Amazing food!! We had lunch here with my family and everything tasted just like in Greece. Authentic, delicious and super nice service. I would highly recommend Yassou Greek Grill Cafe to anyone who is craving some Greek food:)

ykPf4IoHTSLGmUBjAPADbg.text: I frequent this place (pretty much every week). They are extremely consistent, and their super mini combo for lunch is truly delicious. For a nice takeout type Greek place this is a great choice!

aW5C7h1I6HPWaXYvvexkpQ.text: So decided to check out this place after seeing all of the great reviews on Yelp.  I'm a fan of Greek food, despite not having eaten at all of the Mediterranean restaurants in the valley.  For my initial visit, I decided on the Big Fat Gyro combo which included "Greek" fries (garlic and feta) and a fountain soda ($12). Their menu was quite large and encompassed a very nice range of specialties I look forward to checking out on future visits.  I arrived on a Thursday around 11:30 and was greeted by a friendly cashier.  After paying for my order, it magically appeared about 10 minutes later. Opa!!   The gyro was neatly wrapped in foil, and about a third of it was poking out, revealing tasty looking meat topped with tzatziki sauce and feta crumbles.  I was disappointed the meat didn't seem to have very much flavor; typically used to stronger Greek spices and flavors in the gyro meat, this was much more mild.  The pita was decent and definitely not fresh made, as stacks of pre-packaged pitas were displayed 10 high.  Anyway, it was pretty good.  I did notice the owner, Mr Pappas, to be working his tail off preparing nearly every dish himself.  This proud owner only had the assistance of another guy who helped him out when he had a chance.  His red faced determination was evident as he rarely stood still and ensured every dish was prepared as it should be.  Las Vegas needs to continue to support local, hard-working businessmen like Mr Pappas.   Look forward to my next visit when I plan on ordering Souvlaki platter with side of hummus.  Can't wait.

It really hurt my feelings to hear that because I am already self-conscious enough from the baby weight. That was sooo rude of her. She looks like a pathetic ugly old troll but unlike her I wouldn't just straight up tell her that! We came here to eat food, not get insulted!

My favorite is the lemon herb chicken salad   U can see them making your good which is nice of you have some sort of trust issues....  This is defiantly a place I have never had anything bad To say about its amazing and I totally will keep Going and recommending

E8o4nWUK6XNJPJR6SbkEvA.text: I have never written a review in my life. When a business does a good job or a bad job I don't say much either way. However, today I had a really amazing experience that I wanted to share.   I entered the Yassou Grill and was warmly greeted. That was a great start. But not worth reviewing over. Most places greet customers. Still...great start. I'm a district manager of a local business so I take my shop managers out to lunch during visits. At least once a month. This manager recommended that we head to this location. I ordered the gyro and she ordered a gyro salad and also added  a hummus appetizer. Let me tell you...the very best hummus I have ever eaten. Smooth, no over spiced. Just perfect! While I was eating I took some time to look around. Really clean and open atmosphere. Then the sandwich and salad arrived. So so fresh. I have been to so many greek restaurants in Las Vegas but this one was by far the freshest. Wonderful gyro meat, perfectly seasoned sauce. Even the tomatoes were as if that where picked fresh from a garden. The total package. As we left they thanked us for the business and invited us to come back. Really cool. This review may seem over the top. However, please check my account. I never review! I highly recommend this place. Good service, great food, and amazing customer experience.   Thank you Yassou Grill, I'll be back!

fWyAW97Mf5Cm-coDZSBE-A.text: The food here is delicious. In from out of town but would come back regularly if we could.   We ordered the big fat gyro. All the ingredients were fresh and perfectly portioned. The meat wasn't greasy or dry. We also had the Greek fries which tasted like heaven. Definitely recommend those for a side. My husband really enjoyed the baklava for dessert - which was a big piece, enough to share.   The inside is small but clean and charming.   Highly recommend!

VdfnkqX0_-mB9XvOF5t4HA.text: This is our favorite go to restaurant for lunch or ordering out. Their food is always fresh, tasty and delicious. Great service and friendly staff. And very reasonable prices.

jduY2zTFMOshdVwvwtXwBg.text: Very excellent Greek food. I had the Gyros plate and had enough left to take home. Great tasting with real Lamb shaved off of rotisereie , not the brown lunchmeat type. Girlfriend had the Big Gyro sandwhich. Large and filling !! I Tsadziki was great too. Recommended !!

-foGbrQ6Qa683W65oKHbLw.text: My favorite affordable Greek food in Vegas, so satisfying I've never ventured past Yassou. We do the My Big Fat Gyro or Gyro Plate. So much meat! The plate is fun, but the gyro wrap is hands down the best beast you'll wrangle during your work week. They're massive. I find myself picking out slices of meat to pack it smaller. My husband can go to town on it without much of a mess, but he has man hands and a man mouth.   That gyro meat is a shaved beauty, how I'd imagine gyros or shawarma should come off (if you ask a foreigner like me). I'm always prepared to get one bad piece, just one. Maybe a piece of fat or ligament, but nope, hasn't happened yet.   We call ahead and do takeout most of the time, and probably won't change the routine up anytime soon. Can't beat these prices. Cheap greek!

lS2YNLnv1FD3wdMN6U_jqw.text: The best Greek food in Las Vegas. Everything is so fresh. Their Greek fries are delicious.

bXdLPMzy9p8ozNnbIdtCiw.text: Got a gyro plate and loved it. Fantastic service, delicious food, convenient location. Will definitely come again.

ll_f8qWifYSR8rHwVYlhrA.text: The wait time to receive our order was almost FORTY MINUTES for take-out. That long a wait is simply unacceptable. The food was good but certainly not worth that long of a wait. An explanation on why it was taking long could have made the experience more bearable but unfortunately that did not happen. We left disappointed and probably will not return.

ZMh4Z2x-uu7u_8zGEqOARw.text: we discovered this place about a year ago and have always enjoyed the food but today's experience was horrible.  We have put up with the high prices (2 plates & 1 drink always seem to come out to $20+) & super long wait time, (for a FAST food place) but today was the worst.  In order to avoid waiting the usual 15+ minutes I called ahead.  When my husband paid, the cashier got the order wrong that had been given over the phone.  My husband had to correct her a few times in the same transaction.  We thought it was strange we were not given a receipt or a table number.  Over the phone they had told us it would be ready in 10 min but it took 19.  We were once again waiting.  Also, over the phone I had said I was calling in advance to eat there, yet they set up our food in to go boxes - but didn't give us a bag...I don't understand the logic there.  When we got the food both to go boxes had smeared food marks on them - looked very unsanitary & unprofessional, and the order was wrong STILL.  We had been charged $2 for the extra rice my hubby ordered, but it appeared that they simply substituted his salad for a small amount of rice because the salad was missing altogether!  To make it right, they quickly (for once) made a salad to go, but even THAT box had smears of food or whatever on it.  GROSS!  The one good thing about this place is that the food always tastes great, but after this experience we may be looking for a new local Greek place.

9PJgmg_03hR_0CL1Fgom_w.text: I tried this place and loved it.  They make ever to order, and at a reasonable price.  If you are wanting some good greek food this is your place

PdUW0HszVKFhoPRFkT1MxQ.text: The only thing that I could possibly criticize about this place is trying to get there from the east...I've got to make an illegal u-turn on W. Charleston because I come north on Buffalo and make a left onto Charleston....LOL.  Seriously, I discovered this place because my vet is across the parking lot.  It quickly became my favorite Greek places to eat.  Silly me, I always order the Gyro...I've got to try other menu items !!  I'm very picky about what I eat, and Yassou has never let me down.  Family-run business, reasonable prices, excellent food and friendly service where they actually recognize me!  In a city of 2 million people, it's really great to get noticed as a repeat customer.  I won't eat Greek anywhere else...this place is consitantly marvelous & yummy !!!!!

Z8uXSZ76aCxWZSphlXluWA.text: My wife and I luckily stumbled across this while visisting my Dad. All I can say is that it was the best greek meal either of us have had. The chicken was fantastic and the gyros as well. I recommend the beef and chicken kabob. Get the baklava as it is baked fresh (as is all their food) and is made from scratch on site. The owner was very friendly and accomodating.We went back the next day we liked it so mush.  My Dad loved the lemon chicken soup and like everything elseit is made from scratch. I don't know why they do not have a cafe n the strip. All thumbs up from both of us.

dn9i6AlolCvHZNhf9r-u5g.text: First of all, i go to Yassou ALL THE TIME. The reviewers here that say this place is bad either A- Dont know good food or B- Have their own Greek place and want more business. The Big Fat Gyro @ Yassou is not only the best in L.V, it is the best PERIOD. If you want Greek fine dining go to OPA, but if you want a cozy lunch Greek grill, it gets no better than Yassou.

akib_GqXcTePwEZVF1cl8A.text: I have been coming here for years since its first year and the quality is consistently good if not even better now and the portions have never minimized unlike many successful restaurants that get greedy!  For $11 I get a delicious chicken kabob, plenty of Gyro meat, yellow rice, salad, and pita bread...a meal that lasts 2 days and I usually don't even eat leftovers but I look forward to stretching this out! The owner is always appreciative and nice, humble guy =)

tg3fBpLnjn8_QjTrNyWFDQ.text: Honestly the best Greek restaurant I've ever been to. Everyone treats me and whomever I bring with the topmost respect and attentiveness. The food is just plain amazing. Even when I'm full I'm still craving more.   Keep up the great work guys!

xS6CX_9ewSSZTuzthCPWnA.text: Stumbled across this place by accident on a trip out to Suncoast.  It's edible.  This isn't the most delicious or authentic greek food I've ever had, but it isn't terrible.    Wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but also wouldn't tell anyone it's not worth trying at least once.  Overall, just average.

X074KARUWNFo2uIfu7jUjg.text: There is simply no other Greek restaurant in Vegas.  I've had pricier, fancier Greek dining in Vegas and other cities, and frankly, no other restaurant holds up to Yassou's quality.  It's a great place, everything on the menu is great and the waitstaff is wonderfully kind.  If you're ever in need for Greek, Yassou is definitely your best option!

Y5l8y-7yQRt_nlyDP7ccLA.text: Happened to be on this side of town, which for some reason the good Greek restaurants seem to be (I'm Greek, live in Henderson...get with the program people), and happened to stop to have a bite to eat. I'm very glad I did. First of all, the people are very friendly and gave us a sample of the Greek custard dessert they had, which of course we purchased.   My friend and I both got the gyro plate and were both pleased. The beef/lamb was seasoned just right and I loved the salad and rice that the plate comes with. I usually don't eat the rice, but theirs was good. Now for the custard dessert...wow, this was delicious. It was a generous piece that my friend and I shared, warm custard, topped with phyllo and of course, some honey. Highly recommend.   I'm looking forward to going back!

odEDREg2I9FkORXrRNovLw.text: Wow. Yum. Great Greek. This is a casual dining spot, but the flavors and the well prepared meals make you feel as if you're at an upscale Greek place if there is such a thing. I love the chicken-lamb kabob plate. The place is one of my favs and that's no easy feat considering how picky I am.

DUG5vXIJchrg5pOPk2PNdQ.text: OK I really don't wanna oversell it because it takes away the kind of surprise I enjoyed today on my first visit, but in fairness I have to say it was stunning! Almost unbelievably good...as in: I had to pause mid-mouthful to make sure I wasn't dreaming! I got the under $8 lunch special with a chicken and a beef skewer, greek salad, pita and rice (oh the rice! 'wasn't expecting mild mannered little grain like rice to be such a star!) The chef (whom I could see from my seat) even took time out from cutting up fresh cucumber (by hand) to make sure I was enjoying my order. I don't care if you live on the east side, get yer butt to the west side, order some greek food and get happier with each bite. :)

vRlL7VMpEwMoo9VIYPr9Uw.text: This wasn't too bad.  I had the lamb gyro.  Needs a little more flavor some where and thats where the sauce comes in.  I would come back for seconds and try something different.

SGPv3DLW6IKFJQH6ohbCJw.text: :):):) hi I was also there on it happened, I'm a regular here for the past 5 years, I love the food and the staff , it feels like family ... About the overpowering thing the lady exaggerated , it was just a discussion between employes, I know all of them and they are very friendly with customers and between them.               The food is the best in town and overall this is the best restaurant!!!!!!!

MCvoKXjMpqWOTbSz6FvzwQ.text: Tonight I had the Olympic Veggie Pita in my life I ever experienced such a tasty and delicious sandwich. The service was great and the place was clean as a whistle. I would recommend this place to anyone

O1VGFqVtz1PufCzvYF9JGg.text: Best Greek food this side of Athens. Family-owned; they treat customers as they would treat guests at their home for dinner. I have tried almost everything on the menu--it was all great. My favorite is the Super Lemon Herb Chicken Pita. Makes my mouth water just to think about it.

qrIPBHkA9aNXNDDa06MjtA.text: I had the 6 oz herb chicken pita and it was delicious. I also added a Cyprus smoothie (strawberry and mango_ which was quite tasty. I would definitely return.

4kLUHM_sOg8m32RXSu8WQg.text: Their Food is Great and the father and son that run the restaurant are great too. Everything is always fresh and good. I have a special interest because the son got married through my dating service (Interactions Dating). So Yassou keep up the great food.                                                              Elaine

WY5_Y4YjT3MOpoDLQUmgSQ.text: I ate here today with my fiance and baby and we loved it! The food was amazing, the portions were huge, and the service was great. I had the mini souvlaki plate and brought home leftovers. The hummus , sliders, gyro meat were all awesome. I love  salad and theirs was delicious and most importantly, the baklava!! Oh, we loved the greek fries also (they came on the slider plate)! Will for sure be back!! I have been searching for good greek food in vegas, this is hands down, the BEST!

rzmAOktAUGoK6EBl65Pzvw.text: Hands down the best Greek food I have ever had.  Authentic feel, friendly service.  I would make a recommendation of what to get, but it is all amazing and made to order!!!  Can't wait to go back!

xzakvScKVkxSCJyG9IIe_A.text: Three words....Chicken Lunch Special =) Yum! My daughter & I have been here several times, and even though we say we're going to try something new, we always end up ordering the chicken lunch special.  It just taste so good! =) Food is fresh and the staff is friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UdTjfoXIJ6B717L8OTv8-Q.text: This place is fantastic. I tried the saganaki, spanakopita, and the big fat gyro. Everything was delicious. The service was outstanding as well. You won't be disappointed.

hl4UBiU4xtFRREP6fZiXDA.text: Yassou is one of the best places I have been to here in Las Vegas. It is hands down the best Greek spot I have eaten at. The place is very spacious. Staff is friendly. Lots of options to choose from they even have a vegetarian menu. My wife and kids loved and because they at everything usually when we go eat the just pick at it but they at everything because the food is so flavorful every last bite of it.

aPVZQ0IUi_3LIidL_piW2Q.text: AMAZING! I'm from Chicago and its been hard to find a good gyro out in Vegas. Everything on the menu is delicious! Their hummus, gyro, saganaki, all the best! But besides the food the owners are super friendly and nice. We were referred by Pete and while we were there all we saw was him interacting with customers, cooking, helping everyone out, and working hard! For me personally besides the food, good customer service is very important to me. I love small businesses and I prefer going to a family owned place over a chain restaurant. My mom works at a local Walgreen's and had Pete as a customer who told her about his store and that's how we ended up learning about it. While my mom lives in Summerlin i live in Seven Hills and I can honestly say I will make the drive to get take out/dine in again. Its businesses like this that will make it very far :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QsV0TRJXuvHGFWh8Oa_jkA.text: Yum! So glad I live close to this little gem. The gyro meat is some of the best I have had. It was flavorful and moist, and the tzatziki sauce was on point. I chose the chicken souvlaki and gyro meat plate it was around $12. It came with a small salad, rice and warm pita. I didn't care too much for the rice, but not because it was bad, just because I am not a fan of that style of rice. The owner was welcoming and friendly, and I appreciate that he helped out in the kitchen when it got busy to get the orders out quicker.  I can't wait to come back and try some of the other items on the menu.  Yelp 2015 Review #27

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oa97Q7eO_M1dTnnbEt6xiA.text: We stopped here after a trip to the Social Security Office. What a gem of a restaurant. Very clean. Everyone was so friendly. We had the Big Fat Gyro. The menu is so delicious I wanted all of it. I guess that means we'll be back until we have tried everything and we'll have it with the rice pilaf. I highly recommend this place.  I have had some great Greek food in Greek Town in Chicago and this place is as good. It's a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We started with the Greek fries the the owner brought us some rice pilaf. The best rice in the world.
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The big fat gyro. FANTASTIC!

rfd41te0XgvC7PejcdPAjA.text: I absolutely Love this place.  Very friendly and welcoming every time we stop in for the Best Gyros in town!

P87uSGFYttjKpX5s8CVTZA.text: My husband and I both ordered the combo plates with a chicken skewer and a beef skewer. It seemed like they were filling a catering order, so we had to wait a little while. But, the food was worth the wait. I liked how the plate had both rice and flatbread so we could try both. The meat also had good flavor and was juicy.  The man with the Bob Ross hair (the owner?) also came by, gave us a wink, and handed us a free order if feta fries :) They were so good.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will be going back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries topped with feta and parsley. Yummy combination!

23xpHoNzo4hPovatNcORkQ.text: Hummus was lacking in all zest. 3/10  Taramosalata is reminiscent of mayonnaise, with a hint of yogurt. 6/10  Dolmades are zesty and delicious despite being half heartedly wrapped.   10/10  Yassou Gyro is tasty, a great gyro.  9/10  Big Fat Gyro is also tasty with a little kick with the feta cheese.  10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Fat Gyro
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yassou Giro
Photo of Yassou Greek Grill Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus

1c7D4sLLwCXZHqsihrppXQ.text: Enjoyed the food after i finaly got it. Not a very friendly restaurant thoe, watched as an older grey curly haired man was yelling at the employees. Not the way I want to enjoy my dinner.

PGofcDpMPt2tVmX6Z8qzNw.text: Normally I go for the chicken souvlaki plate. Super delicious and have never been disappointed. Today I decided to venture out and tried the Greek pizza with chicken. It is to die for!!! The olives really make this pizza something special.

4sz1Pc5neefZgn0o0mzomw.text: Good food but kitchen and service was disorganized. Gyro sandwiches were delicious. Food 4 star service 2 stars.

NrpBJvz1xSdwjlKpdZvEaA.text: Don't go there Sundays I got so sick I was in the bathroom for 3 hours I got a sandwich and it hardly had any meat inside it was full of sauce

AJE43853KnVaHIpsvUZRQw.text: Wow! This place is amazing whole family visited for the first time today. Tried several different plates and sandwiches everything was amazing. Also highly suggest a smoothie

vLleOjFOtcnuH-eIscU9mA.text: Decent quantity and quality. Combo plates offer a very good deal. Steak was nicely marinated and tender. The gyro meat was terrific. It's cooked on the skewer and shaved as is proper. This is not a flat top grilled gyro. Thank the Greek gods for that. Limitations in my opinion are seating options.

hnPZKeE-tsOUuqxJ3Up61g.text: I typically order for pick up. The service is fine. No complaints there but it doesn't rank highly among some of the other Mediterranean places I like in Vegas i.e. Shish Kabob House  and Market Street Grille. The meats and veggies and rice all seem to be better quality at these other places. They do give pretty good quantity for the price but it's not a place I'd recommend if you have other options nearby.

sFUJ2U38dagxz4XYZZ8FyA.text: This restaurant has the BEST LAMB CHOPS I have ever tasted.  My plate was overflowing.  There is such a personal touch from this single owner business.  I will always go back as everything is always fresh and delicious.  Donna D.

TbB-HiFgEPrvfJgMr5DhkA.text: my favorite greek food in vegas, also very friendly staff & clean eat-in area. win/win. highly recommend.

QNAsy3AvQTGhiQw2xEQz7A.text: What else can I say except it's one of the best gyros you can get in the valley and at a solid price.  The Big Fat Gyro is just that.  They don't skimp on anything the comes in the gyro.  The lamb is well seasoned.  The tzatziki sauce it's refreshing.  Living in NLV, it's always worth the drive to eat here.  You can get the fries either American ( just fries) or Greek (w/feta cheese & herbs) with the meal.

HSKw2oQZLcdLkfYmnIPRuw.text: This place is okay. Food does seem to be bland. My Greek fries seriously had 3 pieces of feta. The beef lamb was also bland. The staff was nice. I will not be back.

2Wgw08xAZp5-Oy8kYnliWQ.text: Yassou's is the place to get good Greek food.   They make amazing Spanakopita (spinach pie) and their lemon buttery rice is delish.   It took about 15  minutes for the food to be served but it was worth the wait. Prices are reasonable, $8 to $9 for a sure-to-fill entree. The staff was friendly and prompt.   Black and white checkered floor tiles, dainty Greek music, and abstract(-ish) paintings on the wall creates a friendly comfortable atmosphere in this little cafe.   If you're trying to fix a Greek craving, this is it.

dRSj6aKt3YXrSUopgU2DZA.text: You definetly get your fill for the price. The flavors here are good but not great. Definetly worth it if you have a craving for Mediterranean and dont want to fix it at home. Not bad though. Will give it another shot when I get another craving. Lol

b0_BAPx5rqiy4Glely5Rxw.text: This place is right around the corner from our house! Lucky us! We eat here at least once a month. I've never had anything I didn't like. Usually get the gyro souvlaki and have plenty of leftovers. Love me some Yassou's!

Qr0ej09GwibbGVa3C1kGbg.text: I've been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience. The owner is engaging and genuinely cares about the food which is refreshing in Vegas. Highly recommended

LQ2yG61pTks-js55CPKKRw.text: I've never had Greek food before this place and this place made me LOVE Greek food. Their gyros and beyond delicious, packed with meat and flavor. Let's not mention the Greek fries, my mouth is watering from just thinking about it and the lemon juice and feta cheese. The entire meal will fill you up for the day so the price is good for a meal this size. This place started my love for Greek food and I'm so glad I lost my Greek food virginity here. It's casual, the staff is very nice, and most importantly, the food is amazing!

bMWR3fi50xywtE8vr1wSWg.text: One of my fav spots for Greek food! Everything here is good! I usually order either the Yassou pita, the spanokopita, chicken/steak souvlaki or any of the plates! I'm happy each time. The yogurt tzatziki sauce is delish! The hummus is great as well. Never disappointed !

mzqMfgjJa86hggm8UmoFCg.text: Pretty good prices on all of the traditional Greek stuff! And I've always had great experiences with people working there. And it's a great deal for the quality and portions!

hvoD0y3V1T_3U7AAMGLOTw.text: Had super high expectations based on the reviews, but food was bland, service was terrible, and we took our food to go and they forgot the grape leaves-the whole reason I got the veggie spreads plate!  Not cool!  Won't return.

DDuoUKsvjQyVCW6nL9Bxlg.text: So So - Greek food... I have had better in smaller joint across town... not bad if you are on their side of town - light fare... Was looking for the Wow factor - did not find it... nothing wrong with the food - just average...  your constant companion,  ~deirdra

0DhBCR7sbHjkNfgybrlrkw.text: This is one of my go to places for gyros. Growing up in Chicago I know what good Greek food is and sadly, Vegas is really lacking in the Greek category. Yassou's does satisfy my gyro craving though every time. The meat is always fresh and the sauce is the perfect consistency. The prices are fair as well. For the quality, definitely worth the price. I just wish it was located closer to me.

jmNlRVI0_B4T_iNsQQRkDg.text: It's a nice clean casual dining experience with very good food and friendly service.  The yummy delights are much tastier than Gyro Time or Market Grille Cafe.  The portion sizes are huge.  I haven't found a meal here that allows room for dessert yet (especially since it's so hard to resist a side of their luscious Greek fries!)...must keep trying.

hBmT9rqZ2xVqDgkmODisfQ.text: The best greek food in Las Vegas!!! I just moved to Nashville and I'm slightly upset they dont have a Yassou's out there. Whenever I come back to town, you better believe I'm stopping by.

8AfJxkJGwyLi0aEyGWnmXw.text: First time for my me and my husband.  I am of Greek decent and this tastes just like Yiayia's cooking. We will be back on our next visit to Las Vegas!

BD-qaWX6XwVxPqA2p4b_mg.text: Stopped by here for lunch with a colleague to grab a bite to eat. First of all, their customer service is TOP NOTCH! As soon as we walked in, the guy behind the register greeted us and chatted with my friend (he's a regular there). He was very polite and went out of his way to make sure I was comfortable and had everything and anything I could have wanted. He was like that with every person who walked in. KUDOS! It seemed like most of the people who came in were regulars, or they treated them that way. I can't say enough nice things about how awesome the service was. Now to the food. I had a Big Fat Gyro Sandwich that was yummy. My only complaint was that it needed more tahini sauce (again, you can never have too much!) but I stole some from my dining partner. It was a great, light meal. I definitely will be back!

AMaEYgN7k91Vpl8PW1L2mw.text: This place is delicious! I go here whenever I visit my sister who lives in LV. I love the greek fries!! Actually, everything I had was great. They don't always have smoothies but with so many other great options, who cares!! Best Greek Food in LV!! Yassou even came out to say hello, he has awesome hair!

_ofjTZzuaLOjtL911Wwb4g.text: It's great here. Friendly staff, delicious food.   The souvlaki combo is my favorite. They also have a mini souvlaki combo, not on the regular menu, but posted by the register. It's still huge.

nJAyEtT_VucGRcOil0Wasg.text: Love it!  Been here well over 20 times, great food and great service.   The mousaka is my favorite dish.

4OueD_-MhLQNvp6izOSpsg.text: Seriously the best Greek food I've ever had. We even had them cater our wedding last year. I have yet to find anything on their menu I don't like. Friendly, delicious and a great place to relax. Perfect first date location.

DvRzMbQVvumlP5P-nupHJg.text: A Greek man once told me "This is the only good Greek food in Las Vegas". I can't say that I've eaten at every Greek place in LV, but I can say that none of the other places I've tried have come close.  Let's start with what to expect, the employees/owners do not seem to be the most service oriented people. Some days they greet you with a hello, other days they convey a sense of "hurry up and order". I would like to go on record as stating that I don't believe this is a bad thing. I don't care if the staff doesn't hug and comfort me in times of need, I just want good food which is exactly what Yassou provides.   Their prices are fair given the quality and size of the plates they serve. I usually end up spending 10-15 dollars a meal. The thing that really sets them apart for me is their meats. Cooked perfectly, not dry, not tough, and definitely not bland.   They offer a few of those "powder from a box" smoothies, not good at all, but again, what really makes this place worth visiting is the food.   For all you folks who feel limited by "doors" and "walls", they have tables outdoors which is a plus.

SRIeIM_d0-pb71fTJprBaw.text: Great food at great price, service though is a bit lacking. The Mini Souvlaki plate was really good chicken and beef were tender  and savory. The Salads are pretty good as well. A good healthy alternative although i would recommend getting the order as a take out instead of dine in. The front of the house is understaffed food on the other hand was excellent.
